weapons.name: Dueling Shield
weapons.description: A "thrusting shield," or combined weapon and shield. Enables the wielder to attack and guard simultaneously. An armament once used in ritual combat performed to honor the Erdtreea custom that had somehow remained within the realm of shadow.

weapons.name: Carian Thrusting Shield
weapons.description: Silver thrusting shield embedded with glintstones. Enables the wielder to attack and guard simultaneously. Once wielded by Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight, during her sole entry into ritual combata demonstration of fidelity to the Erdtree.
weapons.lore:
Silver thrusting shield embedded with glintstones.
Enables the wielder to attack and guard simultaneously.

weapons.name: Dryleaf Arts
weapons.description: A technique for hand-to-hand combat without the aid of a weapon. This martial art combines fist strikes and kicks. The teachings of a group of spiritual seekers known as the Dryleaf Sect, revealed only to those of worthy valor and character. The practice of this martial art marks the dawn of an ascetic's journey.

weapons.name: Dane's Footwork
weapons.description: A technique for hand-to-hand combat without the aid of a weapon. This martial art focuses on kicking techniques. This kick-based martial art is unique to Dane, a Dryleaf and sworn ally of Leda. He acquired these skills by training with the aid of a waterfall; letting the water beat his body, and throwing himself into its basin.

weapons.name: Smithscript Dagger
weapons.description: Dagger engraved with a smithscript. Reduced mass enhances the effects of the smithing arts, allowing this weapon to function as a throwing dagger for all attacks. Once thrown, the dagger instantly reappears in the wielder's hand.
weapons.lore: Dagger engraved with a smithscript.

weapons.name: Backhand Blade
weapons.description: Curved blade wielded with a backhand grip. A type of weapon wielded by hornsent for generations. The style of combat associated with this weapon is marked by spinning slashes and gouging thrust attacks.

weapons.name: Smithscript Cirque
weapons.description: Circular backhand blade engraved with a smithscript. A throwing weapon created through the smithing arts. Execute a strong attack to throw the backhand blade, causing it to fly in a curved trajectory.
weapons.lore:
Circular backhand blade engraved with a smithscript.
A throwing weapon created through the smithing arts.

weapons.name: Curseblade's Cirque
weapons.description: Weapon of the masked Curseblades. Circular backhand blade with wave-like cutting edges, sharpened into points that incite blood loss. Long ago, this was employed by the ascetics who strove to become tutelary deities as a ritualistic object in their self-flagellating dances.
weapons.lore:
Weapon of the masked Curseblades.
Circular backhand blade with wave-like cutting edges, sharpened into points that incite blood loss.

weapons.name: Firespark Perfume Bottle
weapons.description: Perfume bottle remade into a weapon by perfumers of the realm of shadow. Attacks release perfumed powder, producing sparks of fire. The crusade was a violent purge, and the perfumers were not called there to heal.
weapons.lore: Perfume bottle remade into a weapon by perfumers of the realm of shadow.

weapons.name: Chilling Perfume Bottle
weapons.description: Perfume bottle remade into a weapon by perfumers of the realm of shadow. Attacks release perfumed powder, producing an icy chill. From time to time, perfumers set out on journeys to pursue new aromatics and flower gardens.
weapons.lore: Perfume bottle remade into a weapon by perfumers of the realm of shadow.

weapons.name: Frenzyflame Perfume Bottle
weapons.description: Perfume bottle remade into a weapon by perfumers of the realm of shadow. Attacks release perfumed powder, producing frenzied flame. From time to time, perfumers set out on journeys to pursue new aromatics and flower gardens.
weapons.lore: Perfume bottle remade into a weapon by perfumers of the realm of shadow.

weapons.name: Lightning Perfume Bottle
weapons.description: Perfume bottle remade into a weapon by perfumers of the realm of shadow. Attacks release perfumed powder, producing lightning. From time to time, perfumers set out on journeys to pursue new aromatics and flower gardens.
weapons.lore: Perfume bottle remade into a weapon by perfumers of the realm of shadow.

weapons.name: Deadly Poison Perfume Bottle
weapons.description: Perfume bottle customized by Thiollier. Attacks release perfumed powder, producing deadly poison. There are some techniques of the perfuming arts that employ poison. Upon learning of this, Thiollier threw himself into mastering those techniques, and he made them his own.
weapons.lore: Perfume bottle customized by Thiollier.

weapons.name: Red Bear's Claw
weapons.description: Claw of a great red bear wielded without modification by Red Bear, whose name is lost to madness. After killing the great red bear in a blood-soaked bout, he became fascinated by the untainted glory of its naked strength. "I wish to be a bear, no more, and no less

weapons.name: Beast Claw (Weapon)
weapons.description: Weapon in the form of a carnivorous beast's vicious claws. Used to perform bestial slashing attacks uncanny to humankind. An imitation of the esoteric technique of the horned warriors. Those who carry this weapon wield it as though they have been possessed by a savage beast.

weapons.name: Milady
weapons.description: A light greatsword; that is, a sword whose blade matches the length of a greatsword, while being constrained to a minimal weight. Nicknamed after ladies of noble status for its refined appearance. With cultivated form, one can wield this weapon as swiftly as one might a straight sword.

weapons.name: Leda's Sword
weapons.description: Light greatsword with gold inlaid. Weapon of Leda, the Needle Knight. Deals holy damage. Though polished to a mirror sheen, this blade still reeks with the stench of crusted blood that lingers from the cull of her knightly comrades.

weapons.name: Rellana's Twin Blades
weapons.description: Carian light greatsword embedded with blue glintstone. Weapon of Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight. Two swords as a single armament. When two-handing, a straight sword engraved with golden flame will be carried in the left hand. Here, and here alone, were moon and fire ever together.
weapons.lore:
Carian light greatsword embedded with blue glintstone.
Weapon of Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight.

weapons.name: Great Katana
weapons.description: Large katana with a long, heavy blade. A weapon unique to warriors of the Land of Reeds. Designed for aggression, this armament requires the wielder to throw their entire body into swinging it. The slashing attacks of its honed edge incite blood loss.

weapons.name: Dragon-Hunter's Great Katana
weapons.description: Great katana with spines of gravel stone along its blade, wielded by the Ancient Dragon-Man of the Dragon's Pit. Has an anti-dragon effect. Formerly a Dragon Communion warrior, the Ancient Dragon-Man was once arbiter of those worthy to devour the Dreaded One.
weapons.lore:
Great katana with spines of gravel stone along its blade, wielded by the Ancient Dragon-Man of the Dragon's Pit.
Has an anti-dragon effect.

weapons.name: Rakshasa's Great Katana
weapons.description: A great katana with the tempering pattern of its blade forever stained red with blood. Weapon of Rakshasa, who cuts down and devours. A berserker's weapon used to endure enemy attacks and reply with one's full fury. When attacking, the wielder is less likely to stagger from counterattacks, but will also take increased damage.
weapons.lore: A great katana with the tempering pattern of its blade forever stained red with blood. Weapon of Rakshasa, who cuts down and devours.

weapons.name: Dagger
weapons.description: A standard dagger with a straight blade. Though modest in reach and capacity for harm, this weapon is light enough to jab in rapid succession and delivers devastating critical hits.

weapons.name: Parrying Dagger
weapons.description: A knife with curved handguards. Designed to parry, turning foes' attacks against them. For master of combat who anticipate every enemy strike and counter accordingly, this weapon is all they need.
weapons.lore:
A knife with curved handguards.
Designed to parry, turning foes' attacks against them.

weapons.name: Misericorde
weapons.description: Dagger favored by military physicians in white. The pointed blade is hard and sharp, making critical hits especially potent. Medicine is mercy. and mercy upon the battlefield is ruthless. Beware the killers clothed as men of compassion

weapons.name: Great Knife
weapons.description: Large knife with a broad, curved blade. This weapon is designed to slash and rend, inflicting blood loss upon the recipient.

weapons.name: Bloodstained Dagger
weapons.description: Dagger with a bloodstained blade. Afflicts targets with blood loss. As blood darkened the dagger through repeated slashing and stabbing, its blade only grew sharper and harder.
weapons.lore:
Dagger with a bloodstained blade.
Afflicts targets with blood loss.

weapons.name: Erdsteel Dagger
weapons.description: An erdsteel dagger with a grass crest engraved upon its blade. Carried by the Erdtree royalty for self-defense in times of peace. Though forged to a high standard, the weapon is difficult to wield. Attack power also scales with faith.
weapons.lore: An erdsteel dagger with a grass crest engraved upon its blade. Carried by the Erdtree royalty for self-defense in times of peace.

weapons.name: Wakizashi
weapons.description: Short sword with a tempering pattern on the blade. A weapon unique to warriors of the Land of Reeds. Afflicts targets with blood loss. These swords are considered auxiliary weapons. Yet, one man is known to wield this weapon in his left hand while using a full-sized katana in his right. A demonic swordsman known only as Okina.

weapons.name: Celebrant's Sickle
weapons.description: Sickle decorated with flowers and many-coloured fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula. Its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard.Crafted from human bone. Grants trace amounts of runes on landing attacks.
weapons.lore: Sickle decorated with flowers and many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula. Its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard.

weapons.name: Ivory Sickle
weapons.description: Sickle fashioned form ivory. Weapon carried by aged Albunaurics. These weapons are evidence of their dedication to the Haligtree, despite never having entered its presence.

weapons.name: Crystal Knife
weapons.description: A knife made by sharpening hard crystal.Signature weapon of glintstone miners. Used as a tool to extract glintstone from broken rock, and as such a faint magic enwreathes the blade.

weapons.name: Scorpion's Stinger
weapons.description: Dagger fashioned from a great scorpion's tail, glistening with scarlet rot. A ceremonial tool used by heretics, crafted from the relic of a sealed outer god.
weapons.lore: Dagger fashioned from a great scorpion's tail, glistening with scarlet rot.

weapons.name: Cinquedea
weapons.description: Short sword given to high ranking clergymen of Farum Azula. Raises potency of bestial incantations. The design celebrates a beast's five fingers, symbolic of the intelligence once granted upon their kind.

weapons.name: Glintstone Kris
weapons.description: Ritual blade once presented to Leyndell by the Academy of Raya Lucaria to celebrate their newfound peace. Though the weapon is embedded with precious glintstones and features Erdtree ornamentation, the undulating blade is symbolic of an ancient ritual.
weapons.lore: Ritual blade once presented to Leyndell by the Academy of Raya Lucaria to celebrate their newfound peace. Though the weapon is embedded with precious glintstones and features Erdtree ornamentation, the undulating blade is symbolic of an ancient ritual.

weapons.name: Reduvia
weapons.description: Jagged dagger with a distinctive curled blade.Carried by the noble servants of the Lord of Blood. This dagger rips the flesh as it enters, inflicting blood loss with sickening efficacy. A proud testament to the success of its vicious design, this weapon is perpetually coated in blood.

weapons.name: Blade of Calling
weapons.description: Dagger given to one who set out on a journey to fulfill her duty long ago. The power of its former owner, the kindling maiden, is still apparent. The one who walks alongside flame, Shall one day meet the road of Destined Death.
weapons.lore: Dagger given to one who set out on a journey to fulfill her duty long ago. The power of its former owner, the kindling maiden, is still apparent.

weapons.name: Black Knife
weapons.description: Dagger once belonging to one of the assassins who murdered Godwyn the Golden on the Night of the Black Knives. A ritual performed on the oddly misshapen blade imbued it with the power of the stolen Rune of Death.

weapons.name: Main-gauche
weapons.description: Dagger with a large hand guard. Intended to be used in the left hand, thereby complementing a piercing sword or identical blade held in the right to enable a distinctive style of fighting.

weapons.name: Fire Knight's Shortsword
weapons.description: Shortsword used by the Fire Knights. A slender blade that undulates like fire. Blessed with a flame incantation. Further flame imbuement will amplify the effect and greatly increase the armament's power.
weapons.lore:
Shortsword used by the Fire Knights.
A slender blade that undulates like fire.

weapons.name: Short Sword
weapons.description: A short straight sword with a short blade. In addition to its reliable standard damage, this weapon also boasts powerful piercing attacks. Lightweight amongst straight swords, this weapon is easy to wield, requiring only humble attributes.

weapons.name: Longsword
weapons.description: A straight sword with a double-edged blade. In addition to its easily-inflicted standard damage, this well- balanced weapon can also perform powerful piercing attacks.

weapons.name: Broadsword
weapons.description: A straight sword with a wide blade, suited to slashing attacks. Horizontal swings boast wide attack range, making it easier to connect with foes.

weapons.name: Weathered Straight Sword
weapons.description: Straight sword with a rather short but wide blade. Simple to wield, it was known as the sword of the people. Though the Erdtree styling is still visible, time has not been kind to this sword, now merely a shadow of its former self.
weapons.lore:
Straight sword with a rather short but wide blade.
Simple to wield, it was known as the sword of the people.

weapons.name: Lordsworn's Straight Sword
weapons.description: Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army. Though blackened and damaged by years of use, it appears to have otherwise been kept in a servicable condition, despite the soldiers having long since lost their minds.
weapons.lore:
Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious
design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army.

weapons.name: Noble's Slender Sword
weapons.description: Narrow blade carried by wandering nobles.Made to be easy to wield. Daubed with gold from tip to tail, it should fetch a good sum.
weapons.lore:
Narrow blade carried by wandering nobles.
Made to be easy to wield.

weapons.name: Cane Sword
weapons.description: Beloved sword of an aged knight whose last quest was long behindhim, repurposed into a walking stick. The tip is rather worn. Though bent of back and without the brawn required even toraise the sword aloft, still he wished to meet his end with weaponin hand.

weapons.name: Warhawk's Talon
weapons.description: Talon-swords are affixed to the legs of the Stormveil's warhawks, but this one has been repurposed for human use. The blade is thin and lightweight so as not to obstruct the hawk's mobility.
weapons.lore: Talon-swords are affixed to the legs of Stormveil's warhawks, but this one has been repurposed for human use.

weapons.name: Lazuli Glintstone Sword
weapons.description: A sword with a glintstone in its handguards. Wielded by scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus who seek to master Carian sorcery. Deals magic damage. Apparently once used as a staff of sorcery, this sword is made of wood.
weapons.lore:
A sword with a glintstone in its handguards. Wielded by scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus who seek to master Carian sorcery.
Deals magic damage.

weapons.name: Carian Knight's Sword
weapons.description: Straight sword embedded with a blue glintstone. Weapon of knights sworn to Carian royalty. These knights' swords could serve as catalysts, letting them wield sorcerous battle skills. Despite numbering fewer than twenty, this power made them a match for even the champions of gold in battle.
weapons.lore:
Straight sword embedded with a blue glintstone.
Weapon of knights sworn to Carian royalty.

weapons.name: Crystal Sword
weapons.description: Sword fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence. The inscrutable Crystalians have but one clear purpose; to safeguard their crystals unto the end. One theory posits that they yearn for the return of their creator who will carve for them new brethren.

weapons.name: Rotten Crystal Sword
weapons.description: Sword fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human.It festers with scarlet rot. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence.
weapons.lore: Sword fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human.

weapons.name: Miquellan Knight's Sword
weapons.description: Sword forged by servants of Miquella of the Haligtree, with a design modeled after those carried by Carian knights. Instead of glintstone however, amber from the Haligtree is embedded in the blade. A sumptuous piece, yet it has never been offered to any knight an ill-starred sword with no master. Skill: Sacred Blade
weapons.lore: Sword forged by servants of Miquella of the Haligtree, with a design modeled after those carried by Carian knights. Instead of glintstone however, amber from the Haligtree is embedded in the blade.

weapons.name: Ornamental Straight Sword
weapons.description: Slender straight sword patterned after an antique ornament.Superior swordsmen prefer to wield one in each hand. After falling from grace, the dregs of the golden lineage sought power and purpose in the past.
weapons.lore:
Slender straight sword patterned after an antique ornament.
Superior swordsmen prefer to wield one in each hand.

weapons.name: Golden Epitaph
weapons.description: A sword made to commemorate the death of Godwyn the Golden, first of the demigods to die. Infused with the humble prayer of a young boy; "O brother, lord brother, please die a true death."

weapons.name: Sword of St Trina
weapons.description: Silver sword carried by clerics of St. Trina. Inflicts sleep ailment upon foes. St. Trina is an enigmatic figure. Some say she is a comely young girl, others are sure he is a boy. The only certainty is that their appearance was as sudden as their disappearance.
weapons.lore:
Silver sword carried by clerics of St. Trina.
Inflicts sleep ailment upon foes.

weapons.name: Regalia of Eochaid
weapons.description: Treasured sword of Eochaid, a lesser, long-vanished domain. The copper coloration is not to be confused for rust, but is a conduit for its wielder to move it by their will alone. Swords of Eochaid dance through the skies
weapons.lore:
Treasured sword of Eochaid, a lesser, long-vanished domain.
The copper coloration is not to be confused for rust, but is a conduit for its wielder to move it by their will alone.

weapons.name: Coded Sword
weapons.description: Hidden sword once granted to the Tarnished of the Roundtable by the Two Fingers. A formless cipher comprises its blade, which deals holy damage no shield can repel. Champions would gather at the Roundtable Hold in days long past, when the Two Fingers were masters of oration, their flesh yet full of vigor.

weapons.name: Sword of Night and Flame
weapons.description: Storied sword and treasure of Caria Manor.One of the legendary armaments. Astrologers, who preceded the sorcerers, established themselves in mountaintops that nearly touched the sky, and considered the Fire Giants their neighbors.
weapons.lore:
Storied sword and treasure of Caria Manor.
One of the legendary armaments.

weapons.name: Velvet Sword of St Trina
weapons.description: Silver sword of St. Trina, now stained the color of velvet. Inflicts eternal sleep. When St. Trina was abandoned, the faint, light-purple mists coalesced into an intoxicating deep-purple cloud.
weapons.lore:
Silver sword of St. Trina, now stained the color of velvet.
Inflicts eternal sleep.

weapons.name: Stone-Sheathed Sword
weapons.description: A sword that none can pull from its scabbard of cracked stone. Relic of a lost civilization from a time long past, said to have served a ritual purpose at altars of light and darkness.
weapons.lore: A sword that none can pull from its scabbard of cracked stone.

weapons.name: Sword of Light
weapons.description: Sword of light, pulled from its stone scabbard at an altar. From the quick of the root, unswerving rays of light intersect and reflect to give the silver blade form.

weapons.name: Sword of Darkness
weapons.description: Sword of darkness, pulled from its stone scabbard at an altar. From the quick of the root, wandering coils of darkness coalesce and release, their eddies and vortices giving form to the dark blade.
weapons.lore: Sword of darkness, pulled from its stone scabbard at an altar.

weapons.name: Bastard Sword
weapons.description: A large sword with a straight blade.This heavy sword is normally wielded with two hands, but those with sufficient strength can wield it in one alone.The hefty blade can be swung into multiple foes at once thanks to the broad, sweeping attack, making fending off crowds all the easier.

weapons.name: Claymore
weapons.description: A large sword with a long, straight blade. This heavy sword is usually wielded with two hands, but for those with enough strength, one is sufficient. In addition to the heavy sweeping attacks, it can also make a heavy piercing thrust making this a versatile weapon.

weapons.name: Iron Greatsword
weapons.description: Greatsword with a blade of unusually thick steel. A coarse weapon to which polishing is a foreign concept. Weighty even among others of its class, the impact of each strike is sure to be felt.
weapons.lore:
Greatsword with a blade of unusually thick steel.
A coarse weapon to which polishing is a foreign concept.

weapons.name: Lordsworn's Greatsword
weapons.description: Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army. Through blackened and damaged by years of use, it appears to have otherwise been kept in a serviceable condition, despite the soldiers having long since lost their minds.
weapons.lore:
Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious
design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army.

weapons.name: Knight's Greatsword
weapons.description: Greatsword bestowed upon skilled swordsmen in the demigods' service, and yet had no rank or title. Featuring a long grip enabling a dual-handed use, this weapon was designed to dispatch larger foes. Being charged with such a duty was undoubtedly a great honor.
weapons.lore: Greatsword bestowed upon skilled swordsmen in the demigods' service, and yet had no rank or title.

weapons.name: Banished Knight's Greatsword
weapons.description: A finely-crafted greatsword intricately engraved with an ancient motif. G iven to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.
weapons.lore:
A finely-crafted greatsword intricately engraved with an ancient motif.
Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.

weapons.name: Forked Greatsword
weapons.description: Oddly shaped greatsword wielded by imps. The gently undulating forked blade is known as an "imp's tongue" and causes blood loss.
weapons.lore: Oddly shaped greatsword wielded by imps.

weapons.name: Flamberge
weapons.description: Greatsword featuring a flame-like undulation.Shreds enemy flesh, inducing blood loss. Scarlet rot is kept at bay with flame at Redmane Castle, and as such, this beloved sword of Jerren's eventually became the symbol of the castle itself.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Greatsword
weapons.description: Bronze greatsword wielded by Valiant Gargoyles. Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.
weapons.lore: Bronze greatsword wielded by Valiant Gargoyle.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Blackblade
weapons.description: Bronze greatsword wielded by Valiant Gargoyles mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage. Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.
weapons.lore:
Bronze greatsword wielded by Valiant Gargoyle, mended with blackened corpse wax.
Deals holy damage.

weapons.name: Inseparable Sword
weapons.description: Sword forged by compounding silver and gold. A sacred weapon to hunt Those Who Live in Death. Deals holy damage. The inseparable twins found solace in the Golden Order, the only institution not to revile them as accursed beings.
weapons.lore:
Sword forged by compounding silver and gold.
A sacred weapon to hunt Those Who Live in Death.
Deals holy damage.

weapons.name: Sword of Milos
weapons.description: Sinister greatsword fashioned from a giant's backbone. Metes out wounds like a lopsided saw-blade, and restores some FP upon defeating an enemy. Milos was undersized for a giant, and was viewed as sullied and terribly grotesque.

weapons.name: Marais Executioner's Sword
weapons.description: Storied sword of House Marais, the family of executioners who presided over the Shaded Castle. One of the legendary armaments. Elemer of the Briar, the Bell Bearing Hunter, snatched the sword from the site of his looming execution, and furnished it with battle skills from his home of Eochaid..
weapons.lore:
Storied sword of House Marais, the family of executioners who presided over the Shaded Castle.
One of the legendary armaments.

weapons.name: Ordovis's Greatsword
weapons.description: Greatsword of Ordovis, one of the two honored as foremostamong the Crucible Knights. This sword is imbued with an ancient holy essence.Its red tint exemplifies the nature of primordial gold, said to beclose in nature to life itself.
weapons.lore: Greatsword of Ordovis, one of the two honored as foremost among the Crucible Knights.

weapons.name: Alabaster Lord's Sword
weapons.description: Greatsword forged from a blue-white meteoric ore.The blade conceals gravity-manipulating magic. A weapon unique to the Alabaster Lords, a race of ancients withskin of stone who were said to have risen to life when a meteorstruck long ago.
weapons.lore:
Greatsword forged from a blue-white meteoric ore.
The blade conceals gravity-manipulating magic.

weapons.name: Death's Poker
weapons.description: Barbed rod carried by Deathbirds. The birds are graveyard fire keepers; it is said they rake out the ashen remains of the dead from their kilns.

weapons.name: Helphen's Steeple
weapons.description: Greatsword patterned after the black steeple of the Helphen, the lampwood which guides the dead of the spirit world. The lamplight is similar to grace in appearance, only it is said that it can only be seen by those who met their death in battle.
weapons.lore: Greatsword patterned after the black steeple of the Helphen, the lampwood which guides the dead of the spirit world.

weapons.name: Blasphemous Blade
weapons.description: Sacred sword of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy.Remains of the countless heroes he has devoured writhe upon the surface of this blade. Now they share the same blood, bound together as family.Some HP is restored upon defeating an enemy.
weapons.lore:
Sacred sword of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy.
Remains of the countless heroes he has devoured writhe upon the surface of this blade.

weapons.name: Golden Order Greatsword
weapons.description: Greatsword made of light, modeled after the Elden Ring itself. Forged by King Consort Radagon to proudly symbolize the tenets of the Golden Order. One of the legendary armaments. Telltale signs betray that this was once the greatsword bequeathed to him by his first wife, Rennala.
weapons.lore:
Greatsword made of light, modeled after the Elden Ring itself. Forged by King Consort Radagon to proudly
symbolize the tenets of the Golden Order.
One of the legendary armaments.

weapons.name: Dark Moon Greatsword
weapons.description: A Moon Greatsword, bestowed by a Carian queen upon herspouse to honor long-standing tradition.One of the legendary armaments. Ranni's sigil is a full moon, cold and leaden, and this sword is but a beam of its light.
weapons.lore:
A Moon Greatsword, bestowed by a Carian queen upon her spouse to honor long-standing tradition.
One of the legendary armaments.

weapons.name: Sacred Relic Sword
weapons.description: Sword wrought from the remains of a god who should have lived a life eternal. Thoughts on what the weapon portends are many and varied. Some consider it the mark of a great sin, or a sign of great devastation. Some think of it as the end of an age, while others; the beginning.
weapons.lore: Sword wrought from the remains of a god who should have lived a life eternal.

weapons.name: Lizard Greatsword
weapons.description: A peculiar weapon carried by imps. Greatsword smithed in the shape of a fork-tongued lizard. Strong attacks allow the wielder to fire the forked tongue from the blade.
weapons.lore:
A peculiar weapon carried by imps.
Greatsword smithed in the shape of a fork-tongued lizard.

weapons.name: Greatsword of Damnation
weapons.description: Golden greatsword that once pierced the body of Midra, master of the manse. Used by the hornsent in the execution of a damnation like no other. The barbs that pierce the victim from within wind gently around the blade.
weapons.lore: Golden greatsword that once pierced the body of Midra, master of the manse. Used by the hornsent in the execution of a damnation like no other.

weapons.name: Greatsword of Solitude
weapons.description: Steel greatsword wielded by the Knights of the Solitary Gaol. Through a secret rite, they relinquished their hearts for heightened battle prowess. Next, they engraved their blades with two crests: one depicting the light of birth, and the other, solitude.
weapons.lore: Steel greatsword wielded by the Knights of the Solitary Gaol.

weapons.name: Zweihander
weapons.description: Just about the largest sword a mere man is capable of swinging. True to its name, it is designed to be wielded in both hands, but those of merely ordinary strength will still struggle to do so.The long blade is heavy and sharp, sending foes reeling back with its broader strokes, while also capable of a devastating piercing thrust.

weapons.name: Greatsword
weapons.description: A coarse iron lump of an ultra greatsword. Mows down foes by utilizing its incredible weight. Though handling it likely requires the wielder to have surpassed the realm of the merely human, it is precisely for this reason the weapon is used to slaughter even inhuman foes.

weapons.name: Watchdog's Greatsword
weapons.description: Stone greatsword wielded by Erdtree Burial Watchdogs. Though decorated with the watchman's eye, the pupil was taken by graverobbers and is now hollow, leaving this sword a mere lump of stone.
weapons.lore: Stone greatsword wielded by Erdtree Burial Watchdogs.

weapons.name: Troll's Golden Sword
weapons.description: Sword given to the lesser giants who fought for the Erdtree during the War against the Giants long ago. Though the giants have lost their minds, they stay inseparable from their swords that are in sad shapesuch that the gold plating had flaked away.
weapons.lore: Sword given to the giants who fought for the Erdtree during the War against the Giants long ago.

weapons.name: Troll Knight's Sword
weapons.description: Greatsword embedded with a blue glintstone.Weapon of the trolls in service to the royal family of Caria. Called into service when the Queen invoked an oath they swore, the trolls are treated as true knights of Caria, and fight arm in arm with their human comrades.
weapons.lore:
Greatsword embedded with a blue glintstone.
Weapon of the trolls in service to the royal family of Caria. Called into service when the Queen invoked an oath they swore, the trolls are treated as true knights of Caria, and fight arm in arm with their human comrades.

weapons.name: Royal Greatsword
weapons.description: Greatsword decorated in royal Carian Style. Favored weapon of Blaidd the Half-Wolf. In defiance of the fate he was born to, Blaidd swore to serve no master but Ranni. As proof. the sword was imbued with a cold magic at the moment oath was sworn.
weapons.lore:
Greatsword decorated in royal Carian style.
Favored weapon of Blaidd the Half-Wolf.

weapons.name: Grafted Blade Greatsword
weapons.description: The storied sword of Castle Morne. A revenger's weapon, it is burdened with oceans of anger and regret. One of the legendary armaments. A lone surviving champion from a country now vanished was so determined to continue fighting that he claimed the swords of an entire clan of warriors.
weapons.lore:
The storied sword of Castle Morne. A revenger's weapon, it is burdened with oceans of anger and regret.
One of the legendary armaments.

weapons.name: Ruins Greatsword
weapons.description: Originally rubble from a ruin which fell from the sky, this surviving fragment was honed into a weapon.One of the legendary armaments. The ruin it came from crumbled when struck by a meteorite, as such this weapon harbors its destructive power.
weapons.lore:
Originally rubble from a ruin which fell from the sky, this surviving fragment was honed into a weapon.
One of the legendary armaments.

weapons.name: Starscourge Greatsword
weapons.description: Curved greatswords of black steel wielded by General Radahn. A pair of weapons decorated with a lion mane motif. Radahn earned considerable renown as the Starscourge in his youth, and it is said that it was during this time he engraved the gravity crest upon these blades.
weapons.lore:
Curved greatswords of black steel wielded by General Radahn.
A pair of weapons decorated with a lion mane motif.

weapons.name: Godslayer's Greatsword
weapons.description: Sacred sword of the Gloam-Eyed Queen who controlled the Godskin Apostles before her defeat at the hands of Maliketh. The black flames wielded by the apostles are channeled from this sword.
weapons.lore: Sacred sword of the Dusk-Eyed Queen who controlled the Godskin Apostles before her defeat at the hands of Maliketh.

weapons.name: Maliketh's Black Blade
weapons.description: Maliketh's black blade which once harbored the power of theRune of Death. A sad shadow of its former glory. After a fragment of Death was stolen on that fateful night,Maliketh bound the blade within his own flesh, such that nonemight ever rob Death again.
weapons.lore: Maliketh's black blade which once harbored the power of the Rune of Death. A sad shadow of its former glory.

weapons.name: Ancient Meteoric Ore Greatsword
weapons.description: One of the treasures of the ruined forges. Greatsword of ancient meteoric ore, ending in a sharp point. Fashioned from an excavated shard of an arrowhead that once was a part of the old gods' arsenal. A capable piercing weapon that excels at thrusting attacks.
weapons.lore:
One of the treasures of the ruined forges.
Greatsword of ancient meteoric ore, ending in a sharp point.

weapons.name: Fire Knight's Greatsword
weapons.description: Greatsword of the Fire Knights. A long, slender blade that undulates like fire. Blessed with a flame incantation. Further flame imbuement will amplify the effect and greatly increase the armament's power.
weapons.lore:
Greatsword of the Fire Knights.
A long, slender blade that undulates like fire.

weapons.name: Greatsword of Radahn (Light)
weapons.description: Greatswords of black steel wielded by Radahn in his youth. A pair of weapons decorated with a lion mane motif. These were in his possession immediately before his triumph over the starsthe swords of a lord who does not rely on physical strength and gravity alone.

weapons.name: Greatsword of Radahn (Lord)
weapons.description: Greatswords of black steel wielded by Radahn in his youth. A pair of weapons decorated with a lion mane motif. These were in his possession immediately before his triumph over the starsthe swords of a lord who does not rely on physical strength and gravity alone.
weapons.lore:
Greatswords of black steel wielded by Radahn in his youth.
A pair of weapons decorated with a lion mane motif.

weapons.name: Moonrithyll's Knight Sword
weapons.description: Greatsword embedded with a blue glintstone. The favored weapon of the steadfast Carian knight, Moonrithyll. Moonrithyll was the Twin Moon Knight's chamberlain. She was also a friend to the trolls, who served the royal family, and proudly wielded their weapons as she fought arm in arm with her gargantuan comrades.
weapons.lore:
Greatsword embedded with a blue glintstone.
The favored weapon of the steadfast Carian knight, Moonrithyll.

weapons.name: Rapier
weapons.description: A piercing sword with a sharp, slender blade.In addition to this weapon's thrusting attack prowess, it also boasts the ability to be used while guarding with a shield. As one of the smaller piercing swords, quick successive thrust area easy to perform, but without a cutting edge, it cannot be used for slashing attacks.

weapons.name: Estoc
weapons.description: Large piercing sword with a long, hard bladed edge which is also capable of slashing attacks. For its large size, it can be wielded rather nimbly, leaving little opportunity for the enemy to counter.

weapons.name: Noble's Estoc
weapons.description: Estoc carried by wandering nobles. Made to be easy to wield. Daubed with gold from tip to tail, it should fetch a good sum.

weapons.name: Cleanrot Knight's Sword
weapons.description: Piercing sword of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Mainly used as a backup weapon, in combination with a long- handled armament.
weapons.lore: Piercing sword of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

weapons.name: Rogier's Rapier
weapons.description: Piercing sword of superior quality, featuring intricate ornamentation. Signature weapon of the sorcerer Rogier. High dexterity is required to wield the blade to its full potential, but mastery is a sight to behold, characterized by a flowing style which excels in successive attacks.
weapons.lore:
Piercing sword of superior quality, featuring intricate ornamentation.
Signature weapon of the sorcerer Rogier.

weapons.name: Antspur Rapier
weapons.description: Spur of a giant ant which has been fashioned into a rapier. The blade drips with scarlet rot. Scarlet rot is an old legend, of which Maleigh Marais of the Shaded Castle was a private believer. And indeed, he eventually found his own personal goddess.

weapons.name: Frozen Needle
weapons.description: A razor-thin piercing blade of ice.Forged by Ijii, the carian Royal Blackmith. Can inflict frost upon enemies, and launch its blade with a strong attack. The blade immediately regenerates.

weapons.name: Carian Sorcery Sword
weapons.description: One of the Carian royal family's glintstone swords. A smaller piercing sword with a slender blade. Formerly used by the Carian knights of old before the full refinement of their sorcerous combat techniques, this armament functions as a catalyst for glintstone sorcery when executing strong attacks.
weapons.lore:
One of the Carian royal family's glintstone swords.
A smaller piercing sword with a slender blade.
Formerly used by the Carian knights of old before the full refinement of their sorcerous combat techniques, this armament functions as a catalyst for glintstone sorcery when executing strong attacks.

weapons.name: Great Epee
weapons.description: Large rapier featuring a thin, sharp blade. Commonly used in life or death duels.Like its smaller counterparts, its made for thrusting attacks, and can be used while guarding with a shield.

weapons.name: Godskin Stitcher
weapons.description: Elegant piercing sword with a celadon colored blade wielded by Godskin Nobles. The nobles possess skill with the sword unmatched by any lowborn. Despite its size, successive attacks from this weapon are swifter than the eye can follow.
weapons.lore: Elegant piercing sword with a celadon colored blade wielded by Godskin Nobles.

weapons.name: Bloody Helice
weapons.description: Ominous piercing sword with a winding blade. Carried by the noble servants of the Lord of Blood. Designed to bore into flesh, causing severe blood loss at the wound. The extracted blood trickles gracefully down the length of the blade.

weapons.name: Dragon King's Cragblade
weapons.description: Piercing Gravel Stone sword containing primeval lightning. A portion of the Dragonlord's power, gained from a remembrance. This weapon commands great power over the paltry, mortal dragons of today.
weapons.lore:
Piercing Gravel Stone sword containing primeval lightning.
A portion of the Dragonlord's power, gained from a remembrance.

weapons.name: Queelign's Greatsword
weapons.description: Greatsword of the Fire Knight Queelign. A weighty piercing sword with a blade that undulates like fire. Queelign devoted his all to the crusade, and remade his greatsword in the shape of the lance wielded by his liegeaspiring to become a second Impaler.
weapons.lore:
Greatsword of the Fire Knight Queelign.
A weighty piercing sword with a blade that undulates like fire.

weapons.name: Sword Lance
weapons.description: Weapon once wielded by Commander Gaius. A combination of greatsword and lance. Weighty and capable of being brought to bear with great force, this armament shows its true potential when used astride a mount. Gaius himself was never without his boar.

weapons.name: Scimitar
weapons.description: A curved sword with a single-sided blade. Delivers slashing attacks with its sharp blade, but is ineffective against armor and hides covered in tough scales. Smaller in size than most curved swords, it carves into enemies with quick, sharp cuts.

weapons.name: Falchion
weapons.description: A curved sword with a single-sided blade. Delivers slashing attacks with its sharp blade, but is ineffective against thick armor and hides covered in tough scales. Wielders of the weapon employ a unique style that enhances attacks with spinning motions.

weapons.name: Shamshir
weapons.description: Curved sword with a thin blade of ample length. Light of weight despite its larger size, its slicing attacks come in rapid succession. A devastatingly powerful weapon in the hands of a skilled swordsman.

weapons.name: Grossmesser
weapons.description: Curved sword boasting a large blade. This weapon is designed to make use of its weight in combination with its sharp cutting edge. A thoroughly reliable choice of weapon for those who can master its particulars.

weapons.name: Bandit's Curved Sword
weapons.description: Curved sword with a light, crescent-shaped blade. Used by the bandits who ran rampant in the wake of the Shattering. Most of the blade is now darkened and covered in rust, but with enough dexterity this weapon may still stand up to some use.
weapons.lore:
Curved sword with a light, crescent-shaped blade.
Used by the bandits who ran rampant in the wake of the Shattering.

weapons.name: Shotel
weapons.description: Curved sword with a severely hooked blade. Its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard. Made to hunt down humans, this weapon requires high dexterity to wield efficiently.

weapons.name: Scavenger's Curved Sword
weapons.description: Unique curved sword, notched like shark's teeth. Weapon carried by corpse pillagers who prowl the sites of old battles. The blade is tacky with blood and covered in hefty nicks, making it totally uneven. Life can be sinister indeed.
weapons.lore:
Unique curved sword, notched like shark's teeth.
Weapon carried by corpse pillagers who prowl the sites of old battles.

weapons.name: Mantis Blade
weapons.description: A curved sword with a blade at both ends wielded by the Cemetery Shades, the insect-ridden grave keepers. The blade is thin and sharp, and strong attack unleashes a far-reaching slash.

weapons.name: Beastman's Curved Sword
weapons.description: Curved sword forged of dull iron wielded by the beastmen of Farum Azula. The blade is heavy but well-balanced. Comparatively easy to wield for the damage it delivers.
weapons.lore: Curved sword forged of dull iron wielded by the beastmen of Farum Azula.

weapons.name: Flowing Curved Sword
weapons.description: Legends speak of a master of the sword garbed in blue, and his curved blade that was patterned after flowing water. Strong attack unleashes a series of strikes akin to a dance, offering a glimpse into the legend. Skill: Spinning Slash Skill favored by dexterous warriors. Slash foes as your body spins. Additional input allows for a follow-up attack.
weapons.lore: Legends speak of a master of the sword garbed in blue, and his curved blade that was patterned after flowing water.

weapons.name: Serpent-God's Curved Sword
weapons.description: Curved sword fashioned in the image of an ancient serpent deity and tool of a forgotten religion practiced on Mt. Gelmir. Formerly used to offer up sacrifices, this sword restores HP upon slaying an enemy.
weapons.lore: Curved sword fashioned in the image of an ancient serpent deity and tool of a forgotten religion practiced on Mt. Gelmir.

weapons.name: Magma Blade
weapons.description: Curved sword with a blade fashioned from the lava of Mt. Gelmir. An armament of the man-serpents, impossible for a human to have made. Deals fire damage.

weapons.name: Nox Flowing Sword
weapons.description: A grim weapon wielded by swordsmen of the Eternal City, thisshotel has a blade as fine as a needle. Forged from the liquid metal of a Silver Tear, it is thoroughlytempered until hardened
weapons.lore: A grim weapon wielded by swordsmen of the Eternal City, this shotel has a blade as fine as a needle.

weapons.name: Wing of Astel
weapons.description: Sword fashioned from a delicate wing, suffused with the magic ofthe stars.Strong attack unleashes a wave of enchanted light. Crafted from a relic of the Naturalborn of the Void who is said tohave assailed the Eternal City.

weapons.name: Eclipse Shotel
weapons.description: Storied sword and treasure of Castle Sol that depicts an eclipsed sun drained of color. One of the legendary armaments. In Sol, the sight of an eclipse inspires a dreadful awe, preventing an onlooker from averting his gaze.

weapons.name: Spirit Sword
weapons.description: Sharp blade sculpted into a twisted shape. A sword that has seen many years of use in the gravesite. Said to serve as a medium for communion with spirits.

weapons.name: Falx
weapons.description: Curved swords with long, sickle-like blades. A pair of weapons made to be wielded in both hands. Forged by a hornsent in the name of revenge. "In vengeance for the flames, my blade I wield..."

weapons.name: Dancing Blade of Ranah
weapons.description: Decorative swords ablaze with impassioned red. A pair of weapons made to be wielded in both hands. Used by the dancers of Ranah. Strikes enemies with a dancing assault when executing a strong attack.
weapons.lore:
Decorative swords ablaze with impassioned red.
A pair of weapons made to be wielded in both hands.

weapons.name: Horned Warrior's Sword
weapons.description: Curved sword of the horned warriors, keepers of the tower. The ornamental tangled horns allow the blade to serve as a medium for horn-calling.
weapons.lore: Curved sword of the horned warriors, keepers of the tower.

weapons.name: Dismounter
weapons.description: This curved greatsword wielded by the brawny sellswords of Kaiden combines the blades of a scimitar with the heft of a hatchet. A difficult to handle weapon that demands much of the wielder's strength and dexterity, but with practice and ability, it can serve as a versatile weapon even on horseback.

weapons.name: Omen Cleaver
weapons.description: Heavy-bladed curved sword of colossal size awarded to Omen as a tool of war. This weapon is made to take advantage of brute strength. The pattern etched upon the blade is the remnant of a deteriorating malediction. Indeed, when bestowing a weapon, preparations must be made for taking it away.

weapons.name: Monk's Flameblade
weapons.description: Curved sword with a flickering flame motif. Wielded by the Fire Monks who came from the Mountaintops of the Giants. The monks came to the land of Liurnia in pursuit of a fugitive who stole their fire.
weapons.lore:
Curved sword with a flickering flame motif.
Wielded by the Fire Monks who came from the Mountaintops of the Giants.

weapons.name: Beastman's Cleaver
weapons.description: Curved greatsword of colossal size forged of dull iron and wielded by the beastmen of Farum Azula.The blade is incredibly heavy, but well-balanced. Comparatively easy to wield for the damage it delivers. It's clear the beastmen possess knowledge beyond human ken.
weapons.lore: Curved greatsword of colossal size forged of dull iron and wielded by the beastmen of Farum Azula.

weapons.name: Bloodhound's Fang
weapons.description: Curved greatsword with a gently undulating blade wielded by Bloodhound Knights. A fearsome blade capable of brutal airborne attacks.
weapons.lore: Curved greatsword with a gently undulating blade wielded by Bloodhound Knights.

weapons.name: Onyx Lord's Greatsword
weapons.description: Greatsword forged from golden-hued meteoric ore. The blade conceals gravity-manipulating magic. A weapon unique to the Onyx Lords, a race of ancients with skin of stone who were said to have risen to life when a meteor struck long ago.
weapons.lore:
Greatsword forged from golden-hued meteoric ore.
The blade conceals gravity-manipulating magic.

weapons.name: Zamor Curved Sword
weapons.description: Weapon wielded by the knights of Zamor who earned greatrenown during the War against the Giants. In apparent devotion to winter, the curved blade is styled after anicy wind and imbued with a powerful frost effect.
weapons.lore: Weapon wielded by the knights of Zamor who earned great renown during the War against the Giants.

weapons.name: Magma Wyrm's Scalesword
weapons.description: Curved greatsword wielded by Magma Wyrms. The shape resembles a dragon's jaw and is covered in hard scales. It's said these land-bound dragons were once human heroes who partook in dragon communion, a grave transgression for which they were cursed to crawl the earth upon their bellies, shadows of their former selves.
weapons.lore: Curved greatsword wielded by Magma Wyrms. The shape resembles a dragon's jaw and is covered in hard scales.

weapons.name: Morgott's Cursed Sword
weapons.description: Warped blade of shifting hue used by Morgott, the Omen King. The accused blood that Morgott recanted and sealed away reformed into this blade.
weapons.lore: Warped blade of shifting hue used by Morgott, the Omen King.

weapons.name: Horned Warrior's Greatsword
weapons.description: Curved greatsword of the horned warriors, keepers of the tower. A heavy weapon made to bring the deft strength of the warriors to bear. The ornamental tangled horns allow the blade to serve as a medium for horn-calling.
weapons.lore:
Curved greatsword of the horned warriors, keepers of the tower.
A heavy weapon made to bring the deft strength of the warriors to bear.

weapons.name: Freyja's Greatsword
weapons.description: Weapon of Freyja, a Redmane. Greatsword decorated with a mane, much like the weapons used by her liege. The spirit of Freyja's training lingers in this sword, enhancing the power of Redmane battle skills.
weapons.lore:
Weapon of Freyja, a Redmane.
Greatsword decorated with a mane, much like the weapons used by her liege.

weapons.name: Uchigatana
weapons.description: A katana with a long single-edged curved blade. A unique weapon wielded by the samurai from the Land of Reeds. The blade, with its undulating design, boasts extraordinary sharpness, and its slash attacks cause blood loss.

weapons.name: Nagakiba
weapons.description: Katana with a ferociously long blade.Signature weapon of Yura, hunter of Bloody Fingers. Reminiscent of a reinforced spear, its imposing length can be put to good use with powerful thrusting attacks.

weapons.name: Serpentbone Blade
weapons.description: Sinister katana modeled after a serpent bone. The densely packed row of spines that jut away from the cutting edge are coated in a lethal poison.
weapons.lore: Sinister katana modeled after a serpent bone.

weapons.name: Meteoric Ore Blade
weapons.description: Katana forged from meteoric ore to dispatch lifeforms born of falling stars.Deals magic damage.The blade is weighty, known to deliver slashes of such ferocity that the impact is said to resemble the crash of a falling meteor.
weapons.lore:
Katana forged from meteoric ore to dispatch lifeforms born of falling stars.
Deals magic damage.

weapons.name: Moonveil
weapons.description: Katana forged of glintstone.Masterpiece of a Sellian swordsmith. Light enwreathes the blade when sheathed, explaining its Moonveil moniker.

weapons.name: Rivers of Blood
weapons.description: Weapon of Okina, swordsman from the Land of Reeds.A cursed weapon that has felled countless men. When Mohg, the Lord of Blood, first felt Okina's sword, and madness, upon his flesh, he had a proposal, to offer Okina the life of a demon, whose thirst would never go unsated.
weapons.lore:
Weapon of Okina, swordsman from the Land of Reeds.
A cursed weapon that has felled countless men.

weapons.name: Dragonscale Blade
weapons.description: A weapon made by sharpening a Gravel Stone scale, thought to be the source of ancient dragon immortality, into an unclouded blade. Alas, the Dragonkin Soldiers never attained immortality, and perished as decrepit, pale imitations of their skyborn kin.
weapons.lore: A weapon made by sharpening a Gravel Stone scale, thought to be the source of ancient dragon immortality, into an unclouded blade.

weapons.name: Hand of Malenia
weapons.description: Blade built into Malenia's prosthetic arm. Through consecration it is resistant to rot. Malenia's war prosthesis symbolized her victories. Some claim to have seen wings when the weapon was raised aloft; wings of fierce determination that have never known defeat.
weapons.lore:
Blade built into Malenia's prosthetic arm.
Through consecration it is resistant to rot.

weapons.name: Star-Lined Sword
weapons.description: Sword encrusted with a line of stars fashioned from small pieces of crude glintstone. Weapon of the demi-human swordsmen. When bestowed with this weapon by their queen, the swordsmen swear to find the truth that lies at the end of the procession of stars.
weapons.lore:
Sword encrusted with a line of stars fashioned from small pieces of crude glintstone.
Weapon of the demi-human swordsmen.

weapons.name: Sword of Night
weapons.description: Sword of an all-consuming, bottomless black that devours even the light that shines upon it. Wielded by Jolan, Swordhand of Night. The blade of the sword is only semicorporeal, and thus cannot be guarded against completely.

weapons.name: Twinblade
weapons.description: A sword with blades on both sides of the hilt.This weapon is difficult to wield, and requires high dexterity. Can be wielded with a single hand, but its true strength is enabled with dual-handed spinning attacks.

weapons.name: Twinned Knight Swords
weapons.description: An attractive twinblade of fine make that prizes the chivalric way. Can be wielded with a single hand, but its true strength is unlocked with dual-handed spinning attacks.
weapons.lore: An attractive twinblade of fine make that prizes the chivalric way.

weapons.name: Godskin Peeler
weapons.description: Unique twinblade wielded by Godskin Apostles characterized by its disturbing design. One end features a sickle for slicing attacks while the other boasts a winding spike for boring into flesh. Much skill is required to wield this weapon due to its asymmetric nature.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Twinblade
weapons.description: Bronze twinblade wielded by Valiant Gargoyles. Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.
weapons.lore: Bronze twinblade wielded by Valiant Gargoyle.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Black Blades
weapons.description: Bronze twinblade wielded by Valiant Gargoyles, mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage. Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.
weapons.lore:
Bronze twinblade wielded by Valiant Gargoyle, mended with blackened corpse wax.
Deals holy damage.

weapons.name: Eleonora's Poleblade
weapons.description: Twinned naginata forged in the Land of Reeds. Chosen weapon of Eleonora, Violet Bloody Finger. Her mastery of the sword was such that her onslaught was likened to a whirlwind, but now her legacy is stained by accursed blood.
weapons.lore:
Twinned naginata forged in the Land of Reeds.
Chosen weapon of Eleonora, Violet Bloody Finger.

weapons.name: Black Steel Twinblade
weapons.description: Weapon of the Black Knights, servants of Messmer the Impaler. Twinblade of black steel with decorative embellishments in gold. Blessed with an Erdtree incantation. Further holy imbuement will amplify the effect and greatly increase the armament's power.
weapons.lore: Weapon of the Black Knights, servants of Messmer the Impaler. Twinblade of black steel with decorative embellishments in gold.

weapons.name: Euporia
weapons.description: Twinblade symbolizing abundance. The secret treasure of the tower. Though the blades, fashioned from golden shoots, are largely wilted and darkened, their luster can be restored by dealing damage to foes. However, damage dealt to Those Who Live in Death will have no such effect.

weapons.name: Hand Axe
weapons.description: Commonly known as a hatchet, this smaller variety of axe is an everyday work tool. Despite its short reach, it is easy to handle, exceling in successive attacks.

weapons.name: Forked Hatchet
weapons.description: Peculiar hatchet wielded by imps. The gently undulating forked blade is known as an "imp's tongue" and causes blood loss.

weapons.name: Battle Axe
weapons.description: A thick, heavy blade attached to a handle. A versatile, standard weaponCapable of powerful attacks thanks to the weighty blade, these weapons are also regarded for their powerful charge attacks.

weapons.name: Warped Axe
weapons.description: Oversized double-headed axe with a bizarre, almost melted appearance. Brute strength is the only thing required to wield this weapon, which appears to have taken quite the beating itself.

weapons.name: Jawbone Axe
weapons.description: Axe made from a herbivore's skull. Weapon of the ancestral followers who disdain metal. This axe is more of a bludgeon; it forgoes a bladed edge, instead using the beast's molar teeth to buffet foes, dealing strike damage.

weapons.name: Iron Cleaver
weapons.description: Fairly large iron cleaver, commonly used by the maltreated Misbegotten. Steeped in resentment, these weapons are swung wildly and relentlessly, often after rushing up to foes.

weapons.name: Highland Axe
weapons.description: Single-sided axe used by the warriors of the highlands. Brave combatants begin battle by crying out their names. Roars are enhanced by this weapon.

weapons.name: Celebrant's Cleaver
weapons.description: Cleaver decorated with many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village. Crafted from human bone. Grants trace amounts of runes upon landing attacks.
weapons.lore: Cleaver decorated with many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.

weapons.name: Sacrificial Axe
weapons.description: Hatchet used in ancient sacrificial rite. A Deathbird is depicted as a malevolent deity. The power of the rite yet lingers. A small amount of FP is restored upon slaying a foe.

weapons.name: Icerind Hatchet
weapons.description: A hatchet with a frost-coated blade. One of several gifts given by Castle Sol in the distant north. Known as "freezing fog," the blade is thought to be a dragon's scale. Inflicts a powerful frost effect.

weapons.name: Ripple Blade
weapons.description: Unique weapon wielded by young Albinaurics, this sword is modelled after the ripples that are thought to be the origin of their species. Its attack power is greatly enhanced with one's arcane attribute.

weapons.name: Stormhawk Axe
weapons.description: Battle axe designed to resemble a hawk, with its wings comprising the blade. Signature weapon of warriors who strive to remain one with the storm, despite being so far from their place of birth. Their hearts are proud, and thereby easily undone.

weapons.name: Rosus' Axe
weapons.description: Usher of Death, Rosus, who shows the path to the catacombs throughout the Lands Between, is depicted on this ritual axe. The dead easily lose their way, and have always been in sore need of a guiding hand.

weapons.name: Forked-Tongue Hatchet
weapons.description: A peculiar weapon wielded by imps. Hatchet smithed in the shape of a fork-tongued dragon. The gently undulating forked blade is known as an "imp's tongue" and causes blood loss.
weapons.lore:
A peculiar weapon wielded by imps.
Hatchet smithed in the shape of a fork-tongued dragon.

weapons.name: Smithscript Axe
weapons.description: Axe engraved with a smithscript. A throwing weapon created through the smithing arts. Execute a strong attack or jumping strong attack to throw the axe.

weapons.name: Messmer Soldier's Axe
weapons.description: Weapon used by the soldiers who serve Messmer the Impaler. A steel axe, worn from use. A favorite of those who lost themselves utterly in their lord's war. Capable of performing powerful charge attacks.
weapons.lore:
Weapon used by the soldiers who serve Messmer the Impaler.
A steel axe, worn from use.

weapons.name: Death Knight's Twin Axes
weapons.description: Golden war axes of the Death Knight. A pair of weapons made to be wielded in both hands. Crackles with lightning, the power of the capital's ancient dragon cult. The knight, once the personal guard of Godwyn, was also the protector of the Prince of Death's cadaver surrogate.
weapons.lore:
Golden war axes of the Death Knight.
A pair of weapons made to be wielded in both hands.
Crackles with lightning, the power of the capital's ancient dragon cult.

weapons.name: Greataxe
weapons.description: Greataxe akin to a huge lump of iron. Recognized as the weapon of choice of badland chieftains.Too heavy to be wielded by those of merely ordinary strength, blows from this axe will flatten enemies, and the force of its charged attack is a sight to behold.

weapons.name: Crescent Moon Axe
weapons.description: Greataxe with a large, arcing blade and long handle. The "Crescent Moon" of its name is said to have been spurred by nostalgia. Specializes in sweeping through foes by making use of its long handle.
weapons.lore: Greataxe with a large, arcing blade and long handle. The "Crescent Moon" of its name is said to have been spurred by nostalgia.

weapons.name: Longhaft Axe
weapons.description: Large iron axe with a long handle. Weapon of the maltreated Misbegotten. Making use of the force generated by its length, this weapon's resentment-charged blows are difficult to stop.

weapons.name: Executioner's Greataxe
weapons.description: Bulky cleaver welded to a long haft. Said to have been used to dispatch the remnants of defeated armies, felling them like timber. Perhaps that is the reason it excels at critical hits.
weapons.lore: Bulky cleaver welded to a long haft. Said to have been used to dispatch the remnants of defeated armies, felling them like timber.

weapons.name: Great Omenkiller Cleaver
weapons.description: The blade of this huge, loathsome cleaver comprises a row of amputated Omen horns. Weapon of slaughter wielded by Omen killers. The hideous horns cause blood loss, adding vibrant colors to the ongoing mayhem.
weapons.lore: The blade of this huge, loathsome cleaver comprises a row of amputated Omen horns. Weapon of slaughter wielded by Omenkillers.

weapons.name: Rusted Anchor
weapons.description: A rusty anchor wielded as a weapon. Each of its four flukes is thick and sharp, enabling piercing attacks. While the Tarnished left the Lands Between with their Lord, one boat alone was said to have been left behind.

weapons.name: Butchering Knife
weapons.description: Huge carving knife made to cleanly butcher the human body.Signature weapon of the Ogress Anastasia, known to have eatencountless Tarnished while disguised as a Finger Maiden. Restores a very small amount of HP when it squarely strikes an enemy.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Great Axe
weapons.description: Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyles. Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.
weapons.lore: Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyle.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Black Axe
weapons.description: Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyles, mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage. Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.
weapons.lore:
Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyle, mended with blackened corpse wax.
Deals holy damage.

weapons.name: Winged Greathorn
weapons.description: Distinctive horn suffused with the power of ancestral spirits. This large, wing-shaped specimen is wielded as a weapon of spirit worship.In the ancestral spirit-worshipping faith, these are considered envoys' wings, made to reap the lives of beings which experience no sprouting.

weapons.name: Axe of Godrick
weapons.description: Greataxe wielded by Godrick the Grafted. This golden battleaxe is emblazoned with the figure of a beast, representing the strength of Godfrey, First Elden Lord and patriarch of the golden lineage. "I command thee kneel! For I am the lord of all that is golden!"

weapons.name: Putrescence Cleaver
weapons.description: Weapon wielded by the Putrescent Knight. A great cleaver of hardened putrescence affixed to an arch fashioned from human bones. Gains power from the wielder's arcane attribute.
weapons.lore:
Weapon wielded by the Putrescent Knight.
A great cleaver of hardened putrescence affixed to an arch fashioned from human bones.

weapons.name: Death Knight's Longhaft Axe
weapons.description: A long-hafted golden axe wielded by the Death Knight. Bears a representation of a decayed golden ring. Crackles with lightning, the power of the capital's ancient dragon cult. The knight, once the personal guard of Godwyn, was also the protector of the Prince of Death's cadaver surrogate.
weapons.lore:
A long-hafted golden axe wielded by the Death Knight.
Bears a representation of a decayed golden ring.
Crackles with lightning, the power of the capital's ancient dragon cult.
The knight, once the personal guard of Godwyn, was also the protector of the Prince of Death's cadaver surrogate.

weapons.name: Bonny Butchering Knife
weapons.description: Weapon of the greater potentates of Bonny Village. An outsize butcher's cleaver used to dismember human bodies in the making of the great jars stored in the gaols. Restores a very small amount of HP when it squarely strikes an enemy.
weapons.lore:
Weapon of the greater potentates of Bonny Village.
An outsize butcher's cleaver used to dismember human bodies in the making of the great jars stored in the gaols.

weapons.name: Club
weapons.description: A thick, solid lump of wood.Wielding this striking weapon requires no skill. A simple, primitive weapon that requires only brute strength and persistence to hammer your foe into the ground.

weapons.name: Curved Club
weapons.description: Hard, curved club, shaped like a crescent moon. Wielded instead of a curved sword by Albinaurics lacking dexterity. The only point of similarity between the two is the shape.

weapons.name: Spiked Club
weapons.description: A club with beast fangs wrapped around the striking end. The uneven spread of fangs causes blood loss. Given only to the toughest of demi-humans, this weapon is a badge of honor. Or so the demi-humans believe.

weapons.name: Stone Club
weapons.description: Signature weapon of battlemages, hewn from hard glintstone. This club is much heavier than its size suggests, but has no magic power. So that they not lose sight of the true essence of combat, battlemages prefer to feel the impact of their blows, fighting their opponents hand to hand.

weapons.name: Mace
weapons.description: An iron bludgeon with sharp protrusions. Striking attacks have few drawbacks, potent as they are at breaking through guards and stances, Most suited to head on slugging matches.

weapons.name: Morning Star
weapons.description: Battle hammer comprised of a globe attached to a handle. Though a bludgeon dealing strike damage, the appellative star is covered in spikes which cause blood loss. Ironic given its graceful name, this weapon often reeks of blood.

weapons.name: Warpick
weapons.description: Battle hammer with a hard protruding beak. A pickaxe designed for combat, in essence. A simple but highly effective weapon, the weighty piercing attack casually rips through metal armor.

weapons.name: Hammer
weapons.description: Hammer comprised of a large stone affixed to a metal handle.Originally a blacksmith's tool. The art of smithing is said to have originated among the giants.This weapon's striking attacks boast ample weight behind them.

weapons.name: Monk's Flamemace
weapons.description: Battle hammer made to resemble flickering flames. Signature weapon of the Fire Monks, who hail from the Mountaintops of the Giants. The unique strong attack rouses fiery combative spirit.

weapons.name: Varre's Bouquet
weapons.description: A steel mace resembling a charming bouquet of roses. Each petal has a sharpened edge, leaving the roses perpetually colored with blood. This weapon reflects White Mask Varre's manner of speech rather well, enticing in its splendor, but full of deadly consequence.

weapons.name: Envoy's Horn
weapons.description: Golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt. Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.

weapons.name: Nox Flowing Hammer
weapons.description: Mace shaped like a suspended metal droplet wielded by monks of the Eternal City. Forged from liquid metal from a Silver Tear, it is thoroughly tempered until hardened.
weapons.lore: Mace shaped like a suspended metal droplet wielded by monks of the Eternal City.

weapons.name: Ringed Finger
weapons.description: Bludgeon made of an enormous finger sheathed in several heavy rings. Thought to have been cut from an ancestor of the Fingercreeper. Some life yet remains in this legacy of an ancient act of blasphemy, as evidenced by the barely perceptible warmth it still exudes.

weapons.name: Scepter of the All-Knowing
weapons.description: Scepter in the form of a hand grasping a pearl. Signature weaponof Sir Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. The pearl stands for theworld, the heavens, and an eye, representing the many forms ofknowledge, never fully attainable. Even knowing that, the All-Knowing's hand grasps for it.
weapons.lore: Scepter in the form of a hand grasping a pearl. Signature weapon of Sir Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. The pearl stands for the world, the heavens, and an eye, representing the many forms of knowledge, never fully attainable. Even knowing that, the All-Knowing's hand grasps for it.

weapons.name: Marika's Hammer
weapons.description: Stone hammer made in the lands of the Numen, outside the Lands Between. The tool with which Queen Marika shattered the Elden Ring and Radagon attempted to repair it. The hammer partially broke upon shattering the Ring, becoming splintered with rune fragments.

weapons.name: Flowerstone Gavel
weapons.description: Weapon of the Dragon Communion priestess. A dragonstone hammer resembling an ancient flower. The four petals and the flower's core are all sharp, ending in points, and are capable of dealing heavy damage to dragons.
weapons.lore:
Weapon of the Dragon Communion priestess.
A dragonstone hammer resembling an ancient flower.

weapons.name: Flail
weapons.description: Weapon consisting of a bludgeoning head attached to a handle by chain. The iron ball is spiked and induces blood loss. Blows from this weapon cannot be parried. The charge attack whirls the iron ball around for increased force before striking.

weapons.name: Nightrider Flail
weapons.description: A flail with two additional bludgeoning heads. Weapon of the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds. The large spikes make it highly effective at inducing blood loss, but also demand higher dexterity to wield.

weapons.name: Chainlink Flail
weapons.description: A spiked iron tube attached by a chain wielded by Mad Pumpkin Heads. Especially large for a flail, wielding it requires more strength than it does dexterity.

weapons.name: Family Heads
weapons.description: Three bludgeoning copper heads attached to a handle by chains. Signature weapon of Necromancer Garris, the heretical sage.The heads were made to resemble those of his wife and two children.

weapons.name: Bastard's Stars
weapons.description: Flail which deals magic damage, having been imbued with power by the remembrance of Astel. Formed of the same many-colored star debris that comprised the form of the Naturalborn of the Void.

weapons.name: Serpent Flail
weapons.description: A flail with coiled snakes for bludgeoning heads. Fire roars within the snakes' bodies, inflicting horrible burns. Some of Messmer's army used these flails to burn hornsentto brand them with agony and fear.

weapons.name: Large Club
weapons.description: A thick, solid lump of wood. Wielding this striking weapon requires no skill. A simple, primitive weapon that requires only brute strength to swing about.

weapons.name: Curved Great Club
weapons.description: Large curved club of hard wood, shaped like a crescent moon. Wielded by Albinaurics lacking the dexterity demanded by a curved sword, and who prefer the added weight and destructive force.
weapons.lore: Large curved club of hard wood, shaped like a crescent moon.

weapons.name: Great Mace
weapons.description: Huge bludgeon with sharp protrusions. An enlarged version of its smaller cousin. Maintains all the advantages of smaller bludgeons, boasting few deficiencies while being very capable at breaking enemy guards and stances. A shrewd choice for simple slugging matches.

weapons.name: Pickaxe
weapons.description: Large pickaxe designed to crack thick bedrock. Tool of sturdy miners. Not originally designed as a weapon, but very adept at piercing armor. "Little wretches, do you think your armor harder than stone?"

weapons.name: Brick Hammer
weapons.description: Weapon made from an ordinary stone brick. Wielded by a laborer who lead a rebellion, and later become a champion himself. Even among other bludgeons of its size, this weapon is especially weighty. The strength of a giant is required to wield it.

weapons.name: Battle Hammer
weapons.description: Large iron great hammer designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum. Weighty enough to crush armor and its wearer alike.

weapons.name: Rotten Battle Hammer
weapons.description: Large iron great hammer designed for gladiatorial combat, now festering with scarlet rot. Weighty enough to crush armor and its wearer alike. Skill: Braggart's Roar Declare your presence with a boastful roar. Raises attack power, defense, and stamina recovery speed.
weapons.lore: Large iron warhammer designed for gladiatorial combat, now festering with scarlet rot.

weapons.name: Celebrant's Skull
weapons.description: Large bludgeon decorated with flowers and many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village. The striking end is a skull too large in size to be human. Grants trace amounts of runes on landing attacks.
weapons.lore: Large bludgeon decorated with flowers and many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.

weapons.name: Great Stars
weapons.description: Huge bludgeon with three stars at the striking end. Though primarily a striking weapon, the stars' spikes cause blood loss.A blood-stained star is an ill omen, a fact not lost upon those against whom this weapon is brought to bear. Landing attacks slightly restores HP.

weapons.name: Greathorn Hammer
weapons.description: Huge thick horn carved with tree ring-like markings adapted into a bludgeoning weapon. Wielded by ancestral follower warriors. The ancient horn is imbued with the power of ancestral spirits. A small amount of HP is restored upon defeating an enemy.

weapons.name: Envoy's Long Horn
weapons.description: Long golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt. Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.
weapons.lore: Long golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt.

weapons.name: Cranial Vessel Candlestand
weapons.description: Candlestand used in worship of Birac, the most hallowed MonkPrelate of the Giants' Flame. Concerned over the lazy arrogancewith which the monks treated the Flame, Birac severed his ownhead as a lesson to the others, intending it be used as a candlestand. His faith yet smolders from within the cranial vessel.
weapons.lore: Candlestand used in worship of Birac, the most hallowed Monk Prelate of the Giants' Flame. Concerned over the lazy arrogance with which the monks treated the Flame, Birac severed his own head as a lesson to the others, intending it be used as a candlestand. His faith yet smolders from within the cranial vessel.

weapons.name: Beastclaw Greathammer
weapons.description: Greathammer with a striking end modelled to resemble five beastly claws. The black nails protruding from golden fur are said to represent Serosh, Lord of Beasts, who went to become King Godfrey's Regent.
weapons.lore: Greathammer with a striking end modelled to resemble five beastly claws.

weapons.name: Devourer's Scepter
weapons.description: Scepter in the shape of a serpent devouring the world. Thisweapon will one day become the very symbol of the Lord of Blasphemy.One of the legendary armaments. A vision of the future briefly seen by Rykard in his final momentsbefore being devoured by the great serpent.
weapons.lore:
Scepter in the shape of a serpent devouring the world. This weapon will one day become the very symbol of the Lord of Blasphemy.
One of the legendary armaments.

weapons.name: Black Steel Greathammer
weapons.description: Weapon of the Black Knights, servants of Messmer the Impaler. Greathammer of black steel with decorative embellishments in gold. Blessed with an Erdtree incantation. Further holy imbuement will amplify the effect and greatly increase the armament's power. Guard Counters cause a burst of power.
weapons.lore:
