This incantation has been taught to knights of the royal capital for generations, and knights sent on distant expeditions lean on it as a source of courage.
incantations.lore: Skill: Golden Vow
incantations.effect: Increases attack and defense for self and allies
incantations.location: Corpse-Stench Shack, in Mt Gelmir

incantations.name: Great Heal
incantations.description: Superior incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful. Greatly heals HP for the caster and nearby allies. Hold to continue praying and delay activation. The Two Fingers has high hopes for the Tarnished; that even if they should be wounded, even should they fall, they will continue to fight for their duty.
incantations.effect: Greatly Heals HP for self and nearby allies
incantations.location: Sold by Brother Corhyn for 9,000 Runes after he moves to Altus Plateau.

incantations.name: Greyoll's Roar
incantations.description: Superior incantation of Dragon Communion.Channels the power of Greyoll, the Elder Dragon.An incantation of legendary status. Transforms caster into a dragon to emit a terrible roar, reducing the attack power and defense of nearby enemies. Greyoll was the mother of all dragons, dwarfing all who stood before her like a looming mountain.
incantations.lore:
Superior incantation of Dragon Communion.
Channels the power of Greyoll, the Elder Dragon.
An incantation of legendary status.
incantations.effect: Emits the roar of Elder Dragon Greyoll
incantations.location: Can be purchased at the Dragon Communion Altar at the Cathedral of Dragon Communion for Dragon Heart. You need to defeat Greyoll in order to unlock this Incantation.

incantations.name: Gurranq's Beast Claw
incantations.description: Superior incantation taught by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman. Creates beast claws that rend surroundings with shockwaves. Long ago, Gurranq was a beast of such terrifying ferocity that his former name meant "Death of the Demigods." Notes:
incantations.lore: Superior incantation taught by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman.
incantations.effect: Creates beast claws to rend surroundings with shockwaves
incantations.location: Bestial Sanctum: Reward from Gurranq, Beast Clergyman after giving him the eighth Deathroot.

incantations.name: Heal
incantations.description: Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful. Heals HP for the caster and nearby allies.Hold to continue praying and delay activation. The Two Fingers has high hopes for the Tarnished; that even if they should be wounded, even should they fall, they will continue to fight for their duty.
incantations.effect: HealsHPfor you and nearby allies.
incantations.location: Starting equipment for the Prophet ClassPurchase from Brother Corhyn at Roundtable Hold for 1,500 Runes.

incantations.name: Honed Bolt
incantations.description: One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult. Summons a bolt of lightning to strike foes from above.This incantation can be cast repeatedly. Long ago, Godwyn the Golden defeated the ancient dragon Fortissax, and befriended his fallen foe an event that gave rise to the ancient dragon cult in the capital.
incantations.effect: Strikes foe with lightning bolt from above
incantations.location: Purchase from Brother Corhyn or Miriel, Pastor of Vows after giving either the Dragon Cult Prayerbook for 7,000 Runes.

incantations.name: Howl of Shabriri
incantations.description: Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers. Releases a maddening shriek that causes madness buildup in foes nearby. This incantation also causes madness buildup in the caster and makes enemies more likely to target them. It is said that the sickness of the flame of frenzy began with Shabriri, the most reviled man in all history.
incantations.lore: Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers.
incantations.effect: Shrieks, building up madness in nearby foes
incantations.location: A stone tower named Frenzy-Flaming Tower between the Great Lift of Dectus and the Frenzied Flame Village. [Map Link]

incantations.name: Immutable Shield
incantations.description: One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. Enchants shield held in the left hand with the light of regression, increasing all forms of non-physical damage negation and ailment resistance. Two concepts form the basis for Golden Order fundamentalism. One is the law of regression, to which this incantation relates.
incantations.lore: One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
incantations.effect: Increases left-hand shield's affinity/ailment resistance
incantations.location: Purchasable from Brother Corhyn as part of his quest to the west of the Erdtree Sanctuary at the Colosseum overlooking Leyndell for 13,000 Runes.

incantations.name: Inescapable Frenzy
incantations.description: Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers. Causes the yellow flame of frenzy to blaze from the caster's eyes. The caster then latches onto foes, spreading the madness. This incantation also causes buildup of madness in the caster, and is only effective against Tarnished. To gaze into one another's eyes is truly the most intimate form of human contact. Note: Note: Note:
incantations.lore: Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers.
incantations.effect: Latches onto foes to spread madness
incantations.location: Located in Subterranean Shunning-Grounds at Cathedral of the Forsaken Site of Grace just after Mohg, the Omen boss fight; behind the altar in the boss is a hidden path. At the end of the hidden path are a series of drops, and Inescapable Frenzy is towards the very bottom path.

incantations.name: Lansseax's Glaive
incantations.description: Incantation that channels the power of the ancient dragon Lansseax. Creates a red-lightning glaive and sweeps the area from above.This attack unleashes trails of lightning. Lansseax was the sister of Fortissax. It is said that she took the form of a human to commune with the knights as a priestess of the ancient dragon cult. Note:
incantations.lore: Incantation that channels the power of the ancient dragon Lansseax.
incantations.effect: Sweeps from above with red lightning glaive
incantations.location: Dropped by Ancient Dragon Lansseax

incantations.name: Law of Causality
incantations.description: One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. One of the key fundamentals. Manifests a small ring of causality within that allows the caster to automatically retaliate upon receiving a certain number of blows. The fundamentalists describe the Golden Order through the powers of regression and causality. Causality is the pull between meanings; that which links all things in a chain of relation . NOTE:
incantations.lore:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
One of the key fundamentals.
incantations.effect: Retaliates upon receiving a number of blows
incantations.location: Given by Gideon Ofnir after beating Mohg, Lord of Blood and asking about the cocoon in the boss arena.Purchasable at Twin Maiden Husks after defeating Maliketh, the Black Blade.

incantations.name: Law of Regression
incantations.description: Incantation of the Golden Order fundamentalists.One of the key fundamentals. Heals all negative statuses, dispels special effects, and reveals mimicry in all its forms. The fundamentalists describe the Golden Order through the powers of regression and causality. Regression is the pull of meaning; that all things yearn eternally to converge. ,
incantations.lore:
Incantation of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
One of the key fundamentals.
incantations.effect: Heals all ailments and dispels all special effects
incantations.location: Purchase from Brother Corhyn or Miriel, Pastor of Vows after giving either the Golden Order Principia for 10,000 Runes.

incantations.name: Lightning Fortification
incantations.description: Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful. Increases lightning damage negation. This incantation can be cast while in motion. Follow the path that has been set for you, and you will make enemies of all others: the monks, the sorcerers, the ancient dragon knights, and the scions of gold. Heed me the Lands Between offers no welcome to the Tarnished.
incantations.lore: Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.
incantations.effect: Increase lightning damage negation
incantations.location: Sold by Brother Corhyn for 7,500 Runes after he moves to Altus Plateau.

incantations.name: Lightning Spear
incantations.description: One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult. Summons a lightning spear and hurls it before the caster.Charging causes a lightning bolt to strike the point of impact.Long ago, Godwyn the Golden defeated the ancient dragon Fortissax, and befriended his fallen foe an event that gave rise to the ancient dragon cult in the capital. NOTE:
incantations.lore: One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult.
incantations.effect: Hurls lightning spear before caster
incantations.location: Purchase from Brother Corhyn or Miriel, Pastor of Vows after giving either the Dragon Cult Prayerbook for 6,000 Runes.

incantations.name: Lightning Strike
incantations.description: One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult. Summons a bolt of lightning that scatters and spreads around the surrounding area.This incantation can be cast repeatedly. Ancestors of the modern dragons, the ancient dragons had scales of Gravel Stone and wielded lightning as their weapon. It is said that they once attacked Leyndell, the Royal Capital. NOTE:
incantations.lore: One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult.
incantations.effect: Summons lightning bolt that spreads from impact
incantations.location: Weeping Peninsula: Dropped by a Teardrop Scarab

incantations.name: Litany of Proper Death
incantations.description: One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. Used by hunters of Those Who Live in Death. Creates an image of Order, dealing holy damage to nearby foes. This incantation is especially damaging to Those Who Live in Death. Any felled by this incantation cannot be revived. The role of the hunters is to stamp out defiled reason all for the perfection of the Golden Order.
incantations.lore:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
Used by hunters of Those Who Live in Death.
incantations.effect: Creates image of Order to deal holy damage
incantations.location: Can be purchased from D, Hunter of The Dead for 2,500 RunesCan be purchased from Twin Maiden Husks at the Roundtable Hold after giving them D's Bell Bearing

incantations.name: Lord's Aid
incantations.description: Incantation bestowed by the Two Fingers upon the Tarnished deemed worthy of becoming a lord. Alleviates buildup of poison, blood loss, and sleep for the caster and nearby allies. Additionally, cures poison. Hold to continue praying and delay activation.
incantations.effect: Alleviates poison/ blood loss/ sleep buildup for self/ allies
incantations.location: Purchase from Brother Corhyn or Miriel, Pastor of Vows after giving either the Two Fingers' Prayerbook for 2,500 Runes.

incantations.name: Lord's Divine Fortification
incantations.description: Incantation taught to Gideon the All-Knowing by the Two Fingers. Greatly increases holy damage negation for the caster and nearby allies. Hold to continue praying and delay activation. Gideon gained true knowledge after his long exchange with the Two Fingers - discovering all had been broken long ago; that the trembling fingers, bent with age, and the Erdtree itself, were no exception.
incantations.lore: Incantation taught to Gideon the All-Knowing by the Two Fingers.
incantations.effect: Greatly increases holy damage negation incl. allies
incantations.location: Received from Gideon Ofnir after defeating Malenia, Blade of Miquella.Purchasable at Twin Maiden Husks after defeating Maliketh, the Black Blade.

incantations.name: Lord's Heal
incantations.description: Incantation bestowed by the Two Fingers upon the Tarnished deemed worthy of becoming a lord. Heals a massive amount of HP for the caster and nearby allies. Hold to continue praying and delay activation. Tarnished - O, Tarnished! Seek the Erdtree and stand before Marika, its Queen. Become the Elden Lord!
incantations.lore: Incantation bestowed by the Two Fingers upon the Tarnished deemed worthy of becoming a lord.
incantations.effect: Massively heals HP for self and nearby allies
incantations.location: Purchase from Brother Corhyn or Miriel, Pastor of Vows after giving either the Two Fingers' Prayerbook for 8,000 Runes.

incantations.name: Magic Fortification
incantations.description: Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful. Increases magic damage negation.This incantation can be cast while in motion. Follow the path that has been set for you, and you will make enemies of all others: the monks, the sorcerers, the ancient dragon knights, and the scions of gold. Heed me the Lands Between offers no welcome to the Tarnished.
incantations.lore: Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.
incantations.effect: Increases magic damage negation
incantations.location: Can be purchased from Brother Corhyn for 3,500 Runes.

incantations.name: Magma Breath
incantations.description: One of the incantations of Dragon Communion. Transforms caster into a wyrm to spew magma breath. Allows one follow-up attack. Those who have performed the Dragon Communion will find their humanity slowly slipping away. Once they fully succumb to their fate, they are left no more than wyrms that crawl the earth.
incantations.lore: One of the incantations of Dragon Communion.
incantations.effect: Channels wyrm to spew magma breath
incantations.location: Can be purchased at the Dragon Communion Altar at the Cathedral of Dragon Communion for 1 Dragon Heart after killing the Magma Wyrm located southwest of the Seethewater Terminus grace in Mt. Gelmir.

incantations.name: Noble Presence
incantations.description: Ancient power of the Godskin Nobles. Thrust out belly with gusto to produce a shockwave that knocks back nearby foes. Charging enhances potency, knocking enemies into the air. Once a sign of the gods' wrath, this incantation became a trophy of the Nobles' god hunt.
incantations.lore: Ancient power of the Godskin Nobles.
incantations.effect: Thrust out belly with gusto to unleash repelling shockwave
incantations.location: Acquired from defeating the Godskin Noble at the Volcano Manor

incantations.name: O, Flame!
incantations.description: Incantation of the Fire Monks. Momentarily sparks roaring flame from the caster's hand.Charging enhances potency. The Giants' Flame still smolders upon the distant northernmountaintop, and the Fire Monks are its guardians.
incantations.effect: Momentarily sparks roaring flame from hand
incantations.location: Purchase from Brother Corhyn or Miriel, Pastor of Vows after giving the Fire Monks' Prayerbook for 6,000 Runes.

incantations.name: Order Healing
incantations.description: One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. Used by hunters of Those Who Live in Death. Alleviates death blight buildup. The noble Goldmask lamented what had become of the hunters. How easy it is for learning and learnedness to be reduced to the ravings of fanatics; all the good and the great wanted, in their foolishness, was an absolute evil to contend with. Does such a notion exist in the fundamentals of Order?
incantations.lore:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
Used by hunters of Those Who Live in Death.
incantations.effect: Alleviates death blight buildup
incantations.location: Dropped by a Teardrop Scarab found in the Siofra Aqueduct.

incantations.name: Order's Blade
incantations.description: One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. Used by hunters of Those Who Live in Death. Enchants armament held in the right hand with holy-affinity attacks. This incantation is especially damaging to Those Who Live in Death. Any felled by this incantation cannot be revived. The role of the hunters is to stamp out defiled reason - all for the perfection of the Golden Order.
incantations.lore:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
Used by hunters of Those Who Live in Death.
incantations.effect: Enchants right-hand armament with holy damage
incantations.location: Can be purchased from D, Hunter of The Dead for 3,000 Runes.Can be purchased from Twin Maiden Husks at the Roundtable Hold after giving them D's Bell Bearing

incantations.name: Pest Threads
incantations.description: Incantation of the servants of rot. Secretes countless sticky threads, launching them forwards. A technique of the pale pests who crawl through the lands afflicted by scarlet rot; the abandoned children of the goddess. "Do you have an interest in rot incantations?"
incantations.lore: Incantation of the servants of rot.
incantations.effect: Launches countless sticky threads before caster
incantations.location: Can be purchased from Gowry after progressing in Millicent's questline for 7,500 Runes.

incantations.name: Placidusax's Ruin
incantations.description: Power gleaned form the remembrance of Dragonlord Placidusax. Transforms caster into the Dragonlord to spew golden breath from above. This incantation can be cast while jumping. These are the dying wails of the Dragonlord who once dwelled eternal beyond time.
incantations.lore: Power gleaned from the remembrance of Dragonlord Placidusax.
incantations.effect: Spews golden breath of Dragonlord Placidusax
incantations.location: Trade Remembrance of the Dragonlord with Enia at Roundtable Hold.

incantations.name: Poison Armament
incantations.description: Incantation of the servants of rot. Enchants armament held in the right hand with poison.This incantation can be cast while in motion. Those who dwell within poison know rot all too well. The death that begets life, that comes to all equally. That is to say: it is the cycle of rebirth put into practice. NOTE:
incantations.lore: Incantation of the servants of rot.
incantations.effect: Enchants right-hand armament with poison
incantations.location: Dropped by an invisible scarab beetle on the northeastern shore of the Aeonia Swamp in Caelid, just northwest of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.

incantations.name: Poison Mist
incantations.description: Incantation of the servants of rot. Releases a poisonous mist before the caster.This incantation can be cast while in motion. Those who dwell within poison know rot all too well. The death that begets life, that comes to all equally. That is to say: it is the cycle of rebirth put into practice.
incantations.lore: Incantation of the servants of rot.
incantations.effect: Releases poison mist before caster
incantations.location: Weeping Peninsula: Dropped by a Teardrop Scarab in a forested area southeast of the Castle Morne Rampart Site of Grace.

incantations.name: Protection of the Erdtree
incantations.description: A superior incantation of Erdtree Worship. Increase damage negation for all affinities except physical, for both the caster and nearby allies.Hold to continue praying and delay activation. In the beginning, everything was in opposition to the Erdtree. But through countless victories in war, it became the embodiment of Order.
incantations.lore: A superior incantation of Erdtree Worship.
incantations.effect: Increases affinity damage negation for self & allies
incantations.location: Dropped by an incantation scarab found on a stone platform slightly east of Goldmask's first location, in Altus Plateau.

incantations.name: Radagon's Rings of Light
incantations.description: One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. A gift of gratitude to the young Miquella from his father, Radagon. Produces a golden ring of light and fires it across a wide area. Charging enhances range. And yet, the young Miquella abandoned fundamentalism, for it could do nothing to treat Malenia's accursed rot. This was the beginning of unalloyed gold. Notes:
incantations.lore:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
A gift of gratitude to the young Miquella from his father, Radagon.
incantations.effect: Creates golden ring of light to attack wide area
incantations.location: Purchase from Brother Corhyn or Miriel, Pastor of Vows after giving either the Golden Order Principia for 7,500 Runes.

incantations.name: Rejection
incantations.description: Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful. Produces a shockwave that knocks back nearby foes. Charging increases the size of the shockwave. Hark, Tarnished! If you truly walk in faith, you must be prepared to reject all else. NOTE:
incantations.effect: Produces a shockwave that pushes away foes.
incantations.location: Can be purchased from Brother Corhyn at the Roundtable Hold for 1,500 Runes.

incantations.name: Rotten Breath
incantations.description: One of the incantations of Dragon Communion. Transforms caster into a dragon to spew scarlet rot breath.Charging extends duration. Those extraordinary individuals who perpetuate DragonCommunion are called the dragon-hearted. NOTE
incantations.lore: One of the incantations of Dragon Communion.
incantations.effect: Channels dragon to spew scarlet rot breath
incantations.location: Can be purchased at the Dragon Communion Altar at the Cathedral of Dragon Communion for 1 Dragon Heart

incantations.name: Scarlet Aeonia
incantations.description: Technique of Malenia, the Goddess of Rot. Creates a gigantic flower that blooms into an explosion of scarlet rot. Each time the scarlet flower blooms, Malenia's rot advances. It has bloomed twice already. With the third bloom, she will become a rue goddess.
incantations.lore: Technique of Malenia, the Goddess of Rot.
incantations.effect: Creates a giant flower that explodes with scarlet rot
incantations.location: Trade Remembrance of the Rot Goddess with Enia at Roundtable Hold.

incantations.name: Scouring Black Flame
incantations.description: A black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles.Sweeps a wide area before the caster with black flame.Charging enhances range.The black flame could once slay gods. But when Maliketh sealed Destined Death, the true power of the black flame was lost. Notes:
incantations.lore: A black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles.
incantations.effect: Sweeps area before caster with black flame
incantations.location: Dropped by Godskin Apostle.

incantations.name: Shadow Bait
incantations.description: Incantation of the Two Fingers' servants, who once served as the assassins of the Roundtable Hold. Creates a pale gold shadow before the caster, luring foes of human build and attracting their aggression. This incantation can be cast while in motion or crouching, and will still affect foes that are already in a combat state. It is said that those beguiled by the shadow see within it a hated foe. (this list is not exhaustive, feel free to contribute)
incantations.lore: Incantation of the Two Fingers' servants, who once served as the assassins of the Roundtable Hold.
incantations.effect: Creates shadow that lures the aggression of foes of human build
incantations.location: Can be found on a corpse at Subterranean Shunning-Grounds, after going through the pipe room to a room with the corpse sitting at the center, next to a not very well hidden Ogre ready to strike.

incantations.name: Smarag's Glintstone Breath
incantations.description: Superior incantation of Dragon Communion. Channels the power of Smarag, the Glintstone Dragon. Transforms caster into a dragon to spew magic breath from above. Charging extends duration. This incantation can be used while jumping. Smarag was a devourer of sorcerers, and over time, his body became corrupted by their glintstones.
incantations.lore:
Superior incantation of Dragon Communion.
Channels the power of Smarag, the Glintstone Dragon.
incantations.effect: Spews magic breath of Glintstone Dragon Smarag from above
incantations.location: Can be purchased at the Dragon Communion Altar at the Cathedral of Dragon Communion in Caelid for 2 Dragon Hearts. Glintstone Dragon Smarag must first be defeated in order to unlock this Incantation.

incantations.name: Stone of Gurranq
incantations.description: Superior incantation taught by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman. Hurls a boulder before the caster. This incantation can be cast repeatedly. Long ago, Gurranq was a beast of such terrifying ferocity that his former name meant "Death of the Demigods." Note:
incantations.lore: Superior incantation taught by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman.
incantations.effect: Hurls a boulder before the caster
incantations.location: Bestial Sanctum: Reward from Gurranq, Beast Clergyman after giving him the sixth Deathroot. Map Link.

incantations.name: Surge, O Flame!
incantations.description: Superior incantation of the Fire Monks. Creates a stream of fire to burn the area before the caster.This incantation can be cast while in motion. Hold to maintainthe effect. The Giants' Flame is the flame of ruin, capable of burning theErdtree. And so, following the War against the Giants, its ruinousblaze was sealed, and guardians were appointed to watch over it.
incantations.lore: Superior incantation of the Fire Monks.
incantations.effect: Incinerates area before caster with stream of fire
incantations.location: Purchase from Brother Corhyn or Miriel, Pastor of Vows after giving either the Fire Monks' Prayerbook for 5,500 Runes.

incantations.name: Swarm of Flies
incantations.description: A Blood Oath incantation, shared from the Lord of Blood's power. Releases a swarm of bloodflies before the caster to assault foes. The vile swarm deals damage and builds up onset of blood loss. This incantation can be cast while in motion. The new palace of the Lord of Blood lies in a swamp of festering blood, and these flies are said to spawn from excrement in that land.
incantations.lore: A Blood Oath incantation, shared from the Lord of Blood's power.
incantations.effect: Releases a swarm of bloodflies before caster
incantations.location: Found on a corpse along the east wall of the Mohgwyn Palace blood marsh, directly north from the Palace Approach Ledge-Road Site of Grace.

incantations.name: The Flame of Frenzy
incantations.description: Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers. Causes the yellow flame of frenzy to burst forth from the caster's eyes. Charging increases the range of the burst. The flame of frenzy deals damage and causes buildup of madness. This incantation also causes buildup of madness in the caster, and is only effective against Tarnished.
incantations.lore: Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers.
incantations.effect: Emits burst of yellow flame of frenzy from eyes
incantations.location: Callu Baptismal Church in the Weeping Peninsula. Found on a corpse by a pillar on the left side of the church. [Map Link]

incantations.name: Theodorix's Magma
incantations.description: Superior incantation of Dragon Communion. Channels the power of the great wyrm Theodorix. Transforms caster into a great wyrm to spew a large volume of magma breath. Allows one follow-up attack. The name of the ancient troll warrior Theodorix lives on as a hero of the War against the Giants.
incantations.lore:
Superior incantation of Dragon Communion.
Channels the power of the great wyrm Theodorix.
incantations.effect: Spews magma breath of Theodorix from above
incantations.location: Dropped by Great Wyrm Theodorix

incantations.name: Triple Rings of Light
incantations.description: One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists. Produces three rings of light and fires them forwards. The rings of light return to a position close to the caster before disappearing. This incantation can be cast repeatedly. A gift from the young Miquella to his father, Radagon.
incantations.lore: One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
incantations.effect: Fire three rings of light before the caster
incantations.location: Elphael, Brace of The Haligtree: From the Prayer Room grace, head out onto the northeastern walkway and drop down one level by using the roofs on the right. There is a sealed treasure room just under the Prayer Room that requires one Stonesword Key to unlock. The chest containing the spell is inside.

incantations.name: Unendurable Frenzy
incantations.description: Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers. Causes the yellow flame of frenzy to violently burst forth from the caster's eyes. Hold to continue channeling the flame. This incantation can be used while in motion. It is the maddening pain and unstoppable tears of those afflicted with the flame of frenzy brought into being. Note:
incantations.lore: Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers.
incantations.effect: Emits violent burst of yellow flame of frenzy from eyes
incantations.location: Yelough Anix Ruins: Found in a chest in an underground treasure room in the central section of the ruins. Its entrance is in a door-less building that you must jump to from the larger ruined church building.

incantations.name: Urgent Heal
incantations.description: Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful. Heals a small amount of HP. This incantation can be cast while in motion. The Two Fingers has high hopes for the Tarnished; that even if they should be wounded, even should they fall, they will continue to fight for their duty.
incantations.lore: Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.
incantations.effect: Heals a small amount of HP
incantations.location: Starting equipment for the Confessor ClassPurchased from Brother Corhyn for 1,000 Runes.

incantations.name: Vyke's Dragonbolt
incantations.description: Incantation of Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. Summons red lightning to bolster both the caster's body and their armament held in the right hand. Enchants armaments with lightning-affinity attacks and increases maximum equipment load. However, lightning damage negation will be reduced. Of all the knights, Vyke the Dragonspear was the one Lansseax loved the most.
incantations.lore: Incantation of Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.
incantations.effect: Bolsters right-hand armament & body with red lightning
incantations.location: Received after defeating Vyke, Knight of the roundtable at Lord Contender's Evergaol.

incantations.name: Whirl, O Flame!
incantations.description: Superior Incantation of the Fire Monks. Creates a spiraling stream of fire that burns the area before the caster. Charging enhances potency and reach. Fire beguiles those who gaze into it. And so the guardians of the flame are also its worshippers. Note:
incantations.lore: Superior incantation of the Fire Monks.
incantations.effect: Sweeps area before caster with stream of fire
incantations.location: Dropped from a Teardrop Scarab on the road between Rotview Balcony and Caelem Ruins next to the wagon.

incantations.name: Wrath of Gold
incantations.description: Superior Erdtree Worship incantation.Produces a golden shockwave that knocks back nearby foes.Charging increases the size of the shockwave.This incantation was discovered when the Elden Ring was shattered, and it was feared as a sign of the Erdtree's wrath. NOTE:
incantations.lore: Superior Erdtree Worship incantation.
incantations.effect: Produces golden shockwave that knocks back foes
incantations.location: Found at Woodfolk Ruins. Among the enemies, there is a staircase that goes down and leads to a chest that contains this incantation. [Map Link]

npcs.name: Abandoned Merchant Siofra River
npcs.description: Abandoned Merchant Siofra River is an NPC and one of several Nomadic Merchants in Elden Ring. Abandoned Merchants sell various items and equipment including Consumables, Materials, Weapons and Armor as well as notes containing hints on how to acquire certain items. This Abandoned Merchant can be found inside one of the ruins in Central Siofra River.

npcs.name: Aeonian Spirit
npcs.description: The Aeonian Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He stands upon the northern cliffs of the Swamp of Aeonia.
npcs.location: Northern cliff of Swamp of Aeonia

npcs.name: Aeonian Swamp Spirit
npcs.description: The Aeonian Swamp Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He rests on the shore of the swamp and looks out towards the Heart of Aeonia.

npcs.name: Albinauric Village Spirit
npcs.description: The Albinauric Village Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. Located in the Village of the Albinaurics, he wishes for Albus' safety and gives you a hint on how to find him.

npcs.name: Albus
npcs.description: Albus is an NPC in Elden Ring. Albus is an Albinauric who is trying to hide from the calamity that befell Village of the Albinaurics in Liurnia of the Lakes. He has an important item that he would like you to protect
npcs.location: Village of the Albinaurics, Liurnia of the Lakes

npcs.name: Sir Ansbach
npcs.description: Sir Ansbach is an NPC in Elden Ring. Sir Ansbach is a former servant of Mohg, Lord of Blood, but is now part of the group that follows Miquella through the Realm of Shadow. Sir Ansbach is an NPC exclusive to Shadow of the Erdtree and does not appear in the base game.
npcs.role: Pureblood Knight Captain (former), NPC Quest Related

npcs.name: Ashen Spirit
npcs.description: Ashen Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. Ashen Spirit can be found sitting on the ground in the ash.

npcs.name: Blackguard Big Boggart
npcs.description: Blackguard Big Boggart is an NPC in Elden Ring. Initially encountered as the thief of Rya's Necklace, he is a minor NPC and merchant.

npcs.name: Blaidd the Half-Wolf
npcs.description: Mistwood Ruins Forlorn Hound Evergaol Siofra River Redmane Castle Three Sisters

npcs.name: Bloody Finger Hunter Yura
npcs.description: Limgrave: near Seaside RuinsLiurnia of the Lakes: Near Raya Lucaria Academy entrance.Altus Plateau: Second Church of Marika
npcs.location: Limgrave: near Seaside RuinsLiurnia of the Lakes: Near Raya Lucaria Academy entrance.Altus Plateau: Second Church of Marika

npcs.name: Boc the Seamster
npcs.description: Boc the Seamster is an NPC in Elden Ring. Boc is a Demi-Human who is capable of advanced communication. Boc is initially met by the player in the form of a small tree.
npcs.lore:
S-surely, not? For me?!
 Oh no, I can't. It would be wasted on the likes of me.
 You should drink it yourself, master.
 I would be far happier knowing you enjoyed it yourself.

npcs.name: Brother Corhyn
npcs.description: Brother Corhyn is an NPC in Elden Ring. Brother Corhyn is a holy practitioner who will teach you practical faith-based Incantations in exchange for Runes. You will encounter him once you've reached the Roundtable Hold.

npcs.name: Carian Manor Spirit
npcs.description: The Carian Manor Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He can be found sitting on a chair, inside the

npcs.name: Church of Pilgrimage Spirit
npcs.description: The Church of Pilgrimage Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. They can be found outside of the Church of Pilgrimage in the Weeping Peninsula.

npcs.name: Count Ymir, High Priest
npcs.description: Count Ymir, High Priest is an NPC in Elden Ring. Count Ymir, High Priest is a High Priest who oversees the Cathedral of Manus Metyr. He sells a collection of spells that can be purchased with runes. He has a servant named Jolan, who can be summoned during certain fights after progressing his questline. Count Ymir, High Priest is an NPC exclusive to the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC and does not appear in the base game.

npcs.name: D, Beholder of Death
npcs.description: D, Beholder of Death (real name: Devin) is an NPC in Elden Ring. He can be found in Nokron, Eternal City, east of the Great Waterfall Basin grace. To interact with D, Beholder of Death, you need the Twinned Armor. If given the armor, he will be available as a summon against the Valiant Gargoyle pair. He is the twin brother of Darian, also known as D, Hunter of the Dead.

npcs.name: D, Hunter of the Dead
npcs.description: D, Hunter of the Dead is an NPC in Elden Ring. D is a hunter of the undead who can be found where the Tibia Mariner boss is located, and later at the Roundtable Hold. When you first encounter D, he will warn you that the nearby small town of Summonwater Village has been taken over by a Mariner. If the player shows him Deathroot and takes him up on his offer of introduction, he will mark your map with a red "Sending Gate" waypoint, indicating that it will take you to the Beast Clergymen.
npcs.lore:
I don't believe we've met.
 I'm known as D. I hunt down Those Who Live in Death, and weed their Deathroot.
 Heed my warning.
 Those Who Live in Death should be left well alone.
 All the more, should you spy a mariner among their number.
 Unless you wish to lay down your life in vain.

npcs.name: Deathtouched Spirit
npcs.description: The Deathtouched Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He can be found sitting defeated out the front of the Deathtouched Catacombs in Northern Limgrave.

npcs.name: Knight Diallos
npcs.description: Diallos is an NPC in Elden Ring. Diallos is a noble you'll come across at the Roundtable Hold. Upon welcoming you, he mentions that he's looking for a loyal servant to his house called Lanya, and asks you to tell him if you happen to come across her.

npcs.name: Dragon Communion Priestess
npcs.description: Dragon Communion Priestess is an NPC in Elden Ring. Dragon Communion Priestess is a survivor of the ancient dragon worshippers, or also known as servants of Dragonlord Placidusax. Dragon Communion Priestess is exclusive to the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC and does not appear in the base game.

npcs.name: Dryleaf Dane
npcs.description: Dryleaf Dane is an NPC in Elden Ring. Dryleaf Dane is an NPC exclusive to the Shadow of the Erdtree expansion. Dryleaf Dane is a master of hand-to-hand combat, he leaves a Monk's Missive for travelers to find and wish to seek a challenge and learn the way of the warrior.

npcs.name: Dung Eater
npcs.description: Roundtable Hold

npcs.name: Eclipse Spirit
npcs.description: The Eclipse Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He can be seen praying inside the Church of Eclipse.

npcs.name: Edgar
npcs.description: Edgar is an NPC in Elden Ring. Edgar is Irina's father and introduces himself as the warden of Castle Morne. He can be found sitting on a bench in a non-hostile area of the ramparts of the castle. His NPC Summon Sign can be used to fight against the Leonine Misbegotten once he has received Irina's Letter.

npcs.name: Ensha of the Royal Remains
npcs.description: Ensha of the Royal Remains or Ensha is an NPC in Elden Ring. He will refuse to speak to the player, but instead stare at them. He is the servant of Gideon Ofnir.

npcs.name: Erdtree Sanctuary Spirit
npcs.description: Erdtree Sanctuary Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He is sitting in a chair facing the bridge that connects the Queen's Bedchamber to the Elden Throne.

npcs.name: Fia, Deathbed Companion
npcs.description: Fia is an NPC in Elden Ring. Fia is a deathbed companion that you will find inside a small bedroom at the Roundtable Hold. Her embrace will give you a special consumable that can increase poise called the Baldachin's Blessing, at the cost of a debuff that slightly decreases your maximum HP. You can ostensibly come back for more if you happen to run out of this consumable. Fia's Questline Steps are highlighted below.
npcs.lore:
Greetings, great champion called by grace.
 I am Fia.
 Circumstances have compelled my stay at the Roundtable Hold.
 Great champion, would you allow me to hold you, but briefly?
 Perhaps you might share with me some of your lifely vigour, and your stout-heartedness.
 Doing so will grant me the warmth of a champion.
 And you, I am sure, will bear a baldachin's blessing.
 Do you think it vulgar, perhaps?
 Where I come from, it is a sacred act.

npcs.name: Finger Maiden Therolina
npcs.description: Finger Maiden Therolina is an NPC in Elden Ring. Finger Maiden Therolina is a sorcerer controlled by Seluvis and one of participants in Radahns' Festival

npcs.name: Fire Knight Queelign
npcs.description: Fire Knight Queelign is an NPC in Elden Ring. Fire Knight Queelign is an NPC exclusive to the Shadow of the Erdtree expansion, he is a knight who pledges his loyalty to Marika. Fire Knight Queelign is first encountered as an NPC Invader in Belurat Tower Settlement and at the Church of Crusade.
npcs.lore:
Ashen remains in which spirits yet dwell.
Use to summon the spirit of Fire Knight Queelign.
Attacks immediately after being summoned.
npcs.location: NPC Invader:Belurat Tower SettlementChurch of CrusadePhysical Body:Church District, Shadow Keep

npcs.name: Frenzied Spirit
npcs.description: The Frenzied Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He can be seen near the Church of Inhibition of in Northern Liurnia.

npcs.name: Redmane Freyja
npcs.description: Redmane Freyja is an NPC in Elden Ring. Redmane Freyja is a former follower of Radahn, but is now a fervent follower of Miquella. Redmane Freyja is an NPC that can be found exclusively in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, and can't be found in the base game.

npcs.name: Frustrated Spirit
npcs.description: Frustrated Spirit was an NPC in Elden Ring. Frustrated Spirit would lay beside the gates to a Colosseum North-East of Stormhill Shack.

npcs.name: The Gate Town Bridge Spirit
npcs.description: The Gate Town Bridge Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He is upset over the Raya Lucaria Academy closing their gates to him.

npcs.name: Gatekeeper Gostoc
npcs.description: Gatekeeper Gostoc is an NPC in Elden Ring. Gatekeeper Gostoc is an old tall fellow that may seem a bit suspicious, but he seems to want to help. It is your choice to trust him or not.
npcs.lore:
You there.
 Come over here, would you?

npcs.name: Gideon Ofnir
npcs.description: Gideon Ofnir is an NPC in Elden Ring. Gideon Ofnir is the leader of Roundtable Hold and a profound source of knowledge. He can be found most commonly at his office, absorbed by an endless amount of books.

npcs.name: Godwyn the Golden
npcs.description: Godwyn the Golden was a demigod and son of Queen Marika the Eternal and Godfrey the First Elden Lord. In the "Night of the Black Knives" he was assassinated by assassins from the land of the Numen with the use of daggers imbued with the Rune of Death. Godwyn the Golden was the firstborn son of Queen Marika the Eternal and her consort Godfrey, the First Elden Lord. Godwyn was a scion of the so-called "Golden Line", of which Godrick the Grafted was the final descendant. Early in his mother's divine reign, the Erdtree came under assault by the Dragons, who had ruled the world before Marika's ascent. The forces of the Erdtree managed to triumph against the dragons, with Godwyn prevailing against the dreaded Fortissax, earning the mighty dragon's friendship in the process. Godwyn would eventually meet his end during the Night of Black Knives. Seeking to be free from her fate as a pawn of the Greater Will, Godwyn's step-sister Lunar Princess Ranni stole a fragment of the rune of death from Maliketh, imbuing the weapons of Numen assassins with the rune. Ranni wished to shed her Empyrean body but preserve her spirit, which meant that someone else's spirit would need to die. Nevertheless, when the assassins fell upon the Royal Capital and murdered Godwyn, his soul was destroyed and left only his soulless body behind. He was the first demigod in history to die since the ascension of Marika to the throne of the Lands Between. Godwyn's death would be the catalyst for the Shattering of the Elden Ring, plunging the kingdom into chaos without the guidance of the Greater Will. Due to Ranni's ritual, Godwyn's flesh was branded with half of the cursemark of death and he became the first of Those Who Live in Death. His body was laid to rest deep in the roots of the Erdtree, but it would eventually corrupt it, leading Deathroot to sprout across the Lands Between, causing others to also rise in undeath. These undead worshipped Godwyn as the Prince of Death, believing he would eventually return and lead them. An aspect of Godwyn's corpse appeared in the depths of Stormveil Castle and is responsible for the loss of Rogier's legs. Many figures, including his half-brother Miquella and his companion Fortissax, tried to cure him of his condition and allow him a proper death, but to no avail. The deathbed companion Fia would become a leading figure among Those Who Live in Death, eventually making her way to Godwyn's corpse. Having received the other half of the cursemark from Ranni's discarded body with help from a Tarnished champion, Fia lay with Godwyn to grant him a second life as the Prince of Death. As a result of their union, Fia conceived a rune, which a champion seeking to become Elden Lord might use to mend the Elden Ring, reimbuing the principle of death within the Golden Order.

npcs.name: Goldmask
npcs.description: Altus Plateau Leyndell, Royal CapitalMountaintops of the Giants
npcs.location: Altus Plateau Leyndell, Royal CapitalMountaintops of the Giants

npcs.name: Grape Spirit
npcs.description: The Grape Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. Located in Stormveil Castle. He is looking for a maiden to give his grapes to and seems to have lost one, since a Shabiri Grape can be found beside him.

npcs.name: Gurranq, Beast Clergyman
npcs.description: Gurranq, Beast Clergyman is an NPC in Elden Ring. Gurranq appears to be a large, hunched creature that lies isolated in the Bestial Sanctum. Constantly hungering for Deathroot, he will reward those who offer it to him.

npcs.name: Hermit Merchant (Leyndell)
npcs.description: Hermit Merchant (Leyndell) is an NPC in Elden Ring. Hermit Merchant (Leyndell) lives a life of seclusion within Hermit Merchant (Leyndell)'s Shack.
npcs.location: Hermit Merchant's Shack, Leyndell Royal Capital

npcs.name: Hornsent
npcs.description: Hornsent is an NPC in Elden Ring. Hornsent can be found alongside Freyja at the Three-Paths Cross in the Realm of Shadow. He is exclusive to the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, and can't be found in the base game.

npcs.name: Hornsent Grandam
npcs.description: Hornsent Grandam is an NPC in Elden Ring. Hornsent Grandam is a member of the antique race that inhabited Belurat, Tower Settlement. Her people were set to the torch by Messmer the Impaler and his forces. Hornsent Grandam is an NPC exclusive to the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, and is not present in the base game.

npcs.name: Hyetta
npcs.description: Liurnia of the LakesSubterranean Shunning-Grounds

npcs.name: Igon
npcs.description: Igon is an NPC in Elden Ring. Igon can be heard screaming in pain, and swearing revenge against a dragon. Igon is an NPC exclusive to the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC and does not appear in the base game.

npcs.name: Imprisoned Merchant
npcs.description: Imprisoned Merchant is an NPC and Merchant in Elden Ring. Similar to Nomadic Merchants, the Imprisoned Merchant serves as a general goods vendor, selling various Consumables, Ammunition and other items. He can be found inside the Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum.

npcs.name: Irina
npcs.description: Irina is an NPC in Elden Ring. Irina is a blind character wearing a ribbon over her eyes, and a dirty dress stained with blood. She can be encountered just beyond the Bridge of Sacrifice, on the Weeping Peninsula Side. Irina warns you about a rebellion in Castle Morne, and asks you to deliver a letter to her father, commander of the castle forces.

npcs.name: Isolated Merchant Raya Lucaria
npcs.description: Raya Lucaria
npcs.location: Raya Lucaria Academy, Liurnia of the Lakes

npcs.name: Jolan
npcs.description: Jolan is an NPC in Elden Ring. Jolan is a servant dressed in all black and can be found in the Cathedral of Manus Metyr. In the same room where you speak with Count Ymir, she can be seen on the pillar to your right.

npcs.name: Kenneth Haight
npcs.description: Kenneth Haight is an NPC in Elden Ring. Kenneth Haight claims to be the next ruler of Limgrave, you will encounter him as you make your way down the ledges at Limgrave. Haight will ask for your help to clean and clear out Fort Haight that's currently being overrun by different enemies.

npcs.name: Kingsrealm Spirit
npcs.description: Kingsrealm Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. Kingrealm Spirit rests at the Kingsrealm Ruins in Northern Liurnia.

npcs.name: Knight Bernahl
npcs.description: Knight Bernahl (later known as Recusant Bernahl) is an NPC in Elden Ring. Bernahl is a Tarnished Knight initially found at the Warmaster's Shack in central Stormhill. He serves as an Ash of War merchant, selling various ashes in exchange for Runes. He is also involved in certain questlines and will move locations according to player progress. Upon meeting him and progressing his storyline, he can become available as an NPC Summon against the Godskin Duo, as well as an NPC Invader.

npcs.name: Laiedd Spirit
npcs.description: The Laiedd Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He is hiding in Fort Laiedd.

npcs.name: Latenna
npcs.description: Latenna is an NPC in Elden Ring. Latenna can be found after finishing the Lakeside Crystal Cave dungeon located under the southern ridge of Liurnia. She willingly becomes a Spirit to join the player, becoming Latenna the Albinauric.
npcs.location: Liurnia of the Lakes, Slumbering Wolf's Shack

npcs.name: Lionel the Lionhearted
npcs.description: Lionel the Lionhearted is an NPC in Elden Ring. Lionel the Lionhearted acts as the Father of Fia and can be encountered as an NPC Invader as one of Fia's Champions. He is also available as an NPC Summon and can be seen wielding a Great Epee, as well as the Prince of Deaths Staff, casting Rancorcall and Fias Mist.

npcs.name: Liurnian Highway Spirit
npcs.description: The Liurnian Highway Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He can be found on the Liurnia Highway in a defeated position, talking about puppet soliders.

npcs.name: Liurnian Lake Spirit
npcs.description: The Liurnian Lake Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He can be found knelt down in the shallow water, just east of the Revenger's Shack.
npcs.location: Near Revengers Shack, Liurnia of the Lakes

npcs.name: Lost Snow Spirit
npcs.description: The Lost Snow Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He is lost and looking for the Haligtree.

npcs.name: Master Lusat
npcs.description: Master Lusat is an NPC in Elden Ring. Master Lusat can be found at Sellia Hideaway.

npcs.name: Melina
npcs.location: The beginning of the Tarnished's journey.

npcs.name: Merchant Kale
npcs.description: Merchant Kale is a Merchant and NPC in Elden Ring. Merchant Kale can be found in Limgrave: Church of Elleh, soon after emerging from the Stranded Graveyard at the start of the game, youll see a building to the North which is the Church of Elleh.

npcs.name: Millicent's Sisters
npcs.description: Millicent's Sisters is a NPC collective in Elden Ring. They are group of female warriors associated with Gowry.

npcs.name: Miquella
npcs.description: Miquella, also known as Miquella the Kind, is a background character in Elden Ring and a central character in Shadow of the Erdtree. One of the Empyrean children of Queen Marika, he is the twin brother of Malenia, Blade of Miquella, together known as the Twin Prodigies. It is revealed that Miquella has stripped himself of his flesh and Empyrean lineage in the Land of Shadow, a place obscured by the Erdtree and purged in an unsung war.

npcs.name: Miriel, Pastor of Vows
npcs.description: Miriel, Pastor of Vows is an NPC in Elden Ring. Miriel, Pastor of Vows is the Liurna Church of Vow's steward, a huge silver tortoise wearing a mitre. He first interacts with you when arriving at the Church of Vows. Miriel, Pastor of Vows welcomes you and offers to share their knowledge of Sorceries and Incantations, as well as lore on certain characters.
npcs.lore:
You're Tarnished, aren't you?
 I welcome you, to the Church of Vows.
 I am Miriel, steward of this sacred chamber.
 My apologies, for the unseemly state of affairs.
 Do you know the origin of this place?
 How it came to be known as the Church of Vows?

npcs.name: Moore
npcs.description: Moore is an NPC in Elden Ring. Moore is one of the followers of Miquella. A gentle giant that also acts as a Merchant. Moore is an NPC exclusive to the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC and does not appear in the base game.

npcs.name: Morne Spirit
npcs.description: The Morne Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He can be found locked inside a cage behind the castle.

npcs.name: Needle Knight Leda
npcs.description: Needle Knight Leda is an NPC in Elden Ring. Needle Knight Leda is the leader of Miquella's band of followers in the Realm of Shadow. She is an NPC exclusive to Shadow of the Erdtree and does not appear in the base game.

npcs.name: Nepheli Loux, Warrior
npcs.description: Nepheli Loux, Warrior is an NPC in Elden Ring. Nepheli Loux is a warrior and fellow tarnished who was ordered by decree from her adoptive father to kill and dethrone Godrick. She wears clothing similar to the starting Hero class, and she can help you in the battle against Godrick the Grafted if summoned. Her summoning sign is golden and is just outside the boss fog. Other NPC Summon opportunities include boss fights against Godfrey, First Elden Lord and Omenkiller (in Village of the Albinaurics). Progress in her questline to have her summon sign available for these encounters.
npcs.lore:
Be proud. You were a fine warrior.
 Your only mistake was your choice of master.
 Let the winds lift you, to a higher place.

npcs.name: Nomadic Merchant Central ALTUS PLATEAU
npcs.description: Central ALTUS PLATEAU

npcs.name: Patches
npcs.description: Patches the Untethered is a Merchant, NPC, and Field Boss in Elden Ring. Patches is a recurring character in From Software games, usually playing the part of a trickster. He can be found in Murkwater Cave. This is an optional boss as players do not need to defeat him to advance.
npcs.location: Murkwater Cave, LimgraveLiurniaMt. GelmirVolcano ManorThe Shaded Castle

npcs.name: Pidia, Carian Servant
npcs.description: Pidia, Carian Servant is an NPC in Elden Ring, found in Caria Manor. He sells high end goods.

npcs.name: Preceptor Seluvis
npcs.description: Preceptor Seluvis is an NPC in Elden Ring. Seluvis is a pompous sorcerer in service to Ranni the Witch. Seluvis Questline is important for players looking to make Magic Builds, so make sure to read all the Seluvis Questline steps below including a potential lockout due to your choices. Seluvis is first encountered in spectral form at Ranni's Rise in the Three Sisters sub-region of Liurnia of the Lakes.
npcs.lore:
I see... You must be Ranni's new hireling.
 I see... You must be Ranni's new girl.
 Yes, yes, I've heard all about you.
 I am Seluvis, preceptor in the sorcerous arts.
 I don't know what it is the mistress sees in a provincial Tarnished like you,
 but since we have the misfortune of serving the same Lady,
 I ask that you kindly try not to drag us all down with you.

npcs.name: Primeval Sorcerer Azur
npcs.description: Primeval Sorcerer Azur is an NPC in Elden Ring. Azur can be found near the cliffs north of the Hermit Village in Mt. Gelmir.

npcs.name: Queen Marika the Eternal
npcs.description: Queen Marika the Eternal is a background character in Elden Ring and Shadow of the Erdtree. She is the current ruler of the Lands Between, and the one who shattered the Elden Ring. She has many powerful Demigod offspring, who seek the Elden Ring's remaining power (see Elden Ring Timeline).

npcs.name: Renna
npcs.description: Aimee-Ffion Edwards

npcs.name: Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon
npcs.description: Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon is an NPC in Elden Ring. Rennala gives access to the Rebirth function, allowing the player to reallocate their stats by using a Larval Tear (also called respeccing). She can also be used to change the player's appearance.
npcs.lore:
Come, sweetings, become what ye desire.
 Come, sweetings, time to be born, anew.

npcs.name: Roderika
npcs.description: Roderika is an NPC in Elden Ring. Roderika is a spirit-tuner that you will encounter at Stormhill Shack on the trail to Stormveil. She will later move to the Roundtable Hold if you progress her quest.

npcs.name: Rya
npcs.description: Rya is an NPC in Elden Ring. Rya acts as a scout for the Volcano Manor, and is the adopted daughter of Tanith.

npcs.name: Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy
npcs.description: God-Devouring Serpent and Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy is a two-phase Demigod Boss in Elden Ring. The God-Devouring Serpent is a massive coiled serpent found at the Volcano Manor in Mt. Gelmir, and Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy is its true form that's revealed after the first phase is defeated. When Rykard offered himself up to the serpent in a pursuit of immortality, most of his followers turned on him and sought to bring him down with the Serpent-Hunter.

npcs.name: Sanguine Noble (NPC)
npcs.description: Sanguine Noble is an NPC enemy invader located in the Consecrated Snowfields. By heading West of the Inner Consecrated Snowfield grace, and just North of the Yelough Anix Ruins towards the cliff edge.

npcs.name: Shabriri
npcs.description: Shabriri is an NPC in Elden Ring. Shabriri can be found at the Mountaintops of the Giants and looks exactly the same as Bloody Finger Hunter Yura, as he implies the hunter died and he has been given his body. Shabriri can become available as an NPC Summon against Godfrey, First Elden Lord depending on questline progress and ending route.

npcs.name: The Shaded Castle Spirit
npcs.description: The Shaded Castle Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. The Shaded Castle Spirit lays defeated within The Shaded Castle.

npcs.name: Siofra River Spirit
npcs.description: The Siofra River Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He can be seen worshipping the Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum.

npcs.name: Smithing Master Hewg
npcs.description: Smithing Master Hewg is an NPC in Elden Ring. Hewg is an imprisoned Misbegotten blacksmith that can be found at the Roundtable Hold. He will upgrade your Weapons beyond the +3 level, as well as duplicating Ashes of War for a fee, provided you have the proper Materials.
npcs.lore:
You're a new face.
 No matter, it's all the same.
 Lay out your arms. Let's get smithing.

npcs.name: Sorcerer Rogier
npcs.description: Stormveil Castle
npcs.lore:
Ah, nice to meet you.
 The pleasure's mine. Rogier's the name. A sorcerer, as you might have guessed.
 I'm looking for a little something, here in the castle.
 When I'm not hotfooting it from the troops, that is.
 But enough about me, what are you doing here in Stormveil Castle?
 This place is bristling with Tarnished hunters, you know. They sacrifice our kind, for grafting.
 Not exactly a place I'd stroll into without a purpose in mind...

npcs.name: Sorceress Sellen
npcs.description: Sorceress Sellen is a Merchant and NPC in Elden Ring. She can be found inside the Waypoint Ruins, far east from where you first arrive in Limgrave. She can teach you Sorceries. She can also be made available as an NPC Summon for specific battles.
npcs.lore:
Tarnished, are we? A wonder you should turn up here.
 I am Sellen, a sorcerer, quite plainly.
 Why are you here?
npcs.location: Limgrave, Waypoint Ruins Weeping Peninsula, Witchbane Ruins

npcs.name: St. Trina
npcs.description: St. Trina is an NPC in Elden Ring. She can be found in Stone Coffin Fissure and is vital to the progression of Thiollier's questline. St. Trina was first mentioned in the base game in various items like St. Trina's Torch and resembles Miquella.
npcs.location: Garden of Deep Purple (Stone Coffin Fissure)

npcs.name: Stranded Graveyard Spirit
npcs.description: The Stranded Graveyard Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He is located in the Stranded Graveyard and tells you where the training area for the game is.

npcs.name: Study Hall Spirit
npcs.description: The Study Hall Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He can be found inside the Carian Study Hall behind a pew.

npcs.name: Tanith
npcs.description: Tanith, Volcano Manor Proprietress is an NPC in Elden Ring. Tanith is the head of the Volcano Manor, and asks the players about joining forces against the Fingers. If you decide to join her quest, you will receive particular missions as well as access to some new Npcs.

npcs.name: The Great-Jar
npcs.description: The Great-Jar is an NPC in Elden Ring. The Great-Jar can be found in Northern Caelid, at the colosseum North of the Deep Siofra River Well Site of Grace.

npcs.name: The Two Fingers
npcs.description: The Two Fingers are an PC in Elden Ring. They are large, shriveled hands with only two fingers that are said to deliver messages of The Greater Will that only the finger readers can interpret.

npcs.name: Thiollier
npcs.description: Thiollier is an NPC in Elden Ring. Thiollier has an eye for crafting poison and is not a fighter. Thiollier is an NPC that can be found exclusively in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, and can't be found in the base game.
npcs.location: Gravesite Plain, next to Pillar Path Cross

npcs.name: Thops
npcs.description: Thops is an NPC in Elden Ring. Thops is a student at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. He can teach some rudimentary sorceries, provided you can spare a small donation of Runes first.
npcs.location: Church of Irith in Liurnia of the Lakes

npcs.name: Three Fingers
npcs.description: Three Fingers is an NPC in Elden Ring. Three Fingers is an integral part of The Lord of Frenzied Flame ending and can be found near the Cathedral of the Forsaken, below the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds

npcs.name: Tower of Return Spirit
npcs.description: The Tower of Return Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He rests on a rock with a forlonging stare towards the Tower of Return.
npcs.location: On a Western cliff in the Weeping Peninsula

npcs.name: Twin Maiden Husks
npcs.description: Twin Maiden Husks is an NPC and Merchant in Elden Ring. Twin Maiden Husks look like two Finger Readers, holding a staff, and will take Bell Bearing objects to expand their inventory, giving players an option to purchase many Upgrade Materials and the stores of any dead merchant.

npcs.name: Two Fingers
npcs.description: God

npcs.name: Volcano Manor Spirit
npcs.description: The Volcano Manor Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He rests in the Volcano Manor.

npcs.name: Wandering Artist Spirit
npcs.description: The Wandering Artist Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He is the artist that painted the landscape paintings that can be collected through the Lands Between.For a guide and more information on the Wandering Artist Spirit's quest, visit the Paintings page.
npcs.location: LimgraveLakes of LiurniaDragonbarrowAltus PlateauMountaintops of the Giants

npcs.name: Iji War Counselor & Carian Blacksmith
npcs.description: War Counselor Iji is an NPC in Elden Ring. War Counselor Iji (first encountered as Smithing Master Iji) is a gentle Troll in charge of the smithing for the Carian royals, but will also provide his services to the player.Find him by heading north into the slopes of Western Liurnia of the Lakes.
npcs.location: Kingsrealm Ruins, Western Liurnia of the Lakes

npcs.name: White Mask Varre
npcs.description: White Mask Varre is an NPC in Elden Ring. White Mask Varre is encountered near the start of the game, right by The First Step Site of Grace, and will offer advice to the player. He can be found multiple times in different locations as the story progresses.
npcs.lore:
Oh, yes... Tarnished, are we?
 Come to the Lands Between for the Elden Ring, hmm?
 Of course you have. No shame in it.
 But I'm afraid you're plumb out of luck.
 You are maidenless. A bit player, fully divorced from the strength of runes.
 Feel free to go off and die in a ditch somewhere.

npcs.name: Windmill Spirit
npcs.description: The Windmill Spirit is an NPC in Elden Ring. He can be found hiding from the Celebrants behind a cart and a wooden box in the Windmill Village.,

npcs.name: Witch-Hunter Jerren
npcs.description: Witch-Hunter Jerren is an NPC in Elden Ring. Jerren, first known as Castellan Jerren, is a part of the Sorceress Sellen questline. He can also be seen as a herald, making proclamations about the Radahn Festival around Redmane Castle just as the festival is getting prepared to start. He then initiates the festival. Jerren has the opportunity to fight alongside players as an NPC Summon.
npcs.lore:
Oh, Tarnished, are you?
 How did you slip inside, with the gate closed?
 Hmph. No matter.
 If you can fell one of them, you're a champion, in my book.
 I am Jerren. Foolish old warrior, and witness.
 Incidentally, do you like a good festival, from time to time?
 Well, it's true, this fortress houses only the vanquished.
 But when the stars align, we celebrate.
 A war festival honoring the last battle and death of General Radahn,
 the mightiest demigod of the Shattering, and bearer of a Great Rune.
npcs.location: Redmane Castle Academy of Raya Lucaria

locations.name: Abandoned Ailing Village
locations.description: A dilapidated village found north of Ellac bridge, is now infested with Man-flies.

locations.name: Artist's Shack (Gravesite Plain)
locations.description: A small ruined shack overlooking the Gravesite Plain.

locations.name: Belurat Gaol
locations.description: An underground prison located deep within the Belurat Tower.

locations.name: Belurat Tower Settlement
items: Ash of War: Shriek of Sorrow

locations.name: Castle Ensis
items: Remembrance of the Twin Moon Knight

locations.name: Church of Benediction
locations.description: A crumbled church in the southwest of Gravesite Plain.

locations.name: Church of Consolation
locations.description: A crumbled church lies at the edge of Gravesite Plain.

locations.name: Dragon's Pit
locations.description: A large cave system found in Gravesite Plain.

locations.name: Elder's Hovel
locations.description: A ruined shack at the edge of the Abyssal Woods.

locations.name: Ellac Greatbridge
locations.description: A great bridge crossing the Ellac river.

locations.name: Fog Rift Fort
locations.description: A large fort on the west of Castle Ensis.

locations.name: Northern Nameless Mausoleum
locations.description: A small Mausoleum lies on a hill on northwest of the Castle Ensis.

locations.name: Prospect Town
locations.description: Remnants of what was once a small town.

locations.name: Rivermouth Cave
locations.description: The Rivermouth Cave is full of twists and turns as you head deeper into it. What creatures lie beneath this cave, undisturbed?

locations.name: Ruined Forge Lava Intake
locations.description: Underground ruins found east of Gravesite Plain, infested with foes.

locations.name: Run-Down Traveler's Rest
locations.description: A ruined house found under the Ellac Bridge.

locations.name: Scorched Ruins
locations.description: Once a magnificent sight to behold, now just ruins.

locations.name: Suppressing Pillar
locations.description: A towering pillar situated east of the Shadow Realm.

locations.name: Western Nameless Mausoleum
locations.description: A small Mausoleum, at the western edge of Gravesite Plain.

locations.name: Bonny Gaol
locations.description: A large underground area, infested with foes and spoils.

locations.name: Bonny Village
locations.description: A dilapidated village in Scadu Altus, full of Jars.

locations.name: Cathedral of Manus Metyr
locations.description: Large cathedral in Scadu Altus, where Count Ymir awaits your arrival.

locations.name: Church of the Crusade
locations.description: A large, crumbled church in Scadu Altus, contains the flame of Messmer.

locations.name: Darklight Catacombs
locations.description: Catacombs in the depth of the south Scadu Altus region.

locations.name: Eastern Nameless Mausoleum
locations.description: A small mausoleum on a river bank, in a valley under Bonny Village.

locations.name: Enir-Ilim
items: Remembrance of a God and a Lord

locations.name: Finger Ruins of Miyr
locations.description: Large ruins located in Scadu Altus.

locations.name: Fog Rift Catacombs
locations.description: Large underground catacombs infested with foes.

locations.name: Fort of Reprimand
locations.description: A large fort overlooking the abyssal woods.
items: Ash of War: Aspects of the Crucible: Wings

locations.name: Moorth Ruins
locations.description: Large Crumbled ruins in Scadu Altus, with huge underground structure.

locations.name: Rabbath's Rise
locations.description: Filapidated empty tower in Scadu Altus. With a balcony hidden behind the secret wall.

locations.name: Ruined Forge of Starfall Past
locations.description: One of the many forges located in the realm of shadow. The Ruined Forge of Starfall Past is situated in the region of Scadu Altus.

locations.name: Ruins of Unte
locations.description: Large Ruins shrouded by yellowish mist, in a chasm in Scadu Altus.

locations.name: Shadow Keep
items: Ash of War: Wall of Sparks

locations.name: Village of Flies
locations.description: Hideen in a small valley underneath Bonny Village, in Recluses' River downstream region, the Man-Fly gather in a make-do village

locations.name: Whipping Hut
locations.description: A lone ruined Hut, found east of Bonny Village.

locations.name: Scorpion River Catacombs
locations.description: Large underground catacombs infested with foes.

locations.name: Taylew's Ruined Forge
locations.description: A dungeon located underneath Shadow Keep.

locations.name: Temple Town Ruins
locations.description: The half-sunken ruin of a once beautiful town.

locations.name: Finger-Weaver's Hovel
locations.description: A ruined shack found in the southern shore region.

locations.name: Southern Nameless Mausoleum
locations.description: A small Mausoleum on an island in the Southern Shores.

locations.name: Stone Coffin Fissure
locations.description: Ruins in a giant deep underground cave in the southern shore region.

locations.name: Lamenter's Gaol
locations.description: A large Underground cave system, infested with foes.

locations.name: Foot of the Jagged Peak
locations.description: At the foot of Jagged Peak.

locations.name: Grand Altar of Dragon Communion
locations.description: An alter in front of a giant Dragon's body, in Southern Shore area.

locations.name: Abandoned Church
locations.description: An crumbling church hidden deep in the Abyssal Woods.

locations.name: Midra's Manse
items: Remembrance of the Lord of Frenzied Flame

locations.name: Finger Ruins of Rhia
locations.description: Large stone fingers erect at the basin in the Southern Shore region.

locations.name: Albinauric's Shack
locations.description: A small ruined shack in Scadu Altus.

locations.name: Finger Ruins of Dheo
locations.description: Large stone fingers erect on a peninsula in Scaduview, often shrouded in yellow mist.

locations.name: Scadutree Chalice
locations.description: A giant chalice supported by roots in Scadu Altus.

locations.name: Shaman Village
locations.description: A small and peaceful village on Scaduview.

locations.name: Roundtable Hold
locations.description: The bustling hub area that exists outside of the Lands Between. A place to mingle with other adventurerers, craftsmen, resupply and discover a trove of blessings and rooms of secrets.

locations.name: Artist's Shack (Limgrave)
locations.description: A small cabin in Limgrave. Its strongly perceived tranquility seems overshadowed by oblivion.

locations.name: Bridge of Sacrifice
locations.description: A busy bridge swarming with iron-clad foes. Be prepared to engage in an array of melee, ranged and artillery attacks or attempt to push past them.

locations.name: Chapel of Anticipation
locations.description: The area where the start of a great adventure takes place, but not before getting ambushed by a difficult enemy.

locations.name: Church of Dragon Communion
locations.description: The dilapidated remains of a church where many consume the hearts of Dragons in order to perform communion.

locations.name: Church of Elleh
locations.description: Church of Elleh is a ruined building that hides a Site of Grace. The rooftop has caved in and offers no protection from the elements, and weeds are overtaking the walls, but this doesn't stop merchants from seeking what little shelter is on offer.

locations.name: Coastal Cave
locations.description: Coastal Cave is a dark opening on the side of a cliff. Its mossy depths are overrun by hostile humanoid creatures, but those who brave it may find passage to new lands.

locations.name: Deathtouched Catacombs
locations.description: Catacombs filled with the stench of death, Skeletons dwell in the shadows.

locations.name: Divine Tower of Limgrave
locations.description: Closed with a giant set of doors. It looks like you need some pieces to interact with the tower.

locations.name: Dragon-Burnt Ruins
locations.description: Dragon-Burnt Ruins are what remains of the housing area among Agheel Lake, long lost to the deadly attacks of the fierce Agheel Dragon

locations.name: Forlorn Hound Evergaol
locations.description: The southern gaol of Limgrave holds a lone knight, who had abandoned his master, now forced to rot inside his cell.

locations.name: Fort Haight
locations.description: The overrun fort of Kenneth Haith, the alleged next ruler of Limgrave.

locations.name: Fringefolk Hero's Grave
locations.description: Fringefolk Hero's Grave is a dark and secluded location within the Cave of Knowledge. The confused and aimless dwell within.

locations.name: Gatefront Ruins
locations.description: Gatefront Ruins is what remains of the now destroyed barracks near the fortification. Despite its poor state, it is a heavily guarded location by those loyal to Stormveil.

locations.name: Groveside Cave
locations.description: Groveside Cave is a small refuge for wildlife in Limgrave. Its proximity to water and ease of access make it a sought-after shelter against bad weather, but those who venture in don't seem to return.

locations.name: Highroad Cave
locations.description: A cave that houses a tomb, deep within. It is situated at the northmost part of Limgrave. It has been inhabited by a pack of Wolves, Land Octopuses, and Giant Bats.

locations.name: Limgrave Tunnels
locations.description: A deep tunnel used by many to mine smithing stones. Its zealous miners never dare to venture into its hidden chambers, for fear of the great Troll within.

locations.name: Minor Erdtree (Mistwood)
locations.description: Easily distiguished from the rest of the trees in Mistwood Forest.

locations.name: Mistwood
locations.description: Mistwood Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: Mistwood Ruins
locations.description: Concealed by the thriving growth of vegetation, these ruins are kept out of sight by the veil of nature itself. But there's more to it than what you see.

locations.name: Murkwater Catacombs
locations.description: An underground cemetery that is located at the north-east side of Agheel Lake in Limgrave. Once a place for peaceful rest for fallen heroes, it is now infested by goblins.

locations.name: Murkwater Cave
locations.description: A dark cave halfway through the Murkwater River

locations.name: Siofra River Well
locations.description: A mystical underground region filled with its own set of skies and stars. Beware, it is teeming with creatures big and small alike.

locations.name: Starfall Crater
locations.description: A crater formed by the falling star upon the defeat of conqueror of the stars.

locations.name: Stormfoot Catacombs
locations.description: Stormfoot Catacombs are meant to be a restful place for the deceased, and are protected by the imps and their Watchdog.

locations.name: Stormgate
locations.description: The Stormgate is a heavily guarded area that marks the border within Limgrave and Stormhill. Only the foolhardy would rush such against such odds

locations.name: Stormhill
locations.description: Stormhill Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: Stormhill Evergaol
locations.description: The Brave and Foolish alike dare venture into the Stormhill Evergaol and face its relentless knight in battle.

locations.name: Stormhill Shack
locations.description: The Stormhill Shack is a dilapidated shelter formerly used to house hunters in the area. A Site of Grace offers a needed moment of rest for those traveling nearby

locations.name: Stormveil Castle
locations.description: Players entering Stormveil Castle should beware that it's a challenging dungeon with groups of numerous enemies with traps and ballistas as well as mini-bosses.

locations.name: Stranded Graveyard
locations.description: Stranded Graveyard is a dark and secluded location within the Cave of Knowledge. The confused and aimless dwell within.

locations.name: Summonwater Village
locations.description: D, Hunter of The Dead, warns you of this nearby village taken over by death, known as Summonwater Village

locations.name: Third Church of Marika
locations.description: The Ruins of an Old Church found in the Mistwood. The most prominent sight here is a statue of a lady with her arms outstretched.

locations.name: Warmaster's Shack
locations.description: Small shack in a remote area near north-central Stormhill.

locations.name: Waypoint Ruins
locations.description: Waypoint Ruins consists of a group of broken buildings and abandoned campsites, now overrun with Miranda sprouts and their crazed caretaker.

locations.name: Ailing Village
locations.description: A small, abandoned village nestled within a forested area north of the Castle Morne Rampart. This village is host to long-dilapidated dwellings, inhabited only by maddened fanatics gripped by the Flame of Frenzy.

locations.name: Bridge of Sacrifice
locations.description: A busy bridge swarming with iron-clad foes. Be prepared to engage in an array of melee, ranged and artillery attacks or attempt to push past them.

locations.name: Callu Baptismal Church
locations.description: A dilapidated church, presumably frequented by the former residents of Ailing Village. Now it lies in ruin, its congregation replaced by a family of mutant vermin feasting on the remains of unfortunate travelers.

locations.name: Castle Morne
locations.description: I've escaped from Castle Morne, to the south. The servants there...have rebelled. Irina

locations.name: Church of Pilgrimage
locations.description: The Church of Pilgrimage is a broken building situated at the top of the cliff in the north of the Weeping Peninsula. Even with the walls and roof destroyed pilgrims still make the journey to visit this church.

locations.name: Demi-Human Forest Ruins
locations.description: Demi-Humans congregate here to worship their queen. Defeating her will reward players with the Demi-Human Queen's Staff, which is excellent for beginner mages.

locations.name: Earthbore Cave
locations.description: Earthbore Cave is a small dark cave on the side of the Cliffside between Limgrave and Weeping Peninsula. One might be able to hear the squeaks of rats and the snoring of a large beast deep within if you listen closely.

locations.name: Forest Lookout Tower
locations.description: A run-down tower built on the edge of the cliffs of the Weeping Peninsula, located west of the Bridge of Sacrifice.

locations.name: Fourth Church of Marika
locations.description: The ruins of a lonely church, sitting atop a plateau west of the peninsula. Despite its current state, the altar remains intact and ghostly knights still roam the fields nearby, perhaps restless and duty-bound to safeguarding the area...

locations.name: Impaler's Catacombs
locations.description: The Impaler's Catacombs are found in the east side of the Weeping Peninsula. Once used to store the bodies of the dead, it is now crawling with Imps.

locations.name: Isolated Merchant's Shack Weeping Peninsula
