locations.description: Found at the western edge of the Weeping Peninsula, this lonesome hut is home to but a single person who has long adapted to a life of seclusion.

locations.name: Minor Erdtree (Weeping Peninsula)
locations.description: One of the large Erdtree's found in the Weeping Peninsula. An Erdtree Avatar charges at those who approach

locations.name: Morne Tunnel
locations.description: A dark and hidden tunnel that is inhabited by Misbegottens and Miners.

locations.name: Oridys's Rise
locations.description: A lone observation tower atop a plateau in the east of the Weeping Peninsula. Long since abandoned, the entrance is barred by a seal, presenting travelers with a small challenge.

locations.name: Tombsward Catacombs
locations.description: The Tombsward Catacombs are hidden inside the mountain near the Minor Erdtree in the Weeping Peninsula. Once filled with the bodies of the dead, armed skeletons now rise to chase away those that wish to explore its depths.

locations.name: Tombsward Cave
locations.description: Hidden cave in the forest teeming with poison-filled creatures.

locations.name: Tombsward Ruins
locations.description: The ruins of a former burial ground. Next to nothing remains here, yet squires still roam the dark tunnels beneath. Perhaps protecting the graves of their former noble masters...

locations.name: Tower of Return
locations.description: A dilapidated tower guarded by foot soldiers and mounted cavalry. Makeshift wooden platforms and ladders line the inside of the tower, allowing it to retain some function as a lookout point and a mount for ballistae.

locations.name: Weeping Evergaol
locations.description: An evergaol located on the western landmass of the Weeping Peninsula. A formidable opponent is imprisoned within.

locations.name: Witchbane Ruins
locations.description: A set of ruins found in western Weeping Peninsula. Overgrown with thick shrubs and poisonous pools, this decrepit landmark invites only misery and dread.

locations.name: Academy Crystal Cave
locations.description: The depths of the Raya Lucaria Academy are rich in rose-tinted crystals, imbued with the natural magic of the area.

locations.name: Academy Gate Town
locations.description: The sunken remains of the academy town.

locations.name: Ainsel River Well
locations.description: A small structure housing a lift that takes you down to the Ainsel River.

locations.name: Artist's Shack (Liurnia of the Lakes)
locations.description: A small cabin at North Liurnia of The Lakes. Its strongly perceived tranquility seems overshadowed by oblivion.

locations.name: Bellum Church
locations.description: Located past the ruins and the forested area guarded by Cuckoo Knights.
npcs: Nomadic Merchant North Liurnia of the Lakes

locations.name: Bellum Highway
locations.description: Outside the East Raya Lucaria Gate

locations.name: Black Knife Catacombs
locations.description: The dreaded catacombs holds many skeletons that can revive until properly killed, but also holds the Black Knifeprint, a key item in a certain quest.

locations.name: Boilprawn Shack
locations.description: Small run-down shack in the swamps of Liurnia. The Blackguard is said to reside here, cooking prawns.

locations.name: Caria Manor
locations.description: A large estate situated far to the north of Liurnia. Heavily guarded by all manner of creatures as well as its eternal warden, the spectral Royal Knight Loretta.

locations.name: Carian Study Hall
locations.description: A large library-like location full of spectres and magic users that leads to the Divine Tower of Liurnia. Using the Carian Inverted Statue unlocks an alternative version of the map.

locations.name: Cathedral of Manus Celes
locations.description: A large church atop the southern plateau of Liurnia. Ranni awaits her lord in the depths of the church, guarded by her loyal Dragon.

locations.name: Chelona's Rise
locations.description: A tower overlooking the southwestern-most tip of Liurnia of the lakes.

locations.name: Church of Inhibition
locations.description: The remnants of an old church in the north of Liurnia, just before the Altus Plateau.

locations.name: Church of Irith
locations.description: A peaceful church at the back of Stormveil Castle.

locations.name: Church of Vows
locations.description: It is here, at the Church of Vows, that the great houses of the Erdtree and the Moon were joined by the matrimonial bond between red-haired Radagon and Rennala of the Full Moon. That is why it holds in view the monuments of both houses, the Erdtree of the Capital and the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

locations.name: Cliffbottom Catacombs
locations.description: Catacombs found at the bottom of the cliffs in the eastern side of the Liurnia of the Lakes region, now infested by Imps and Omens

locations.name: Converted Fringe Tower
locations.description: A tower found on the fringe in the northeastern tip of Liurnia.

locations.name: Converted Tower
locations.description: An abandoned tower overlooking the lakes from the southwest.

locations.name: Cuckoo's Evergaol
locations.description: Evergaol located on the western landmass of Liurnia. A powerful knight stirs within.

locations.name: Deep Ainsel Well
locations.description: A deep well leading to the Moonlight Altar from the underground Grand Cloister.

locations.name: Divine Tower of Liurnia
locations.description: A long bridge leads to the nearly empty Tower of Liurnia where a corpse lies at the peak.

locations.name: Frenzied Flame Village
locations.description: A village in Liurnia gripped in the madness of Three Fingers. Its denizens know nothing but the fiery frenzy burning within them.

locations.name: Frenzy-Flaming Tower
locations.description: A tower in north-east Liurnia of the Lakes, atop which is a giant flame causing madness in the surrounding area.

locations.name: Grand Lift of Dectus
locations.description: A massive lift platform found between Liurnia and the Altus Plateau. The mechanism that operates the lift is barred by four Guardian Statues, requiring the brandishing of a special artifact for them to release their hold.

locations.name: Highway Lookout Tower Liurnia of the Lakes
locations.description: A lone tower overlooking the Liurnia main road on the eastern landmass.

locations.name: Jarburg
locations.description: A peaceful village hidden on the side of a cliff. It is home to many friendly Jars, who only wish to be left alone.

locations.name: Kingsrealm Ruins
locations.description: A ruined area, only seemingly bare.

locations.name: Lakeside Crystal Cave
locations.description: Hidden on the southwestern cliffs of Liurnia of the Lakes, a winding cave carved by large crystals.

locations.name: Laskyar Ruins
locations.description: Ruins of a sunken structure beset by fog, found amidst the marshes of south Liurnia.

locations.name: Lunar Estate Ruins
locations.description: The ruins of a large estate found atop the southwestern plateau of Liurnia.

locations.name: Malefactor's Evergaol
locations.description: An evergaol overlooking the vast lakes. A flame-wielding thief resides within.

locations.name: Minor Erdtree (Liurnia Northeast)
locations.description: A Minor Erdtree standing tall in the northeast of Liurnia. Its base is home to the spirits of the Minotaur-like Ancestral Followers.

locations.name: Minor Erdtree (Liurnia Southwest)
locations.description: This ancient Erdtree overlooks the lakes from the southwest.

locations.name: Moonfolk Ruins
locations.description: Ruins found in the southwest of the Liurnia of the Lakes region

locations.name: Moonlight Altar
locations.description: Moonlight Altar Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: Purified Ruins
locations.description: The holy remains now lie in ruin

locations.name: Ranni's Rise
locations.description: A tower beset by large chunks of glintstone emerging from the ground and penetrating its interiors. Home to a mysterious figure observing The Lands Between.

locations.name: Raya Lucaria Academy
locations.description: A towering ivory tower where scholars come to study the art of sorcery. The gates have been sealed to prevent trespassers from entering the institute. It is heavily guarded by sorcerers, wardens, and reanimated beings imbued with magical properties.
items: Remembrance of the Full Moon Queen
bosses: Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon

locations.name: Raya Lucaria Crystal Tunnel
locations.description: One of the vast networks of tunnels used prominently for the academy's crystal mining operation.

locations.name: Renna's Rise
locations.description: A Tower of the Three Sisters, belonging to Renna. It houses Ranni's Snow Witch Armor Set.

locations.name: Revenger's Shack
locations.description: An isolated shack north of the Minor Erdtree. Bodies litter the ground inside the shack.

locations.name: Ringleader's Evergaol
locations.description: Found on the Moonlight Altar. Inside awaits a notorious assassin, imprisoned for the act of slaying a demigod.

locations.name: Road's End Catacombs
locations.description: Catacombs at the end of the world...

locations.name: Rose Church
locations.description: The ruins of a former church aptly named Rose Church, for its walls are now festering with accursed blood pustules and overgrown with bloodroses.

locations.name: Royal Grave Evergaol
locations.description: An evergaol constructed for the Carian Royal family in the plains east of the royal estate.

locations.name: Ruin-Strewn Precipice
locations.description: A steep precipice with abundant caves in the insides all the way through

locations.name: Seluvis's Rise
locations.description: A tower bequeathed unto Preceptor Seluvis. Serves as his personal study as he delves into the sorcerous arts.

locations.name: Slumbering Wolf's Shack
locations.description: A small shack nestled at the side of a cliff, only accessible through a long winding cave system. A woman and her wolf companion rest here.

locations.name: Stillwater Cave
locations.description: A dark and murky cave beset by a poisonous miasma. Home to servants of rot, relishing in the presence of the giant poisonblooms endemic to the cave.

locations.name: Temple Quarter
locations.description: Ruined by the breaking, the Temple Quarter is now overrun with dangerous creatures, ready to attack any who come near

locations.name: Testu's Rise
locations.description: An observation tower found in the middle of a lone isle in Liurnia. The entrance is sealed by impish magic and presents a challenge to would-be visitors.

locations.name: The Four Belfries
locations.description: As its name suggests, The Four Belfries is a hill with four large bell towers overlooking Liurnia from the west. Each belfry hosts a waygate that transports travellers to various locations.

locations.name: Village of the Albinaurics
locations.description: The cursemongers have destroyed the home of the old Albinaurics, but perhaps hope is not lost for them to find their promised land.

locations.name: Caelem Ruins
locations.description: A set of perpetually burning ruins in western Caelid. The Caelid Highway cuts through these ruins which are heavily guarded by mobile flamethrowers and swarming with burning reanimated corpses.

locations.name: Caelid Catacombs
locations.description: A labyrinth of Scarlet Rot-soaked floors and tunnels.

locations.name: Caelid Waypoint Ruins
locations.description: A set of ruins found in southwest Caelid, along the highway. Long abandoned, the ruins have become home to all manner of creatures that revel in the decay and putrefaction brought on by the scarlet rot.

locations.name: Cathedral of Dragon Communion (Caelid)
locations.description: The Cathedral of Dragon Communion has long been destroyed, but those who seek to commune with draconic power may yet access its power

locations.name: Church of the Plague
locations.description: A dilapidated church found in the cliffs east of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.

locations.name: Divine Tower of Caelid
locations.description: A massive tower found in central Dragonbarrow, north of Caelid. The sides of the tower are crumbling from the massive overgrowth protruding from the plateau.

locations.name: Forsaken Ruins
locations.description: The Forsaken Ruins consists of a group of broken buildings and abandoned campsites. It is located in Caelid and is guarded by a Giant Crow.

locations.name: Fort Gael
locations.description: A ruined fort in a ruined land, Fort Gael looms above the surrounding landscape, a vicious roar can be heard within.

locations.name: Gael Tunnel
locations.description: A set of tunnels found on the western edge of Caelid, along the border to Limgrave.

locations.name: Gaol Cave
locations.description: Found at the west of Caelid

locations.name: Gowry's Shack
locations.description: A lone shack found below the eastern hills near Sellia, Town of Sorcery.

locations.name: Minor Erdtree (Caelid)
locations.description: The Minor Erdtree of Caelid, found in the northwest near the border to Limgrave.

locations.name: Minor Erdtree Catacombs
locations.description: Catacombs found deep beneath the Minor Erdtree in Caelid.

locations.name: Redmane Castle
locations.description: A small castle that is heavily guarded at the castle's outskirts by Radahn Knights and Soldiers. The Redmane Castle serves as the gathering point for warriors alike who are wanting to participate in the Radahn Festival.

locations.name: Sellia Crystal Tunnel
locations.description: The crystal mining operation of Sellia is overseen by grotesque and aggressive Kindred of Rot.

locations.name: Sellia Gateway
locations.description: The gateway leading to Sellia, Town of Socrcery.

locations.name: Sellia, Town of Sorcery
locations.description: A once-great town renowned for its study of the sorcerous arts. Now lying in ruin, the ghosts of its former scholars still roam the streets.

locations.name: Shack of the Rotting
locations.description: An old worn-down shack overlooking a long stretch of cliffs in western Caelid.

locations.name: Smoldering Church
locations.description: A church in northwestern Caelid, near the border with Limgrave

locations.name: Street of Sages Ruins
locations.description: The sages of Caelid are no more, and their former district is now the dwelling of perfumers and their poisonous flowers

locations.name: Swamp Lookout Tower
locations.description: A long-abandoned lookout tower, that now only oversees the poisonous swamp that plagues Caelid

locations.name: Swamp of Aeonia
locations.description: Swamp of Aeonia Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses
items: Ash of War: Sacred Ring of Light

locations.name: Wailing Dunes
locations.description: Wailing Dunes Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: War-Dead Catacombs
locations.description: Tombs for those who have perished in battle, endlessly clashing even as spirits.

locations.name: Altus Tunnel
locations.description: The Altus tunnels were once used to supply the lands with quality crystals

locations.name: Dominula, Windmill Village
locations.description: Located in northern Altus Plateau, many have heard ominous laughter from the locals, who dance as a part of their festival.

locations.name: East Windmill Pasture
locations.description: East Pasture Outskirsts of Windmill Village. True to its name, it can be identified by the still-working windmill placed in the center of the pasture.

locations.name: Golden Lineage Evergaol
locations.description: Found near the Grand Lift of Dectus, this prison contains a member of the Golden Lineage, imprisoned for the grotesque act of Grafting.

locations.name: Grand Lift of Dectus
locations.description: A massive lift platform found between Liurnia and the Altus Plateau. The mechanism that operates the lift is barred by four Guardian Statues, requiring the brandishing of a special artifact for them to release their hold.

locations.name: Highway Lookout Tower Altus Plateau
locations.description: A lookout tower in Altus Plateau, overlooking the main road leading up to the northwestern entrance of the Capital Outskirts.

locations.name: Lux Ruins
locations.description: Long forgotten ruins among golden trees, swarmed with demi-humans protecting the underground chamber.

locations.name: Minor Erdtree (Altus Plateau)
locations.description: A Minor Erdtree found in central Altus Plateau. An air of perpetual gloom permeates the area.

locations.name: Mirage Rise
locations.description: An area with a mystic glow. Adventurers who solve the riddle and touch the Phantom Crests found across the fields will unveil the Mirage Rise and reap its rewards.

locations.name: Old Altus Tunnel
locations.description: An old mining site, still active to this day. Its tunnels echo with the grunts and groans of the commoners, tirelessly slaving away, grinding at the rich reservoir of crystals deep within.

locations.name: Perfumer's Grotto
locations.description: The perfumers of the Altus Plateau tend for their gardens, even when they are blighted beyond recovery

locations.name: Perfumer's Ruins
locations.description: A set of ruins found in Altus Plateau, far to the west and below Mt. Gelmir.

locations.name: Sage's Cave
locations.description: Sage's Cave is a dark opening in the side of a mountain. Its dark depths are overrun by hostile undead, but those who brave it may find treasures beyond compare.

locations.name: Sainted Hero's Grave
locations.description: An ominous grave, found at central Altus Plateau

locations.name: Second Church of Marika
locations.description: Second of the four Churches of Marika where players can gather a Sacred Tear for their flask

locations.name: Stormcaller Church
locations.description: A lonely church on a steppe.

locations.name: The Shaded Castle
locations.description: An abandoned and Decrepit castle found in the northern region between the Mt. Gelmir and the Altus Plateau regions. The castle is half sunken into a poisonous bog, with the air tinged yellow by the fumes.

locations.name: Unsightly Catacombs
locations.description: A burial grounds crawling with Misbegotten creatures found deep beneath the Perfumer's Ruins. Despite its decrepit state, the catacombs give off a trace of fragrant aromas juxtaposed by the scent of the ancient dead.

locations.name: Village Windmill Pasture
locations.description: A windmill with two stables, found near the Dominula, Windmill Village. The windmill here is still functional but the area has been taken over by Misbegotten creatures.

locations.name: West Windmill Pasture
locations.description: Wide Pastures identified from its run down windmill, akin to the areas nearby.

locations.name: Woodfolk Ruins
locations.description: Woodfolk Ruins, guarded by Limgrave's creatures, can be found near the Minor Erdtree within Altus Plateau.

locations.name: Writheblood Ruins
locations.description: A set of ruins overlooking a forest where the Altus Plateau's Minor Erdtree can be found.

locations.name: Wyndham Catacombs
locations.description: Burial grounds located beneath Wyndham Ruins.

locations.name: Wyndham Ruins
locations.description: A large set of ruins atop a burial grounds. The reanimated dead still roam the area.

locations.name: Corpse-Stench Shack
locations.description: A run-down shack amidst burning corpses past the site of a recent battle.

locations.name: Craftsman's Shack
locations.description: A series of long-abandoned huts found directly south of the volcano.

locations.name: Fort Laiedd
locations.description: Fort Laiedd is found on the western edge of Mt. Gelmir, left in disrepair after a siege from the Fire Monks.

locations.name: Gelmir Hero's Grave
locations.description: Large Catacombs housing an ancient hero of Mt. Gelmir.

locations.name: Hermit Village
locations.description: A dilapidated village southeast of Mt. Gelmir. Now home to Demi-Humans.

locations.name: Hermit's Shack
locations.description: An abandoned shack along the southwestern edge of Mt. Gelmir.

locations.name: Minor Erdtree (Mt. Gelmir)
locations.description: A Minor Erdtree found northwest of the volcano in Mt. Gelmir

locations.name: Seethewater Cave
locations.description: A cave found along the Seethewater Ravine.

locations.name: Volcano Cave
locations.description: A cave system at the highest point of Mt. Gelmir, made into a home by a family of Demi-Humans hiding their maddened Queen.

locations.name: Volcano Manor
locations.description: A fiery Legacy Dungeon encountered in Mt. Gelmir
items: Ash of War: Royal Knight's Resolve

locations.name: Auriza Hero's Grave
locations.description: A tomb found on the outskirts of the Royal Capital. Larger than most catacombs, this was built to honor a fallen champion and is heavily guarded to this day.

locations.name: Auriza Side Tomb
locations.description: Catacombs that have been overtaken by Living Jars, who seek fresh bodies to stuff themselves with.

locations.name: Divine Tower of East Altus
locations.description: Seen last before accessing to the Forbidden Lands.

locations.name: Divine Tower of West Altus
locations.description: The hidden entrance to the Divine Tower.

locations.name: Hermit Merchant's Shack
locations.description: Nestled on a cliff within the confines of the Royal Capital, this shack is home to a humble merchant, who has chosen a life of seclusion.However, something ominous lurks...

locations.name: Minor Erdtree (Capital Outskirts)
locations.description: A Minor Erdtree found in Capital Outskirts. Overlooking the entrance to Leyndell, Royal Capital.

locations.name: Minor Erdtree Church
locations.description: What's left of the Church of the Minor Erdtree.

locations.name: Sealed Tunnel
locations.description: An abandoned tunnel hiding secrets behind false walls

locations.name: Elden Throne
locations.description: The seat of reigning Elden Lord

locations.name: Leyndell Catacombs
locations.description: A massive underground mausoleum found beneath the Royal Capital

locations.name: Leyndell Colosseum
locations.description: The practice had died out by the age of King Consort Radagon, but remains of the arenas where ritual combat took place can still be found in every land.

locations.name: Leyndell, Ashen Capital
locations.description: Leyndell, Ashen Capital Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: Leyndell, Royal Capital
locations.description: Leyndell, Royal Capital Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: Abandoned Cave
locations.description: A cliffside cavern found by traversing some roots. Filled with pools of rot, which the inhabitants fervently worship.

locations.name: Bestial Sanctum
locations.description: The Bestial Sanctum is a refuge for Gurranq, Beast Clergyman, who feeds on Deathroot. Offer him any in your possession, and he will grant you the strength of beasts.

locations.name: Dragonbarrow Cave
locations.description: A small dungeon found beneath the Minor Erdtree in Dragonbarrow.

locations.name: Divine Tower of Caelid
locations.description: A massive tower found in central Dragonbarrow, north of Caelid. The sides of the tower are crumbling from the massive overgrowth protruding from the plateau.

locations.name: Deep Siofra Well
locations.description: A second lift to the Siofra River

locations.name: Fort Faroth
locations.description: Fort Faroth used to house the guardians of Caelid, but its defenders have long fallen, now bound to earth as hostile spirits.

locations.name: Isolated Merchant's Shack (Dragonbarrow)
locations.description: A lonesome hut found atop a plateau in western Dragonbarrow. Home to a hermit looking to part with various odds and ends... for a price.

locations.name: Lenne's Rise
locations.description: An observation tower in the northeast of Dragonbarrow, off the path to the Bestial Sanctum.

locations.name: Minor Erdtree (Dragonbarrow)
locations.description: A Minor Erdtree in eastern Dragonbarrow, overlooking the eastern roads.

locations.name: Sellia Evergaol
locations.description: Found on a cliff in the Dragonbarrow, this one holds an esteemed Battlemage, who developed a longing for conflict.

locations.name: Sellia Hideaway
locations.description: Sellia Hideaway is a small cave north-east from Sellia town, where Sorceress Sellen questline unfolds.

locations.name: Castle Sol
locations.description: A castle found in the northeast of the Mountaintops of the Giants. Stronghold of Commander Niall and his spectral knights.

locations.name: Church of Repose
locations.description: A small crumbled church high on the mountains.

locations.name: First Church of Marika
locations.description: The desolated and destroyed remains of the First Church of Marika remain as testament to the desolation of region.

locations.name: Flame Peak
locations.description: The uppermost region of the Mountaintops, littered to the brim with Giant corpses. The many Trolls here are often seen fighting off ravenous creatures.

locations.name: Forbidden Lands
locations.description: Forbidden Lands Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: Forge of the Giants
locations.description: The ever-burning Forge of the Fire Giants, said to hold the power to burn the Erdtree itself.

locations.name: Grand Lift of Rold
locations.description: The impressive Lift of Rold transports those who wield the right key. But could there be more than one destination?

locations.name: Giant-Conquering Hero's Grave
locations.description: A complex dungeon filled with invulnerable enemies and strange golden floor seals.

locations.name: Giants' Mountaintop Catacombs
locations.description: A labyrinth of tunnels deep underground, teeming with enemies and creatures

locations.name: Guardians' Garrison
locations.description: Guardian's Garrison is staffed by the Flame Guardians, who zealously watch the road leading to the Giant's Forge

locations.name: Heretical Rise
locations.description: A Rise located in the Mountaintops, containing a forbidden, primeval sorcery. Guarded closely by the puppet soldiers of the Academy

locations.name: Lord Contender's Evergaol
locations.description: A Tarnished that was the closest to becoming Elden Lord, locked away after being seduced by the flame of frenzy.

locations.name: Minor Erdtree (Mountaintops East)
locations.description: Minor Erdtree of the Mountaintops

locations.name: Shack of the Lofty
locations.description: A lone shack found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. This shack was once visited by a traveling maiden, but she had long since perished under the elements.

locations.name: Spiritcaller Cave
locations.description: A cave found by the Freezing Lake, heavily battered by the elements. Said to be home to strange creatures to call forth spirits to their aid.

locations.name: Stargazers' Ruins
locations.description: A set of ruins found in central Mountaintops of the Giants. The plateau it is sitting on is located between two bridges.

locations.name: Zamor Ruins
locations.description: The ancient town of Zamor, now fallen to ruin. The order of knights still roam the snow-capped streets.

locations.name: Albinauric Rise
locations.description: A lone Rise overlooking the narrow channel of the frozen river. The puzzle requires one to allow Imps to do battle against one another.

locations.name: Apostate Derelict
locations.description: A ruined church lying in the frozen north-westof the Consecrated Grounds

locations.name: Cave of the Forlorn
locations.description: A cave system in the Consecrated Snowfield, serving as a sanctuary for Misbegotten. Their greatest warrior holds a legendary relic of the Golden Order

locations.name: Consecrated Snowfield Catacombs
locations.description: The Catacombs of the fields leading to Miquella's Haligtree hide powerful secrets, but are zealously guarded.

locations.name: Elphael Brace of the Haligtree
locations.description: A Legacy Dungeon in Elden Ring. Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree is a big castle that constitutes the second part of Miquella's Haligtree dungeon.

locations.name: Hidden Path to the Haligtree
locations.description: The secret passage leading to the Haligtree has been overrun by the Vulgar Militia, seeking to ambush any who try to cross.

locations.name: Minor Erdtree (Consecrated Snowfield)
locations.description: A Minor Erdtree enveloped in corruption, standing in the blizzards of the Consecrated Snowfield.

locations.name: Miquella's Haligtree
locations.description: A Legacy Dungeon in Elden Ring. Miquella's Haligtree is found far to the north of the Consecrated Snowfield and the entire Lands Between.

locations.name: Ordina, Liturgical Town
locations.description: A long abandoned town in the snowfield. If one wishes to open the gate, they must enter the evergaol and light three statues in order to proceed.

locations.name: Yelough Anix Ruins
locations.description: A set of ruins found west in the snowfield. Its inhabitants have been afflicted by frenzy.

locations.name: Yelough Anix Tunnel
locations.description: An icy tunnel on the southern edge of the Yelough Anix Ruins. It is home to many extra-terrestrial beings that came from the stars.

locations.name: Ainsel River
locations.description: Ainsel River Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: Ainsel River Main
locations.description: Ainsel River Main Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: Deeproot Depths
locations.description: Deeproot Depths Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: Frenzied Flame Proscription
locations.description: Half-buried catacombs, deep in the earth below Leyndell. The audience-chamber of the Three Fingers.

locations.name: Grand Cloister
locations.description: The Grand Cloister at the Lake of Rot.

locations.name: Hallowhorn Grounds
locations.description: An overgrown temple ruin occupied solely by a giant deer carcass.

locations.name: Lake of Rot
locations.description: Lake of Rot Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: Mohgwyn Palace
locations.description: Mohgwyn Palace Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum
locations.description: A large mausoleum nestled in the western cliffs of Mohgwyn Palace.

locations.name: Night's Sacred Ground
locations.description: A quiet holy site left in ruins in Nokron, Eternal City.

locations.name: Nokron, Eternal City
locations.description: Nokron, Eternal City Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: Nokstella, Eternal City
locations.description: The ruins of a once grand city, now infested with enemies.

locations.name: Siofra Aqueduct
locations.description: A ruined aqueduct in the Eternal City of Nokron. The waters here seemingly flow downwards to the river below.

locations.name: Siofra River
locations.description: Siofra River Map & FragmentsSites of Grace & Sub-LocationsAll NPCs & MerchantsAll Items, Equipment & MagicAll Enemies & Bosses

locations.name: Subterranean Shunning-Grounds
locations.description: The unseen underground of the Royal Capital, where the forsaken Omen were sent to rot in obscurity.

locations.name: Uhl Palace Ruins
locations.description: A crumbling palace ruins now infested with foes.

armors.name: Dane's Hat
armors.description: The sun-faded and lightly soiled hat of Dryleaf Dane. Worn low over the eyes, it obscures the wearer's vision. Meeting the gaze of another can overcome the senses, often leading to the downfall of those who would walk the noble and solitary seekers' path.
armors.how_to_acquire: This Helm is obtained as a drop upon defeating Dryleaf Dane. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]

armors.name: Gaius's Helm
armors.description: The black iron helm of Commander Gaius. Part of an armor set patterned after fallen seeds. Gaius was the most senior disciple of the same Alabaster Lord who taught Radahn and Gaea gravitational technique.
armors.how_to_acquire: Purchased from the Enia at the Roundtable Hold, after defeating Commander Gaius.

armors.name: Oathseeker Knight Helm
armors.description: An Oathseeker Knight helm. Black with gold ornamentation. These knights set off on quests of discovery, hoping to find by themselves an oath of their own choosing to serve in perfect, lifelong devotion.
armors.lore:
An Oathseeker Knight helm.
Black with gold ornamentation.
armors.how_to_acquire: Found inside a hanging body, just outside the Church of Benediction. It contains the whole set: Oathseeker Knight Greaves, Oathseeker Knight Gauntlets, Oathseeker Knight Armor, and Oathseeker Knight Helm. It also contains Pata weapon. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

armors.name: Verdigris Helm
armors.description: Helm made from an unusual metal known as verdigris. Verdigris is said to be the gift of an outer god. Possessed of an enormously hefty yet supple strength thanks to its rusted nature.
armors.how_to_acquire: Complete Moore's questline

armors.name: Pelt of Ralva
armors.description: The pelt of Ralva the Great Red Bear, worn upon the head without modification. Enhances incantations of what is jokingly called "Bear Communion." This untreated hide, won at the end of a bloody bout, is just the thing to make a wild bear out of a warrior.
armors.how_to_acquire: This is a helmet type of armor that can be obtained after defeating Ralva the Great Red Bear. It is known to enhance incantations of what is jokingly called "Bear Communion." [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

armors.name: Fang Helm
armors.description: Helm of Red Bear, whose name is lost to madness. The cheek guards are shaped after lion fangs. Perhaps his fascination with the untamed strength of the wild stemmed from his past as a Redmane.
armors.how_to_acquire: Armor piece drops upon defeating the Red Bear located at the Northern Nameless Mausoleum. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

armors.name: Thiollier's Mask
armors.description: A mask upon which is carved a tranquil sleeping face. The silver hair is arranged in the same style as St. Trina's, increasing arcane. Just once, Thiollier was granted the sweet repose of velvety sleep. The remainder of his days would be spent attempting to recapture it.
armors.lore: A mask upon which is carved a tranquil sleeping face.
armors.how_to_acquire: Summon Thiollier during the battle at the end of his questline, then loot his body in the boss arena after the fight

armors.name: High Priest Hat
armors.description: The hat of Count Ymir, High Priest. The circular design at the top represents the Greater Will and its lightless abyss, imparting increased intelligence and arcane to the wearer. Though Count Ymir instructed Rellana in the sorcerous arts, he abandoned his allegiance to the moon. "It was merely the closest of the celestial bodies. Nothing more."
armors.lore: The hat of Count Ymir, High Priest.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by Count Ymir, Mother of Fingers, who can be found in the Cathedral of Manus Metyr after interacting with the throne, you can only find Count Ymir there after you have defeated Metyr, Mother of Fingers. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

armors.name: Caterpillar Mask
armors.description: Grotesque mask constructed from countless solidified caterpillars. A ritual implement of the greater potentates of Bonny Village. Used to ward off thoughts of impurity, doubt, temptation, and other wickednesses one is vulnerable to while absorbed in divine ritual.
armors.lore: Grotesque mask constructed from countless solidified caterpillars. A ritual implement of the greater potentates of Bonny Village.
armors.how_to_acquire: Complete Hornsent quest.

armors.name: Dancer's Hood
armors.description: Bright-red hood of the Ranah dancers. Enhances the power of dancing attacks. The dance of Ranah is one of burning passion, and the most passionate dancers never allow their fiery dance to end, losing even their names as they dance on. To see the passion fade is to see the dancer's flame extinguished.
armors.special_effect: Enhances the power of dancing attacks by 2.5%.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by defeating Dancer of Ranah at the Southern Nameless Mausoleum [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]

armors.name: Helm of Night
armors.description: Bottomless black helm, cool to the touch.Flowing lines in the seeming shape of a fingerprint adorn the surface. Imprisons the wearer in utterly lightless dark.Bestowed upon those born deep underground, ordaining them as Swordhands of Night.
armors.how_to_acquire: Bonny Gaol: Use the jar lift near the bridge twice to reach the top level of the gaol. First, hop on the jar, go to the bridge level, and activate the switch. Ride the jar lift for the second time to go to the top level. You can find the Night Set on a corpse laying on top of a table. [See SOTE Elden Ring DLC Map] [Video Link]

armors.name: Igon's Helm
armors.description: Helm of the broken drake warrior Igon, from a set of armor comprised of a miscellany of parts. This tattered protective-wear is shaped like a bugle. The poor scavenger of battlefields found honor through Dragon Communion.
armors.how_to_acquire: Loot Igon after defeating Bayle the Dread.

armors.name: Igon's Helm (Altered)
armors.description: Helm of the broken drake warrior Igon, from a set of armor comprised of a miscellany of parts. Patched with scraps of cloth. The poor scavenger of battlefields found honor through Dragon Communion.
armors.lore: Helm of the broken drake warrior Igon, from a set of armor comprised of a miscellany of parts. Patched with scraps of cloth.
armors.how_to_acquire: Alter Igon's Helm at any Site of Grace

armors.name: Wise Man's Mask
armors.description: The iron mask of Sir Ansbach, giving the appearance of a quiet, wise, old bearded man. But an old fear lurks beneath, together with the cold, unflinching discipline that once honed his blade, now employed to enhance Blood Oath and dynastic skills.
armors.lore: The iron mask of Sir Ansbach, giving the appearance of a quiet, wise, old bearded man.
armors.special_effect: Enhances Blood Oath and dynastic skills by 5%.
armors.how_to_acquire: Complete Sir Ansbach's questline all the way through the end, and side with him when facing Leda, and then Promised Consort Radahn/ Radahn, Consort of Miquella. After the fight is over, Sir Ansbach's body will be near the site of grace, alongside with his equipment and his Incantation. [Map Link]

armors.name: Freyja's Helm
armors.description: Golden helm of Redmane Freyja, member of General Radahn's most distinguished knights. A hideous scarlet wound was once hewn into the center of her face. Later, Miquella gently put his lips to it and the unfading scar became the compass that Freyja would thereafter follow.
armors.how_to_acquire: Drop by Redmane Freyja.

armors.name: Helm of Solitude
armors.description: Steel helm of the Knights of the Solitary Gaol. Part of a heavy armor set that covers the whole body in overlapping plates of steel. The nameless mausoleums of the realm of shadow are said to hold the spirits of warriors who lost their names, or their hearts.
armors.lore:
Steel helm of the Knights of the Solitary Gaol.
Part of a heavy armor set that covers the whole body in overlapping plates of steel.
armors.how_to_acquire: Can be obtained after defeating the Blackgaol Knight found inside Northern Nameless Mausoleum. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

armors.name: Messmer Soldier Helm
armors.description: Helm worn by soldiers who serve Messmer the Impaler. The iron helm features a visor. Though the engraving upon the forehead is a Scadutree design, it is etched in gold. A small consolation to those forced to wage a war without grace or honor.
armors.lore: Helm worn by soldiers who serve Messmer the Impaler. The iron helm features a visor.
armors.how_to_acquire: Drop from Messmer Soldiers

armors.name: Black Knight Helm
armors.description: Helm worn by the Black Knights, servants of Messmer the Impaler. Black iron ornamented with gold. A rotten odor stubbornly clings to it. Perhaps it arises from the tainted nature of the blood that splattered upon it. Or perhaps it is the wearer's own blackened soul, festering after endless slaughter.
armors.lore: Helm worn by the Black Knights, servants of Messmer the Impaler. Black iron ornamented with gold. A rotten odor stubbornly clings to it.
armors.how_to_acquire: Black Knight Set pieces are dropped from Black Knights, found throughout the Lands of Shadow.

armors.name: Rakshasa Helm
armors.description: Helm of Rakshasa, soaked in the spurting blood of her victims. Tatters of ragged cloth jut out haphazardly, as if her lust for carnage threatens to break free.Increases damage dealt to foes, but greatly increases damage taken by the wearer.Cut down and devour. Only those who repeat the cycle without rest can truly subvert the self and become Rakshasa.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by Rakshasa in Eastern Nameless Mausoleum. This area can only be accessed by using the ladder in Shadow Keep to get down to a special teleport coffin (this Elden Ring Map location). This will take you to Ruins of Unte and you must follow the cliffs downstream and then carefully drop down to bottom level to reach the mausoleum. [Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

armors.name: Fire Knight Helm
armors.description: Pointed helm of the Fire Knights under Messmer the Impaler's personal command. Slightly increases maximum HP, stamina, and maximum equip load. Each and every knight hailed from a renowned family of the Erdtree's upper echelons, but were shunned and chased from their homes after pledging allegiance to Messmer as their master.
armors.lore: Pointed helm of the Fire Knights under Messmer the Impaler's personal command.
armors.special_effect: Slightly increases maximum HP by 2%, Stamina by 5%, and Equip Load by 4%.
armors.how_to_acquire: Drop by Fire Knights in the Shadow Keep

armors.name: Death Mask Helm
armors.description: Helm of Wego, elder among the Fire Knights. Two warped death masks stacked one atop the other. Reduces FP used to summon spirits. Gnawed at by loneliness, the old man turned his attention to the spirituality of Messmer's flame, using it in a rite of resurrection. Yet the soulless bodies he brought to life were no comfort to poor Wego.
armors.lore: Helm of Wego, elder among the Fire Knights. Two warped death masks stacked one atop the other.
armors.special_effect: Reduces FP to summon spirits by 12%
armors.how_to_acquire: Drops from a Fire Knight miniboss in the cathedral area of Shadow Keep, after draining out the water.

armors.name: Winged Serpent Helm
armors.description: Helm of Kood, captain of the Fire Knights. A winged serpent perches atop it. Enhances Fire Knight skills. The winged serpent is the token creature of Messmer's military forces. It is a wise friend which keeps the base serpent at bay and holds its power in check.
armors.lore: Helm of Kood, captain of the Fire Knights. A winged serpent perches atop it.
armors.how_to_acquire: Shadow Keep: Sixth Floor: Climb the statues once you've used the lever to move them. Head outside, turn right and head up the stairs, turn left to find a Fire Knight at the end of the bridge. Drops this item and Ash of War: Flame Spear. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

armors.name: Salza's Hood
armors.description: Hood of Salza, sage of the Fire Knights.A prodigious amount of cloth wound around it, giving the impression of a greatly swollen head, and wearing it increases intelligence.A disciple of the elder Wego, he refused to burn down an old ruin, at the risk of his own life.
armors.how_to_acquire: From the West Rampart Site of Grace, take the bridge all the way. Use Torrent to avoid being trappped in the Rain of Fire. Defeat the Fire Knight at the end to obtain this and Rain of Fire. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

armors.name: Leather Headband
armors.description: Headband worn by highland warriors, made of woven leather. The white favor represents their home settlement. Highland warriors are known to be hunters of bears; to them, there is no act more glorious than the subjugation of a savage beast.
armors.lore: Headband worn by highland warriors, made of woven leather. The white favor represents their home settlement.
armors.how_to_acquire: To the northwest of the Ravine North Site of Grace, there is a forest inhabited by runebears. At the center of this forest, you'll find a large stone with several items on it, this whole armor set is at the top of the stone. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

armors.name: Leather Crown
armors.description: Helm worn by highland warriors, pieced together using leather. The white favor represents their home settlement. Highland warriors are known to be hunters of bears; to them, there is no act more glorious than the subjugation of a savage beast.
armors.how_to_acquire: Found laying on the grounds in the middle of the woods, alongside the rest of the Highland Warrior Set. [Map Link]

armors.name: Death Knight Helm
armors.description: Golden helm of the Death Knights, whose own death masks served as the visards of their armor. Enhances skills and incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult. The decayed golden wheel that adorns it represents their unbroken loyalty to Godwyn, he who became Prince of Death.
armors.lore: Golden helm of the Death Knights, whose own death masks served as the visards of their armor.
armors.special_effect: Enhances skills and incantations of the ancient dragon cult by 2%.
armors.how_to_acquire: Darklight Catacombs, on a Death Knight corpse

armors.name: Curseblade Mask
armors.description: A mask affixed with a crown of tangled horns, worn by those who would invoke divinity. Divine invocation heightens the dexterity of the wearer, but causes the blessing of the Erdtree to become nauseating, reducing the restorative effect of drinking from a flask of sacred tears. Focus is also troubled by wearing this mask.
armors.lore: A mask affixed with a crown of tangled horns, worn by those who would invoke divinity.
armors.special_effect: Increases Dexterity by +5, but reduces the flask value by -7%
armors.how_to_acquire: Drop by Curseblade enemies.

armors.name: Messmer's Helm
armors.description: Black helm of Messmer the Impaler, crowned with two intertwined winged serpents.Slightly enhances incantations of Messmer's flame as well as Fire Knight skills.The winged snakes were Messmer's constant companions.They were there when the base serpent was sealed away behind his eye. They were there through his eternity of suffering. They will accompany him yet, in his hideous new form born when he destroyed the grace granted by his mother. They have accepted his fate as much as he.
armors.special_effect: Slightly enhances incantations of Messmer's fire and Fire Knight skills by 3%.
armors.how_to_acquire: Purchase from Finger Reader Enia at Roundtable Hold after defeating Messmer the Impaler

armors.name: Messmer's Helm (Altered)
armors.description: Black helm of Messmer the Impaler, crowned with two intertwined winged serpents. Slightly enhances incantations of Messmer's fire as well as Fire Knight skills.The winged snakes were Messmer's constant companions.They were there when the base serpent was sealed away behind his eye. They were there through his eternity of suffering. They will accompany him yet, in his hideous new form born when he destroyed the grace granted by his mother. They have accepted his fate as much as he.
armors.lore: Black helm of Messmer the Impaler, crowned with two intertwined winged serpents. Slightly enhances incantations of Messmer's fire as well as Fire Knight skills.
armors.special_effect: Slightly enhances incantations of Messmer's fire and Fire Knight skills by 3%.
armors.how_to_acquire: Alter Messmer's Helm at any site of grace.

armors.name: Gravebird Helm
armors.description: Stone helm with a tinge of green. One of a set of armor pieces cast in the image of the Gravebird. Empowers spells which summon rings of spectral light. Gravebirds are ancient golems, created to guard the spiritgraves built where all manners of Death ultimately drift.
armors.special_effect: Empowers spells which summon rings of spectral light by 15%.
armors.how_to_acquire: From the Spiral Rise site of grace, climb the spire until you get the elevator shortcut back down. Ride the lift down and jump off halfway into a central altar. [Map Link]

armors.name: Common Soldier Helm
armors.description: Helm of the rank-and-file soldiers of Messmer's army. A pitch-dark soot clings to it, much like the inner faces of the men who wore them.
armors.lore: Helm of the rank-and-file soldiers of Messmer's army.
armors.how_to_acquire: Drop by soldiers in Castle Ensis

armors.name: Horned Warrior Helm
armors.description: Helm featuring a crown of sturdy tangled horns, allowing the wearer to invoke divinity. Attire of the horned warriors, keepers of the tower. Divine invocation bolsters the strength of the wearer, but causes the blessing of the Erdtree to become nauseating, reducing the restorative effect of drinking from a flask of sacred tears. Focus is also troubled by wearing this helm.
armors.lore: Helm featuring a crown of sturdy tangled horns, allowing the wearer to invoke divinity. Attire of the horned warriors, keepers of the tower.
armors.special_effect: Increases Strength by +5, but decreases healing from Flask of Crimson Tears by -7%.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped from Horned Warriors

armors.name: Divine Beast Helm
armors.description: A helm of tangled horn attached to a divine beast mask, allowing the wearer to invoke divinity. Worn by divine beast warriors; the chosen of the horned warriors. Divine invocation heightens intensity of the storm alongside strength and dexterity, but reduces the restorative effect of drinking from a flask of sacred tears. Focus is also troubled by wearing this helm.
armors.lore: A helm of tangled horn attached to a divine beast mask, allowing the wearer to invoke divinity. Worn by divine beast warriors; the chosen of the horned warriors.
armors.special_effect: Heightens intensity of the storm by 4%, boost Strength by +3 and Dexerity by +3, but reduces restorative effect of sacred tears by -9% and lower focus by -45
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by Divine Beast Warriors, Enir Ilim

armors.name: Divine Bird Helm
armors.description: A helm of tangled horn attached to a divine bird mask, allowing the wearer to invoke divinity. Worn by divine bird warriors; the very first of all horned warriors. Divine invocation heightens the power of divine bird feathers alongside strength and dexterity, but reduces the restorative effect of drinking from a flask of sacred tears. Focus is also troubled by wearing this helm.
armors.lore: A helm of tangled horn attached to a divine bird mask, allowing the wearer to invoke divinity. Worn by divine bird warriors; the very first of all horned warriors.
armors.special_effect: Heightens the power of divine bird feathers by 10%, boost Strength by +3 and Dexerity by +4, but reduces restorative effect of sacred tears by -9% and lower focus by -45
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by Divine Bird Warriors

armors.name: Rellana's Helm
armors.description: Ornate helm of Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight, fashioned from silver steel. Rennala, head of the royal family of Caria, was said to have given her younger sister, who renounced her lineage to chase after Messmer, a gift of lustrous black hair.
armors.how_to_acquire: The complete set (Rellana's Set) can be bought from Enia in the Roundtable Hold upon defeating Rellana Twin Moon Knight.

armors.name: Young Lion's Helm
armors.description: The golden helm worn by Radahn in his younger years. Proudly displaying his heroic red hair, it is fitting attire for a lion. When Malenia, Blade of Miquella, let the rotflower blossom in Aeonia, Radahn heard a murmur in his ear "Miquella awaits thee, O promised consort."
armors.lore: The golden helm worn by Radahn in his younger years. Proudly displaying his heroic red hair, it is fitting attire for a lion.
armors.how_to_acquire: Purchase from Finger Reader Enia at Roundtable Hold after defeating Promised Consort Radahn / Radahn, Consort of Miquella in Enir-Ilim [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

armors.name: Circlet of Light
armors.description: The circlet of light which adorned Miquella's head as he returned in divine aspect. It has begun to fade into nothingness. Slightly boosts intelligence, faith, and arcane, while also boosting the power of Miquella's light. This circle was to be the very foundation upon which Miquella's age of compassion would be built, should it have ever come to pass.
armors.lore: The circlet of light which adorned Miquella's head as he returned in divine aspect. It has begun to fade into nothingness.
armors.special_effect: +1 to Intelligence, Faith, and ArcaneBoosts the power of Miquella's Light
armors.how_to_acquire: Obtained after defeating Promised Consort Radhan

armors.name: Shadow Militiaman Helm
armors.description: Helm as dark as shadow, worn by vulgar militiamen. Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. What better place than the realms of shadow then, for such an army?
armors.lore: Helm as dark as shadow, worn by vulgar militiamen.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by the Shadow men

armors.name: Divine Beast Head
armors.description: Ritual headwear in the form of a divine beast's head, used to perform the lion dance. Worn by the very finest of the sculpted keepers. Alas, it no longer responds to the old woman's earnest prayer. Divine invocation heightens intensity of the storm alongside strength and dexterity, but reduces the restorative effect of drinking from a flask of sacred tears. Focus is also troubled by wearing this headwear.
armors.lore: Ritual headwear in the form of a divine beast's head, used to perform the lion dance. Worn by the very finest of the sculpted keepers. Alas, it no longer responds to the old woman's earnest prayer.
armors.special_effect: Heightens intensity of the storm by 10%, boost Strength by +4 and Dexerity by +4, but reduces restorative effect of sacred tears by -11% and lower focus by -63
armors.how_to_acquire: The Divine Beast Dancing Lion drops this Helm upon defeat. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

armors.name: St. Trina's Blossom
armors.description: St. Trina's life withered and fell, as fleeting as the seasons. At her last, she left a single water lily. Slightly boosts max FP. Despite the velvety-purple hue, the flower is in no way poisonousit merely blooms in quietude.
armors.lore: St. Trina's life withered and fell, as fleeting as the seasons. At her last, she left a single water lily.
armors.how_to_acquire: Garden of Deep Purple: After completing Thiollier and St. Trina's questline, return to her cave in Garden of Deep Purple. You can pick up this item from her fallen body. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Elden Ring DLC Map]

armors.name: Crucible Hammer-Helm
armors.description: Helm worn by Devonia, longest-serving of the Crucible Knights. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations. It is said Devonia quested in search of the Crucible's origin, and departed from the lands of the Erdtree alone.
armors.lore: Helm worn by Devonia, longest-serving of the Crucible Knights.
armors.special_effect: Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible Incantations.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by Devonia, Crucible Knight [Map Link]

armors.name: Greatjar
armors.description: A greatjar which fits comfortably over the head when upturned. Attire of the shamans who perform their worship at gaols. Increases the power of thrown pots of all sizes. They offer their prayers to the innards of the greatjars, such that they might be reborn one day into sainthood. This is the cycle of death and rebirth, taken into the hands of mortal men.
armors.special_effect: Increases the power of all thrown pots by 16%.
armors.how_to_acquire: Belurat Gaol: After leaving the jar labyrinth, you will pass a small bridge and fight 3 Mutated Prisoners, on quite a large platform. In order to advance the dungeon, you have to step on the jar at the end of the area, but don't do that. Instead, turn right to find another jar on a slightly lower level. Step on it, and it will take you high. Once there, jump from platform to platform, and once the area, opens up, the item is on a pedestal, beware of the enemies.

armors.name: Imp Head (Lion)
armors.description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling a lion in appearance, life force faintly clings to it.
armors.lore: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.
armors.how_to_acquire: Scorpion River Catacombs. Can be found on top of a platform if you ride one of the two spike trap platform lifts. [Video Link]

armors.name: Alberich's Pointed Hat
armors.description: Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner. Set with red glintstones said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery. Alberiches was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.
armors.lore: Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.
armors.how_to_acquire: The entire Alberich's Set can be found in the main hall of the Fortified manor in Leyndell, Royal Capital, near the Fortified Manor, first floor Site of Grace. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Alberich's Pointed Hat (Altered)
armors.description: Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.
armors.how_to_acquire: Boc the Seamster can alter the original Alberich's Pointed Hat if you have it in your possession.

armors.name: Albinauric Mask
armors.description: Made from the largely unaltered hide of a young Albinauric.Raises arcane, but reduces the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears.A far cry from godskin, this Albinauric hide mask is the product of malicious mockery.
armors.lore: Mask made from the largely unaltered hide of a young Albinauric.
armors.special_effect: +4 Arcane,reduces the HP recovered from Flask of Crimson Tears by 10%.
armors.how_to_acquire: Found in Volcano Manor near the Guest Hall grace. Ascend the stairs to the top floor of the building. Head outside and take the ladder to your left onto the roof. Go to the back of the roof and jump off the right side to a balcony, then enter a room with an Omenkiller, the Albinauric Staff, and the Albinauric Mask. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: All-Knowing Helm
armors.description: Helm set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.
armors.lore:
Helm set with countless eyes and ears.
Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.
armors.how_to_acquire: The entire All-Knowing Set is dropped by Sir Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing upon defeat. He is fought in Leyndell, Capital of Ash, an alternate version of the Royal Capital accessible only after making significant progress in the story. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Aristocrat Hat
armors.description: Leather hat decorated with a withered feather.Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.
armors.lore:
Leather hat decorated with a withered feather.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.
armors.how_to_acquire: Drops from Soldier Aristocrats that can be found wandering the roads of most areas.

armors.name: Aristocrat Headband
armors.description: Valuable headband featuring fine goldwork.Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital.Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are pitiful product of unending life.
armors.lore:
Valuable headband featuring fine goldwork.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital.
armors.how_to_acquire: Rare chance to drop from Aristocrat Sorcerers seen in larger groups of Aristocrat enemies that wander the roads of most areas.Easily farmed in Kingsrealm Ruins, south of the Road to the Manor site of grace.

armors.name: Ash-of-War Scarab
armors.description: Gray scarab worn directly on the head.These scarabs roll clumps of Ashes of War during their labors.Slightly reduces the FP cost of skills, but increases damage taken.
armors.lore:
Gray scarab worn directly on the head.
These scarabs roll clumps of Ashes of War during their labors.
armors.special_effect: Reduces the FP cost of skills by ~14%. Increases damage taken by ~5%.
armors.how_to_acquire: Behind the waygate on the Limgrave Tower Bridge that takes you to the Divine Tower of Limgrave on a broken section of the bridge. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Astrologer Hood
armors.description: Hood fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.
armors.lore:
Hood fashioned from supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.
armors.how_to_acquire: Starting Equipment for the Astrologer ClassCan be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant in Liurnia of the Lakes for 1,000 Runes. Elden Ring Map here.

armors.name: Azur's Glintstone Crown
armors.description: Crown of Azur, primeval current sorcerer, set with a prominent blue-green glintstone.This crown replaced Azur's brain and skull altogether, and now, removed from his body, it is all but dead. What power remains within raises the potency of Azur's primeval current sorceries at the cost of additional FP consumption.
armors.lore: Crown of Azur, primeval current sorcerer, set with a prominent blue-green glintstone.
armors.special_effect: Increases the damage of Comet Azur by 15%, and Glintstone Cometshard and Comet by 10%. Increases FP consumption from sorceries by 15%.
armors.how_to_acquire: The complete Azur's Glintstone Set is found at Azur's location after completing Sorceress Sellen's questline where you side with her. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Bandit Mask
armors.description: Mask of black cloth that covers the mouth. Favored by bandits for hiding their faces, it also provides some protection against poison.
armors.how_to_acquire: Starting Equipment for the Bandit Class.Can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant in North Limgrave for 1500 Runes. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Banished Knight Helm
armors.description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. Perhaps the deep-red scarf was used to block the winds, for on the outskirts, the winds bite with a stinging fierceness.
armors.lore:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by Banished Knights in Stormveil Castle.

armors.name: Banished Knight Helm (Altered)
armors.description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.
armors.lore:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
armors.how_to_acquire: Stormveil Castle. Looted from the Banished Knight located next to the Chapel in the northwest section, where Sorcerer Rogier is located.

armors.name: Beast Champion Helm
armors.description: Silver helm engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.The beasts, their eyes and ears covered, represent an oath: "See nothing, hear nothing, doubt nothing, and carry on, along the path set in stone."
armors.lore:
Silver helm engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.
armors.how_to_acquire: The entire Beast Champion Set drops from Knight Bernahl upon death. Either defeat him at Warmaster's Shack or defeat the Recusant Bernahl invasion in Crumbling Farum Azula. Location in Elden Ring Map here.

armors.name: Black Dumpling
armors.description: "Mask forced on a victim's head to lend torture an extra degree of cruelty.It magnifies one's fears and makes them acutely aware of all forms of pain.Raises attack power when the wearer suffers from madness.When the Black Dumpling goes on, the torturer no longer seeks answers; only to inflict suffering without hope of relief."
armors.special_effect: Raises attack (+10 % to all damage) when the wearer suffers from madness for 60 seconds
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by the enemies found at Volcano Manor who wear it.

armors.name: Black Hood
armors.description: Hood of lusterless black fabric that conceals its wearer's identity.In this world, there is very little that must necessarily be known.
armors.how_to_acquire: In the Sage's Cave, in a treasure chest behind an illusory wall. See it on the Elden Ring Map here.

armors.name: Black Knife Hood
armors.description: Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.
armors.lore: Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins.
armors.how_to_acquire: The entire Black Knife Set is found on a corpse under an archway behind Ordina, Liturgical Town in Consecrated Grounds. Map Link.

armors.name: Black Wolf Mask
armors.description: A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf.Relic of an assassin who assumed the guise of Ranni the Witch's loyal shadow. The likeness is striking.
armors.lore: A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf.
armors.how_to_acquire: Found behind Seluvis's Rise, reached by running and jumping up the crumbling part of the wall near the entrance to the tower. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Blackflame Monk Hood
armors.description: Mail hood of iron links covering a headband engraved with black flames.Attire of the Blackflame Monks.The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.
armors.lore:
Mail hood of iron links covering a headband
engraved with flames. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.
armors.how_to_acquire: Drops from Blackflame Monks

armors.name: Blackguard's Iron Mask
armors.description: Iron mask forced on convicted prisoners.Worn by the blackguard Big Boggart.To Boggart, the mask made him all the more threatening, and helped him get what he wanted. But it was also a mirror of his emptiness.
armors.lore:
Iron mask forced on convicted prisoners.
Worn by the blackguard Big Boggart.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by the merchant Blackguard Big Boggart upon defeat. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Bloodhound Knight Helm
armors.description: Metal helm with a pointed beak. Worn by the Bloodhound Knights. The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.
armors.lore:
Metal helm with a pointed beak.
Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.
armors.how_to_acquire: The entire Bloodhound Knight Set is dropped by the Bloodhound Knight guarding the Gelmir Knight Set pickup in the Gelmir Hero's Grave. See it on the Elden Ring Map here.

armors.name: Bloodsoaked Mask
armors.description: Mask formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood. Even the most ghastly cover is more inviting than the festering face beneath.
armors.lore: Mask formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood.
armors.how_to_acquire: Looted from a corpse in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds near the Underground Roadside site of grace. Elden Ring Map here.

armors.name: Blue Cloth Cowl
armors.description: Cowl of a nomadic warrior. The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer. Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay. Warriors must remain ever-drifting.
armors.lore:
Cowl of a nomadic warrior.
The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer.
armors.how_to_acquire: Starting Equipment for the Warrior Class.Purchasable from Isolated Merchant (Raya Lucaria) Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Blue Festive Hood
armors.description: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.Use of this hood, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.
armors.lore: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by the blue clothed dancers in Dominula, Windmill Village.

armors.name: Blue Silver Mail Hood
armors.description: Chainmail hood crafted with blue silver.Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.
armors.lore:
Chainmail hood crafted with blue silver.
Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.
armors.how_to_acquire: Albinauric Wolfback Archers found in the Consecrated Snowfield, as well as the Ordina Gaol, drop the Blue Silver Set pieces.One that is easily farmed can be found shortly north of the Consecrated Snowfield site of grace.

armors.name: Brave's Cord Circlet
armors.description: Warrior's headband of woven leather.Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.The small flags, white cloths and sheaves of wheatoften found hung from these headbands areprayers of farewell from the people of their home.In bidding farewell to warriors departing ona journey from which they aren't like to return,this small act offers only meager relief.
armors.lore:
Warrior's headband of woven leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.
armors.how_to_acquire: Currently unavailable

armors.name: Brave's Leather Helm
armors.description: Battlewear wrapped in thick leather.Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.
armors.lore:
Battlewear wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.
armors.how_to_acquire: Currently unobtainable.

armors.name: Briar Helm
armors.description: Battered iron helm from a foreign land.Worn by Elemer of the Briar.The winding, rusted iron briars are the mark of the guilty, and typically indicate a sentence of death. They also cause this armor to deal damage when performing dodge rolls.Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.
armors.special_effect: Deals damage when rolling into targets. Damage increases exponentially with more briar pieces.
armors.how_to_acquire: Purchased from the Enia in Roundtable Hold after defeating Elemer of the Briar in The Shaded Castle

armors.name: Bull-Goat Helm
armors.description: Great Horned Tragoth's helm, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provides high poise.Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid
armors.lore: Great Horned Tragoth's helm, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provides high poise.
armors.how_to_acquire: Can be found after killing Patches' assassination target for the Volcano Manor, Great Horned Tragoth. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Carian Knight Helm
armors.description: Helm of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family.The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.
armors.lore: Helm of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family.
armors.how_to_acquire: From the Church of the Cuckoo site of grace, travel to the rotating lift section. On the right side of the gate's entrance, look down as you are hugging the wall to find a platform that you can drop to. Walk on the narrow path and you'll notice a group of Glintstone Zombies worshipping a statue. The entire Carian Knight Set is found at the foot of that statue..

armors.name: Cerulean Tear Scarab
armors.description: Blue scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of cerulean tears during their labors.Slightly increases the recovery effects of the Flask of Cerulean Tears, but increases damage taken.
armors.lore:
Blue scarab worn directly on the head.
These scarabs roll clumps of cerulean tears during their labors.
armors.special_effect: Increases the recovery effects of the Flask of Cerulean Tears by 10%, but increases damage taken.
armors.how_to_acquire: Sellia, Town of Sorcery in Caelid. Found on a corpse on top of a roof in the northeast section of town. Requires platforming across the rooftops. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Chain Coif
armors.description: Coif made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.
armors.how_to_acquire: Can be found at Church of Elleh, purchased from Merchant Kale. It costs 1000 Runes. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Champion Headband
armors.description: Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest. Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.
armors.lore:
Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest.
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.
armors.how_to_acquire: Starting Equipment for the Hero Class.Can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant in south Caelid for 1,000 Runes. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Cleanrot Helm
armors.description: Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by Cleanrot Knights in the Swamp of Aeonia, The Shaded Castle, or Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree.

armors.name: Cleanrot Helm (Altered)
armors.description: Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.
armors.how_to_acquire: After completing Boc's Questline, you (or Boc) can alter Cleanrot Helm into Cleanrot Helm (Altered).

armors.name: Commoner's Headband
armors.description: A headband that holds cloth in place.Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.
armors.lore:
A headband that holds cloth in place.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.
armors.how_to_acquire: The Commoner's Headband is found on a corpse in Mt. Gelmir. After the Temple of Eiglay site of grace, take the elevator up and jump off the outside balcony into the area below. Follow the path past the Abductor Virgin into the window of the manor. Continue until you are on a walkway overlooking the lake the lava lake with Serpent statues on the right side. The Commoner's Headpiece is on a corpse on the head of the second statue. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Commoner's Headband (Altered)
armors.description: A headband with the cloth removed.Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.
armors.lore:
A headband with the cloth removed.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by Commoner enemies found in Stormveil Castle, Leyndell, Royal Capital, and other areas of the map.The non-altered Commoner's Headband is looted from a specific corpse and neither piece can be altered by the player.

armors.name: Confessor Hood
armors.description: Black hood for blending in with the darkness. Worn by church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.
armors.lore:
Black hood for blending in with the darkness.
Worn by church confessors.
armors.how_to_acquire: Starting Equipment for the Confessor Class.Can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant in Mt. Gelmir for 1000 Runes. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Confessor Hood (Altered)
armors.description: Cloth headwrap worn under a church confessor's black hood.Such hoods are made for blending in with the darkness.
armors.lore:
Cloth headwrap worn under a church confessor's black hood.
Such hoods are made for blending in with the darkness.
armors.how_to_acquire: After completing Boc's Questline, you (or Boc) can alter Confessor Hood into Confessor Hood (Altered).

armors.name: Consort's Mask
armors.description: Mask worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor, in the image of a foreign queen.Increase dexterity.Long ago, when Rykard first set eyes on Tanith, she was working as a dancer in a foreign land. Soon, he made her his consort.She was the only human to remain by his side when he became the serpent of blasphemy.In that moment, Tanith was truly charmed by him.
armors.lore:
Mask worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor, in the image of a foreign queen.
Increases dexterity.
armors.how_to_acquire: Looted from the corpse of Tanith after attacking her and defeating the summoned Tannith's Knight near the Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy site of grace in Volcano Manor, Altus Plateau. See it on the Elden Ring Map here.

armors.name: Crimson Hood
armors.description: A hooded cloak of vivid crimson. Worn by expatriated royalty. Increases vigor. Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on journeys without specific orders, to faraway lands from which they would never return. In other words, the gift of a cloak made it easier for undesirable to be on their way. Roderika never once saw the guidance of grace.
armors.how_to_acquire: Stormveil Castle: It is found where the Chrysalids' Memento was initially found after unlocking Spirit Tuning. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Crimson Tear Scarab
