armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by killing Vulgar Militiamen enemies found around the Bestial Sanctum and Farum Greatbridge sites of grace.

armors.name: Godskin Noble Trousers
armors.description: Trousers made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.Subcutaneous fat makes them plump and soft.Worn by Godskin Nobles.Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.
armors.lore:
Trousers made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Subcutaneous fat makes them plump and soft.
Worn by Godskin Nobles.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by Godskin Noble Bossfight. Elden Ring Map here.

armors.name: Depraved Perfumer Trousers
armors.description: Trousers worn by depraved perfumers.These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.
armors.lore: Trousers worn by depraved perfumers.
armors.how_to_acquire: The Depraved Perfumer Set pieces can be farmed from the Depraved Perfumer enemies located around The Shaded Castle.

armors.name: Old Sorcerer's Legwraps
armors.description: Ragged waistcloth that extends to the thighs.Common amongst old-fashioned sorcerers.
armors.lore:
Ragged waistcloth that extends to the thighs.
Common amongst old-fashioned sorcerers.
armors.how_to_acquire: Old Sorcerer's Legwraps can be found after completing Sorceress Sellen's Questline, return to Lusat's location in the Sellia Hideaway. The legwraps will be there, along with the rest of his set for the taking. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Ragged Loincloth
armors.description: Greaves pieced together from scavenged metal.
armors.lore: Greaves pieced together from scavenged metal.
armors.how_to_acquire: Not currently obtainable.

armors.name: War Surgeon Trousers
armors.description: "Bloodstained trousers of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood none were able to tame the accursed blood.None but Varre, that is; though he was an exception."
armors.lore: Bloodstained trousers of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by killing one of three Nameless White Mask NPC invaders in the Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum area of Siofra River, northwest of the Palace Approach Ledge-Road site of grace, in the blood filled lake. This one can be found adjacent to the Giant Crow enemy near the blood filled lake drop off.

armors.name: Royal Remains Greaves
armors.description: Greaves graced with gold human bones.Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord - the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.
armors.lore:
Greaves graced with gold human bones.
Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.
armors.special_effect: Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.
armors.how_to_acquire: Upon attaining the Haligtree Secret Medallion (Right), Ensha of the Royal Remains will invade the players world the next time they travel back to Roundtable Hold. The full Royal Remains Set is acquired after beating him.

armors.name: Brave's Legwraps
armors.description: Greaves wrapped in thick leather.Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.Has a fur lining which excels at keepingthe cold at bay.
armors.lore:
Greaves wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.
armors.how_to_acquire: The Brave's Legwraps Leg Armor is currently unobtainable.

armors.name: Malenia's Greaves
armors.description: Greaves made of unalloyed gold. Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk. "My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a godhe is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."
armors.lore:
Greaves made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.
armors.how_to_acquire: Purchased from Enia for 12,000 after defeating Malenia Blade of Miquella.

armors.name: Fingerprint Greaves
armors.description: Iron greaves singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?
armors.lore:
Iron greaves singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.
armors.how_to_acquire: Lord Contender's Evergaol: Dropped by Roundtable Knight Vyke upon defeat.Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Omen Greaves
armors.description: Malformed greaves resembling an Omen with its horns cut off. Worn by the Dung Eater, their form is a vision of the landscape of his mind, and of his appearance as he wished to see it.The heart of an Omen without the body to match: could there be any crueler existence? What does it matter, then, if the curse claims it all?
armors.how_to_acquire: The Omen set can be found after killing the Dung Eater in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds at the Leyndell Royal Capital.Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Battlemage Legwraps
armors.description: Legwraps worn by the scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.
armors.lore: Legwraps worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.
armors.how_to_acquire: This piece is dropped by Battlemage enemies.The entire Battlemage Set drops from a particular Battlemage enemy, located east of West Windmill Pasture, on a hill near the northern end of the collapsed bridge. Elden Ring Map Link.

armors.name: Traveler's Boots
armors.description: Light yet sturdy leather boots.Worn by young women who set off into the world to confront their fate.
armors.lore: Light yet sturdy leather boots.
armors.how_to_acquire: Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree: The entire Traveler's Set is found deep underground in a side room with a large orange flower, adjacent to the Haligtree Roots site of grace. Elden Ring Map Link

armors.name: Gold Waistwrap
armors.description: Waistwrap made in the image of Erdtree branches.A minimal adornment made by Lord Goldmask's disciples.Those disciples have long since left him.
armors.how_to_acquire: Gold Waistwrap can be found on Goldmask's body after the completion of Brother Corhyn's questline. Head south from the Capital of Ash site of grace and go down the small path in the direction of the colosseum. Go past the plant enemies and stick to the left and you will find Goldmask. Look the rune from him, and reset the area and return to find the rest of his set on his body.Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Leather Boots
armors.description: Lightweight and battle-proven leather boots worn by a savvy soldier.Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.
armors.how_to_acquire: Murkwater Cave: Drops from Patches if he's killed after pleading for mercy.Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Godrick Soldier Greaves
armors.description: Greaves worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted.Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
armors.lore:
Greaves worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
armors.how_to_acquire: Gatefront Ruins, dropped by Godrick Soldier patrolling the outpost

armors.name: Leyndell Soldier Greaves
armors.description: Greaves worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
armors.lore:
Greaves worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
armors.how_to_acquire: This helm and other pieces of the Leyndell Soldier Set can be looted as drops from the foot soldiers scattered around Altus Plateau, and Leyndell, Royal Capital.

armors.name: Mausoleum Greaves
armors.description: Greaves worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Museum.Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
armors.lore:
Greaves worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
armors.how_to_acquire: Mausoleum Soldier Set pieces drop from Mausoleum Soldiers. They can be found patrolling areas around some of the Wandering Mausoleums.An easy spot to farm this set is east of the East Gate Bridge Trestle site of grace in Liurnia of the Lakes. Several groups of 3 or 4 Mausoleum Soldiers are patrolling around this Wandering Mausoleum.

armors.name: Cuckoo Knight Greaves
armors.description: Greaves worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.Time has yet to dull their luster.
armors.lore:
Greaves worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped from Raya Lucaria Academy Knights, also referred to as Cuckoo Knights. There are three nearby to the East Raya Lucaria Gate site of grace.

armors.name: Leyndell Knight Greaves
armors.description: Greaves worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Time has yet to dull their luster.
armors.lore:
Greaves worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
armors.how_to_acquire: Dropped by Gold Dragon Cult Knights.

armors.name: Redmane Knight Greaves
armors.description: Black iron greaves worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side. Time has yet to dull their luster.
armors.lore: Black iron greaves worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side. Time has yet to dull their luster.
armors.how_to_acquire: Chance to drop from Radahn Knight in Fort Gael. Elden Ring Map here

armors.name: Mausoleum Knight Greaves
armors.description: Greaves worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.Time has yet to dull their luster.
armors.lore:
Greaves worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
armors.how_to_acquire: Mausoleum Knight Set pieces can be farmed from the Mausoleum Knights, typically found in Liurnia of the Lakes. The easiest one to farm is directly outside the Black Knife Catacombs entrance, which can be reset quickly with the site of grace.Other possible locations include: Near the Weeping Peninsula Walking Mausoleum.

armors.name: Haligtree Knight Greaves
armors.description: Greaves worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree.Time has yet to dull their luster.
armors.lore:
Greaves worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
armors.how_to_acquire: Haligtree Knights drop the Haligtree Knight Armor, Haligtree Knight Gauntlets, and Haligtree Knight Greaves. They can be found in the latter areas of Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree.

armors.name: Deathbed Smalls
armors.description: Skirt worn by Phia, the Deathbed Companion.
armors.lore: Skirt worn by Phia, the Deathbed Companion.
armors.how_to_acquire: Deathbed Smalls are apparently CUT CONTENT and cannot be found in-game

creatures.name: Black Knight
creatures.description: The Black Knights are the loyal servants of Messmer the Impaler. They don black iron helms decorated with gold and chest plates with golden Scadutree engravings, a small consolation for those forced into a graceless and dishonorable war. They emanate a rotten odor, possibly from the tainted blood splattered upon them, or from their own corrupted souls, decaying from endless slaughter.

creatures.name: Bigmouth Imp
creatures.description: Bigmouth Imps infest many of the catacombs in the Lands of Shadow. These creatures are adept at causing disturbances, moving nimbly like pests, and lurking around corners, ready to attack any trespassers who dare to enter their catacombs.

creatures.name: Jar Innards
creatures.description: For pity's sake, your place is in the jar. Nigh-sainthood itself awaits you within. For shamans like you, this is your lot. Life were you accorded for this alone." - Phantom in Bonny Village

creatures.name: Curseblade
creatures.description: These entities wield the Curseblade's Cirque in both hands, a backhand blade with wave-like cutting edges, sharpened into points that incite blood loss. Long ago, this was employed by the ascetics who strove to become tutelary deities as a ritualistic object in their self-flagellating dances. Their movements are almost dance-like, blending both elegance and lethality as they deliver their attacks. Their flashy combat style will leave their opponents disoriented and overwhelmed.

creatures.name: Golem Smith
creatures.description: These imposing constructs can be seen roaming around the ancient forges. They carry pots of lava on their heads, which they can hurl as projectiles. Their ability to withstand most attacks makes them very difficult to deal with. These beings also have a weakness, a red gem embedded in their backs can be seen and striking this weak spot can inflict critical damage.

creatures.name: Gravebird
creatures.description: Gravebirds are imposing ancient golems crafted to resemble their kin, the Deathbirds. These creatures soar through the air with stone wings and spout ghostflame. According to legend, Gravebirds were created to be kindred spirits to the Deathbirds, sharing a mysterious and sinister origin. Their primary purpose is to guard spiritgraves, the sacred resting places built to collect and contain the souls of all who have met their end.
locations: Common enemy that can be found in the overworld.

creatures.name: Shadowpot
creatures.description: Elusive shadow figures that carry pots over their heads. When confronted, they tend to flee. They are worth the effort to catch as defeating them often yields valuable materials or items.

creatures.name: Shadow Undead
creatures.description: These undead beings have their lost souls cursed to roam eternally, with their minds consumed by the curse, retaining only a fragment of their former selves. Some retain faint echoes of their past lives, occasionally displaying fleeting moments of hesitation or sorrow.

creatures.name: Spider Scorpion
creatures.description: Spider Scorpions blend the traits of both spiders and scorpions. These monstrous beings attack with powerful pincers and a venomous tail, delivering lethal blows to those who dare approach. Originally, this breed of scorpion was native to the realm of shadow and was significantly smaller in size. However, the recent emergence of these gigantic Spider Scorpions has been traced back to the Church of the Bud.

creatures.name: Man-Fly
creatures.description: These creatures were originally humans who suffered from a metamorphosing illness, transforming them into human-insect hybrids. The disease ravaged their peaceful villages, killing most of the population. The few who survived were turned into man-flies. The illness also appears to make the infected aggressive, causing them to attack on sight.

creatures.name: Horned Warrior
creatures.description: A fearsome adversary, easily recognizable by their distinctive appearance. Their helms feature a crown of sturdy tangled horns, allowing them to invoke divinity. Clad in plated armor and adorned with ochre fabric. These warriors are not only resilient, but also agile, as they combine brute strength with swift and deadly precision.

creatures.name: Fire Knight
creatures.description: Adorned in a pointed helm and armor featuring a red cape and twin golden snakes around the neck that enhances Messmer's flame incantations, each knight hails from a renowned family of the Erdtree's upper echelons. However, they were shunned and exiled from their homes after swearing loyalty to Messmer as their master.

creatures.name: Aging Untouchable
creatures.description: "I touched him, but only once. When he thrust his staff in my face, I brushed it aside. It was then that I touched him. The aging untouchable."

creatures.name: Bloodfiend
creatures.description: These creatures have towering figures, but their bodies are grotesquely transformed. Despite their terrifying appearance, they exhibit a strange behavior. They patrol their designated areas as if they're driven by a forgotten purpose.

creatures.name: Hippopotamus
creatures.description: These formidable beasts are reminiscent of the majestic Golden Hippopotamus, but lack the divine erdtree incantations that their golden counterparts possess. Instead, they rely solely on brute strength and aggressive nature to overpower their opponents.

creatures.name: Blue Worm
creatures.description: These creatures can easily be seen, with their sapphire-hued bodies protruding from the ground. They are harmless when left undisturbed.

creatures.name: Giant Beast Skeleton
creatures.description: These skeletal guardians are relentless in their patrols, being at the ready for intruders who dare trespass their domains.

creatures.name: Living Magma
creatures.description: These blazing entities embody the raw, untamed power of fire itself.

creatures.name: Inquisitor
creatures.description: These mages stand vigilant within the dimly lit catacombs of the Lands of Shadow.

creatures.name: Divine Bird Warrior
creatures.description: They are the very first of all horned warriors, donning helms of entwined horns and divine bird masks that enable the wearer to invoke divinity. Their armor, greaves, and gauntlets are crafted from golden metal. It is said that the golden-hued divine birds are known to be cruel, shunning human companionship. Few have ever succeeded in invoking their divine power.

creatures.name: Messmer Soldier
creatures.description: Loyal soldiers who serve Messmer the Impaler. These warriors don iron helms with visors. Their foreheads bear a Scadutree design etched in gold. They are clad in rusted chainmail covered by a ragged cloak, and their chestpieces also feature the Scadutree motif, also engraved with gold.

creatures.name: Shadow Militiamen
creatures.description: These small and agile warriors found their place amid the darkened ruins and cursed Lands of Shadow.

creatures.name: Messmer Foot Soldier
creatures.description: Base level soldiers, devoted followers of Messmer the Impaler.

creatures.name: Horned Shaman
creatures.description: These shamans remain stationary, cloaked in golden robes and giant horns protruding from their heads, with long white hair cascading down their backs. Their gaze spans great distances, ensuring that no one can approach unnoticed. They strike from afar, unleashing powerful spells upon any who dare intrude on the sacred grounds of Enir-Ilim.

creatures.name: Demi-Human Swordmaster
creatures.description: These small but formidable creatures are adept swordsmen, moving with nimble agility and striking their opponents with speed and precision. They can swiftly approach their opponents from behind to catch them off guard.

creatures.name: Putrescence Sorcerer
creatures.description: These malevolent mages cloaked in robes that reek of decay stand silently within their posts, ready to cast death sorceries upon intruders.

creatures.name: Shadow Commoner
creatures.description: Haunting figures found throughout the Lands of Shadow. Unlike their aggressive counterparts, these beings are often seen in a state of series stillness, either kneeling in silent prayer or just standing around in corners, lost in their own thoughts.

creatures.name: Warhawk
creatures.description: Stormhawks that have had their talons sliced off, so that razor-fine swords could be grafted in their place. They react with extreme aggression, using their mobility in combination with their deadly talons.
drops: 56 - 1039 Runes Warhawk's Talon Flight Pinion Stormhawk Feather

creatures.name: Boar
creatures.description: The Boars of Limgrave are less aggressive than normal, but should not be assumed to be passive

creatures.name: Crab
creatures.description: Only those of comfort and means know the truth: a crab's eggs are more delectable than its meat.
locations: Found near bodies of water in the Lands Between.
drops: 10 - 839 Runes Crab Eggs Strip of White Flesh

creatures.name: Deer
creatures.description: Deer roam freely in the plains on Limgrave, now that hunters have all but disappeared
locations: South West Liurnia of The Lakes
drops: 4 - 27 Runes Thin Animal Bones Sliver of Meat Beast Liver Budding Horn Beast Horn Empyrean-Blood Burgeon Dragon's Calorbloom Nectarblood Burgeon Spirit Calculus

creatures.name: Dog
drops: 52 - 1390 Runes Thin Beast Bones Beast Blood

creatures.name: Giant Dragonfly
locations: Near swampy areas in the Lands Between and Lands of Shadow

creatures.name: Putrid Corpse
creatures.description: Their movements are dull and confused... True death does not come easily for them.

creatures.name: Giant Crab
locations: Found anywhere near water in the Lands Between
drops: 318 - 4961 Runes Crab Eggs Strip of White Flesh

creatures.name: Owl
creatures.description: Nocturnal creatures, owls can often be seen perched on cliffsides, looking for preys.
locations: All across the Lands Between and Lands of Shadow
drops: 4 - 16 Runes Slumbering Egg Beast Horn Nectarblood Burgeon Spirit Calculus

creatures.name: Miranda Sprout
creatures.description: Sweet little carnivorous blossoms that feed upon human flesh. They creep slowly, scattering toxic pollen. They are vulnerable to fire.

creatures.name: Land Squirt
creatures.description: The firm, fleshy tubes of the creatures remain rooted to the spot, spraying poisonous liquid over their surroundings.

creatures.name: Giant Rat
creatures.description: [They] swarm upon their victims... These vermin seem to multiply incessantly.

creatures.name: Springhare
locations: Across the Lands Between and Lands of Shadow

creatures.name: Sheep
creatures.description: The wild sheep of the Lands Between have been roaming the wilds ever since The Shattering. They are timid and will often run away when spotted, with some even balling up and rolling away.
locations: Pastures throughout The Lands Between and Lands of Shadow

creatures.name: Skeletal Slime
drops: 16 - 613 Runes Glass Shard Thin Beast Bones Hefty Beast Bone

creatures.name: Spirit Jellyfish
creatures.description: Ethereal beings usually found near places of rest, acting as protectors. They are usually peaceful, but if angered, they attack with deadly poison fired from a distance.
drops: 14 - 569 Runes Grave Gloveworts Golden Rune [3] Trina's Lily

creatures.name: Teardrop Scarabs
creatures.description: These scarabs often roll clumps of valuable ashes of war during their labors, along with crimson and cerulean tears. They are very skittish, and will often flee when spotted.
creatures.lore:
There are both Crimson and Cerulean Teardrop Scarabs.
Defeat them to replenish the flasks that match their type.
However, you cannot replenish more flasks than your maximum amount allows.
locations: All across the Lands Between and Lands of Shadow

creatures.name: Turtle
creatures.description: Turtles are known as a nutritious ingredient, symbolic of inexhaustible power. However, those who hold turtles to be wise creatures consider the practice of eating their meat to be barbarous.

creatures.name: Lone Wolf
creatures.description: Lone Wolves roam the Lands Between in packs, overwhelming targets with their agility

creatures.name: Stray
creatures.description: ...Stray dog. ...Though it is only a small creature, it is as violent as it is nimble.
locations: All across the Lands Between and Lands of Shadow
drops: 52 - 1829 Runes Ruin Fragment Thin Beast Bones Beast Blood Sanctuary Stone Sacramental Bud

creatures.name: Bloody Finger Nerijus
creatures.description: If it isn't Nerijus, The Bloody Finger. The end is nigh. For you, and your cessblood. - Yura
locations: Invades on the ravine leading north-east from Agheel Lake, toward Murkwater Catacombs

creatures.name: Exile Soldier
creatures.description: ...Soldiers sent to the penal colonies, who were required to keep their faces hidden.
drops: Crescent Moon Axe Soldier's Crossbow Smithing Stones Stormhawk Feather Smoldering Butterfly Mushroom

creatures.name: Demi-Human
creatures.description: Demi-Humans are small in stature, but they have a violent, brutish disposition. Though they seem somewhat intelligent, when night falls, their blood boils and they become feral.

creatures.name: Golem
drops: 844 - 3927 Runes Golem's Halberd Golem Greatbow Great Arrow Golem's Great Arrow Golem's Magic Arrow Smithing Stones

creatures.name: Imp
creatures.description: These spirits are well suited to causing a disturbance, moving nimbly like pests and hurling magic pots.
locations: The rooftops of Leyndell Royal Capital
The pipes of the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds

creatures.name: Troll
creatures.description: The lesser giants who fought for the Erdtree during the War against the Giants long ago. Though the giants have lost their minds, they stay inseparable from their swords that are in sad shapesuch that the gold plating had flaked away.

creatures.name: Kaiden Sellsword
creatures.description: These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback. Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.
drops: Rowa Raisin Sweet Raisin Frozen Raisin

creatures.name: Godrick Soldier
creatures.description: The soldiers who serve Godrick the Grafted are what remains of the army that fled the royal capital of the Erdtree.

creatures.name: Skeletal Militiaman
creatures.description: Militiamen who live in Death, and will continue to rise again until properly finished off. This is the grotesque fate of those who come into contact with Deathroot.
locations: In the beaches and graveyards of the Lands Between

creatures.name: Skeletal Bandit
creatures.description: The remains of former bandits that will continue to rise again until properly finished off. After the night of the plot, Deathroot appeared in the Lands Between, and Those Who Live in Death soon followed.
locations: Dungeons and graveyards of the Lands Between
drops: Bandit's Curved Sword Human Bone Shard

creatures.name: Skeleton Mage
locations: Typically found in graveyards across the Lands Between

creatures.name: Living Jar
creatures.description: Though the jars are brought to life by human flesh and blood, they are all rather kindly folk. Perhaps they were made to be better than their innards. Their fragments command a high price due to the magical power locked within. This leaves the living jars unfortunate targets for poachers.

creatures.name: Lesser Alabaster Lord
creatures.description: A race of ancients with skin of stone who were said to have risen to life when a meteor struck long ago.

creatures.name: Misbegotten
creatures.description: The misbegotten are held to be a punishment for making contact with the Crucible, and from birth they are treated as slaves, or worse.

creatures.name: Wandering Nobles
creatures.description: Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead beings are the pitiful product of unending life. They are most commonly found struggling to maintain balance while roaming the fields of The Lands Between. Surely they were in search of something once - but whatever it was has long been forgotten.
locations: Near or around ruins that have fallen from the sky

creatures.name: Noble Sorcerer
creatures.description: Noble Sorcerers are frail old men wearing tattered garbs and a dirty yellow cape. They use a standard glintstone staff as both a sorcery catalyst and walking stick.

creatures.name: School of Graven Mages
creatures.description: The primeval current is a forbidden tradition of glintstone sorcery. To those who cleave to its teachings, the act of collecting sorcerers to fashion them into the seeds of stars is but another path of scientific inquiry.
locations: Various Towers across The Lands Between

creatures.name: Recusant Henricus
creatures.description: An invader serving the Volcano Manor, tasked with hunting down fellow Tarnished. His large mace can make quick of any unfortunate targets.

creatures.name: Lookout Stones
locations: Found near Evergaols, cemeteries, and specific points of interest.

creatures.name: Wild Mouflon
creatures.description: Wild Mouflons become hostile when threatened and fight their aggressors by charging forward and striking them with their large horns.

creatures.name: Lesser Runebear
locations: Open field areas, forests, and caves

creatures.name: Commoner
creatures.description: The boards that hang from their necks depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. A self imposed shackle, that displayed their allegiance to the Erdtree. ...Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

creatures.name: Banished Knight
creatures.description: Many knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

creatures.name: Flame Chariot
creatures.description: Beware the Fire Monks' chariots bearing the faces of giants. - Note: Flame Chariots

creatures.name: Fire Monk
creatures.description: The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants. The monks came to the land of Liurnia in pursuit of a fugitive who stole their fire.

creatures.name: Leyndell Knight
creatures.description: Knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. The golden canopy atop their helmets represent the honor of standing among the tree's defenders.

creatures.name: Marionette Soldier
creatures.description: Marionette soldiers were created to serve a sorcerer. On the verge of falling apart, they are illdisciplined and attack without warning.

creatures.name: Glintstone Sorcerer
creatures.description: Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars

creatures.name: Lazuli Sorcerer
creatures.description: Scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus study Carian sorceries - a heterodox pursuit that views the moon as equal to the stars.

creatures.name: Twinsage Sorcerer
creatures.description: Raya Lucaria sorcerers who wear a stone crown. T hose who study the Twinsage Conspectus are the academy's elite, capable of mastering the Glintstone Cometshard and Crystal Burst sorcereries.

creatures.name: Ancestral Follower
creatures.description: Horned folk who eschew letters and metalworking. The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

creatures.name: Clayman
creatures.description: The warped remains of priests who searched for revelation in service of the ancient dynasty, they employ two sorceries that produce smaller and larger bubbles.

creatures.name: Vulgar Militiamen
creatures.description: In the Lands Between, the small were scorned, and so they formed their vulgar militia as a means to make a living, albeit in ignominy. Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

creatures.name: Silver Tear
creatures.description: The Silver Tear makes mockery of life, reborn again and again into imitation. Perhaps, one day, it will be reborn a lord...

creatures.name: Fallen Hawks Soldier
creatures.description: When the band's last embers were used up in their long search, they began to burn the bones of their fellows, acquiring the cold ghostflame, but sealing their fate as dwellers of the underground for all eternity.

creatures.name: Crucible Knights
locations: All across the Lands Between and Lands of Shadow

creatures.name: Nox Swordstress
creatures.description: Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

creatures.name: Baleful Shadow
creatures.description: I turned my back on the Two Fingers and we each have been cursing the other since. The Baleful Shadows... are their assassins. - Miniature Ranni
creatures.lore:
Oh, it's you...
 It's me, Blaidd.
 Old Iji trapped me here.
 Told me I'd bring nought but bale to Lady Ranni.
 But there's no chance that could happen.
 I'm part of her being. Her very shadow...
 I thought old Iji knew as much...
 Honestly, I don't know what's going on anymore...

creatures.name: Mausoleum Knight
creatures.description: A self-inflicted curse ties the spirits of these loyal knights to the land, having willingly beheaded themselves so that they may serve their masters in death.

creatures.name: Highwayman
creatures.description: Former foot soldiers who have since turned to banditry. They ambush any who approach, wishing to take their valuables for themselves.

creatures.name: Azula Beastman
creatures.description: Beastmen from doomed Farum Azula, the slowly crumbling ruins in the skies. These ruins are said to be the remains of a giant mausoleum enshrining an ancient dragon, guarded by chosen beastmen who wield weapons clad in lightning.

creatures.name: Farum Azula Dragon
creatures.description: Ancestors of the modern dragons, the ancient dragons had scales of Gravel Stone and wielded lightning as their weapon. It is said that they once attacked Leyndell, the Royal Capital. Spoken of in legend, red lightning is the weapon wielded by the ancient dragons.
drops: Ancient Dragon Smithing Stone (Greater Farum Azula Dragons only) Gravel Stone x3 (respawning Lesser Farum Azula Dragon only) Runes (32,400, 21,600, or 14,400 depending on type)

creatures.name: Lesser Red Wolf of Radagon
creatures.description: Extremely large wolves with scarlet fur, often found as the alpha of their pack. It is capable of casting Magic Glintblades, using them along with their blistering speed.
locations: Liurnia of The Lakes Consecrated Snowfield Nokron, Eternal City

creatures.name: Mausoleum Soldier
creatures.description: ...Soldiers who confound foes by disappearing and reappearing at will. The mausoleum is where the bodies of soulless demigods are lain to rest, and these soldiers followed their masters into Death by severing their own heads from their bodies.

creatures.name: Battlemage
creatures.description: Whenever war broke out and the academy sealed its gates, only Haima's scholars dared venture outside. Seclusion is no way to foster discovery; it is only a convenient form of escape. Scholars of the Haima Conspectus sought the power to quell conflict, and to this end studied the sorceries of cannon fire and the gavel.

creatures.name: Celebrant
creatures.description: Dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

creatures.name: Crystal Snail
creatures.description: Snails with crystals growing from their shell. Normally found curled up within their shells blending in to their surroundings, will attack if provoked.

creatures.name: Glintstone Miner
creatures.description: The ever-working miners of the tunnels, tasked with harvesting crystals from deep beneath. Their staff allows them to summon a drill to shatter rock and enemies alike.

creatures.name: Avionette Soldier
creatures.description: Marionette soldiers with avian features that were created to serve a sorcerer. Equipped with long-hafted scythes and swords, they also attack from the skies by lobbing fire pots. Can sometimes malfunction when damaged

creatures.name: Albinauric
creatures.description: Albinaurics are lifeforms made by human hands. Thus, many believe them to live impure lives, untouched by the Erdtree's grace.

creatures.name: Revenant
creatures.description: A grotesque amalgamation of limbs, the Revenant is a creature with the body structure of an arachnid and the face of a human. Much like a spider, it possesses many limbs that seem to have been grafted onto its body, taken from diseased humans. The Revenant is capable of traveling through portals it creates with a peculiar form of magic, swiftly emerging behind a foe to catch them off guard.

creatures.name: Lesser Mad Pumpkin Head
creatures.description: Though he has stifled his panic within the dark confines of his helmet, he rampages as if driven mad when agitated by bloodshed or the humming of insects. This mad soldier is all that is left of a broken gladiator.

creatures.name: Grafted Scion
locations: All across the Lands Between and Lands of Shadow

creatures.name: Perfumer
creatures.description: In time past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives

creatures.name: Blackflame Monk
creatures.description: The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

creatures.name: Chief Guardian Arghanthy
locations: Guardian's Garrison , in Mountaintops of the Giants

creatures.name: Anastasia, Tarnished-Eater
creatures.description: The knife-wielding Ogress Anastasia, known to have eaten countless Tarnished while disguised as a Finger Maiden.

creatures.name: Great Horned Tragoth
creatures.description: Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

creatures.name: Guardian
creatures.description: In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that  their deaths lead not to destruction, but instead to renewed. eternal life as guardians.
locations: Minor Erdtrees across the Lands Between

creatures.name: Lesser Black Knife Assassin
creatures.description: The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

creatures.name: Page
creatures.description: ...Pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way. Uses a piercing sword and crossbow to defend [their] master.

creatures.name: Lesser Bloodhound Knight
creatures.description: The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

creatures.name: Moongrum, Carian Knight
creatures.description: The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family. Despite numbering fewer than twenty, their power made them a match for even the champions of gold in battle

creatures.name: Lesser Kindred of Rot (Pests)
creatures.description: Pale pests who crawl through the lands afflicted by scarlet rot; the abandoned children of the goddess. "Rot for the scarlet goddess. O scarlet blossoms, flourish in distant lands, and return to us, the unwanted children."

creatures.name: Raya Lucaria Foot Soldier
creatures.description: Foot Soldiers usually guarding camps and ruins with their fellow Soldiers, they wander around the Raya Lucaria Academy located within Liurnia of the Lakes.

creatures.name: Leyndell Foot Soldier
creatures.description: ...Foot Soldiers protecting the royal capital of Leyndell.

creatures.name: Radahn Foot Soldier
creatures.description: Base level soldiers, serving General Radahn's army.

creatures.name: Mausoleum Foot Soldier
creatures.description: ...Headless foot soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

creatures.name: Haligtree Foot Soldier
creatures.description: ...Common soldiers who carry the sacred light. When weakened, they explode to deliver a last-ditch attack. This was the bitter revelation discovered by the desperate soldiers who awaited the return of their lord to the rotted Haligtree. May the flash of our deaths guide Miquella's return.

creatures.name: Starcaller
creatures.description: Scavengers desperately digging around craters found in the wake of meteorite strikes, they dub themselves Starcallers.

creatures.name: Thorn Sorcerer
creatures.description: The guilty, their eyes gouged by thorns, lived in eternal darkness. There, they discovered the blood star.

creatures.name: Oracle Envoy
creatures.description: Monstrous band of musicians who employ sacred arts. It is said that when Oracle Envoys appear playing their pipes, they do so to herald the arrival of a new god, or age.

creatures.name: Putrid Corpse
creatures.description: Their movements are dull and confused... True death does not come easily for them.

creatures.name: Haligtree Knight
creatures.description: Knights who have vowed to serve Miquella's Haligtree. They are skilled in using both magical and holy skills, loyally protecting the rotted Haligtree to the very end.

creatures.name: Haligtree Soldier
creatures.description: Loyal Soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. While rather unimpressive on their own, they are often found in large groups, using numbers to their advantage.

creatures.name: Leyndell Soldier
creatures.description: The soldiers of Leyndell fight their battles defensively. During the Shattering, they were the ramparts that fortified the royal capital.

creatures.name: Radahn Soldier
creatures.description: General Radahn's soldiers were all reputed to be masterful warriors, and it was popularly said that the Redmanes knew no weakness.

creatures.name: Redmane Knight
creatures.description: Knights who fought by General Radahn's side. Their red plumes is a symbol of Radahn's pedigree as Lord Radagon's son - the mane of the proud Red Lion.

creatures.name: Albinauric Archer
creatures.description: These warrior Albinaurics have weak legs, which makes them unable to walk. Thus, they rely on their archery to take down opponents. Those found riding Direwolves are a force to be reckoned with.

creatures.name: Ancestral Follower Shaman
creatures.description: The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

creatures.name: Cuckoo Knight
creatures.description: Knights, named for the cuckoo feather on their helmets, who faithfully serve the Academy of Raya Lucaria, and were given free rein to wage war as they please. Like their masters, they use various sorceries for combat, but they are more skilled in melee combat.

creatures.name: Depraved Perfumer
creatures.description: These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

creatures.name: Duelist
creatures.description: Former gladitorial fighters who were exiled from the colloseum. They wield chain axes and hammers, and attack with a frenzied fervor.

creatures.name: Edgar the Revenger
creatures.description: ...Ahh the poor fellow... Gone perfectly mad. Love... Revenge....the frenzied flame melts it all away... - Spirit
creatures.lore:
Ah, there's a face I've not seen before.
 I'm Edgar, warden of this castle as ordained by Lord Godrick himself.
 But you can see how things have turned out.
 The menials have all rebelled.
 They gave me good service, or so I thought,
but it seems it was all an act.
 Foul creatures, as it's said.
And true enough they're foul inside and out.
 I'm sorry to disappoint you,
 But whatever you've come here to do,
I'm afraid Castle Morne won't hold much longer.
 Take this, by way of apology.
locations: Revenger's Shack , Liurnia of the Lakes

creatures.name: Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm
creatures.description: A silent seeker of sorcery, who had gone so far as to make contact with the primeval current, Wilhelm was led by guidance into confrontation with his friend Vargram, and it is said that he was then taken prisoner in Roundtable Hold.

creatures.name: Fire Prelate
creatures.description: The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."
locations: near entrance of Giants' Mountaintop Catacombs

creatures.name: High Page
creatures.description: Strong and dexterous servants of the Nobility, commited to keep them out of harm's way. Specially compared with their common counterparts.

creatures.name: Inquisitor Ghiza
creatures.description: A menacing agent of the Volcano Manor, wielding a colossal weapon of torture.

creatures.name: Juno Hoslow, Knight of Blood
creatures.description: Juno Hoslow had a younger brother who was all talk and no trousers. His inability to commit to action was such that Juno inherited the Hoslow legacy without resistance, granting him the freedom to shower his little brother with adoration.

creatures.name: Knight of Zamor
creatures.description: These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

creatures.name: Lesser Burial Watchdog
creatures.description: The Watchdogs, battered and broken over their lengthy tenure, rule the catacombs and are even said to command the imps

creatures.name: Lesser Fingercreeper
locations: Caria Manor Liurnia of the Lakes

creatures.name: Mad Tongue Alberich
creatures.description: Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

creatures.name: Maleigh Marais, Shaded Castle Castellan
creatures.description: The sons of House Marais are all sickly born. Little wonder that Maleigh Marais would be so beguiled by the beautiful and fierce goddess who was born into rot.
locations: Fields west of The Shaded Castle

creatures.name: Man-Serpent
creatures.description: It is said that long ago, the elder serpent that dwelled on Mt. Gelmir devoured a demigod, and the birth of the man-serpents followed.

creatures.name: Nameless White Mask
creatures.description: Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varre, that is; but he was an exception.

creatures.name: Night Maiden
creatures.description: Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

creatures.name: Nomad
creatures.description: A member of a tribe that was entombed in the earth so as to bury the maddening disease that followed them. Able to emit the terrible flame of frenzy from his eyes, but has low HP and is frail, unable to take much in the way of punishment.

creatures.name: Nox Monk
creatures.description: Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

creatures.name: Nox Swordstress
creatures.description: Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

creatures.name: Old Knight Istvan
creatures.description: Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

creatures.name: Preceptor Miriam
creatures.description: One of the magic preceptors that served the Carian royals

creatures.name: Raya Lucaria Soldier
creatures.description: The soldiers of Raya Lucaria were also known as the Cuckoos. They were given free rein by the academy to wage war as they pleased, and they were infamous for their rapacious ways.

creatures.name: Rileigh the Idle
creatures.description: There was a time when Tarnished who had strayed from guidance feared nothing more than utter silence.

creatures.name: Troll Knight
creatures.description: Called into service when the Queen invoked an oath they swore, the trolls are treated as true knights of Caria, and fight arm in arm with their human comrades.

creatures.name: Vargram the Raging Wolf
creatures.description: One of the first Tarnished to arrive at the Roundtable, Vargram was named after the white wolf pelt on his helm. According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean. Vargram aspired to such a state himself.

creatures.name: Lesser Crystalian
creatures.description: The inscrutable Crystalians have but one clear purpose; to safeguard their crystals unto the end. One theory posits that they yearn for the return of their creator who will carve for them new brethren.

creatures.name: Lesser Cemetery Shade
creatures.description: Insect-ridden grave keepers.

creatures.name: Lesser Dragon
creatures.description: The dragons that escaped the scarlet rot and made nest of the plateau to Caelid's north. Thus it was named "Dragonbarrow," and none dare to enter.

creatures.name: Lesser Cleanrot Knight
creatures.description: The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

creatures.name: Magnus the Beast Claw
drops: Furlcalling Finger Remedy Rune Arc Great Stars Somber Smithing Stone (6)

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Storm Stomp
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill: "Storm Stomp: One of the skills that channel the tempests of Stormveil. Stomp hard on the ground to kick up a momentary storm." Usable on all melee armaments.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Repeating Thrust
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill: "Repeating Thrust: Twist to build power, then unleash a flurry of thrusts." Usable on armaments capable of thrusting (colossal weapons excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Gravitas
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill: "Gravitas: Skill originating from the Alabaster Lords, who had skin of stone. Thrust the armament into the ground to create a gravity well. In addition to dealing damage, this attack pulls enemies in." Usable on melee armaments (small armaments and whips excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Stamp (Sweep)
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill: "Stamp (Sweep): Brace armament and step into a low stance that prevents recoil from most enemy attacks. Follow up with a strong attack for a sweeping strike." Usable on swords, axes, and hammers (small and medium swords excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Unsheathe
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill: "Unsheathe: Skill of swordsmen from the Land of Reeds. Sheathe blade, holding it at the hip in a composed stance. Follow up with a normal or strong attack to perform a swift slash attack." Usable on katana.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Mighty Shot
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill: "Mighty Shot: Archery skill performed from an oblique stance. Ready the bow, then pull the bowstring to its limit to enhance the power of the shot, penetrating the enemy's guard." Usable on light bows and longbows.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Golden Vow
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill: "Golden Vow: Skill passed down from antiquity among the knights of the capital. Raise armament aloft and pledge to honor the Erdtree in battle, granting self and nearby allies increased attack power and defense." Usable on all melee armaments.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Sacred Blade
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill: "Sacred Blade: Grants armament's attacks holy essence and fires off a golden blade projectile. The armament retains its holy essence for a while." Usable on melee armaments (whips, fists, and claws excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Stamp (Upward Cut)
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill: "Stamp (Upward Cut): Brace armament and step into a low stance that prevents recoil from most enemy attacks. Follow up with a strong attack for an upward strike." Usable on swords, axes, and hammers (small and medium swords excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Kick
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill: "Kick: Push an enemy back with a high kick. Effective against enemies who are guarding, and can break a foe's stance. Sometimes a simple tool is the most effective." Usable on all melee armaments.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Endure
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill: "Endure: Assume an anchored stance to brace for incoming attacks, briefly boosting poise. Damage taken while using this skill is reduced." Usable on all melee armaments.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: War Cry
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill: "War Cry: Give a war cry to rally the spirit and increase attack power. While active, strong attacks change to charging attacks." Usable on melee armaments (daggers, thrusting swords, and whips excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Spinning Slash
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill: "Spinning Slash: Skill favored by dexterous warriors. Slash foes as your body spins. Additional input allows for a follow-up attack." Usable on swords, axes, and polearms (colossal weapons excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Impaling Thrust
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill: "Impaling Thrust: Skill that lets piercing armaments overcome enemy shields. Build power, then lunge forward for a strong thrust that pierces an enemy's guard." Usable on armaments capable of thrusting (colossal weapons excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Quickstep
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill: "Quickstep: Skill prized by the crafty and fleet of foot. Perform a quickstep maneuver that allows for circling around lock-on targets." Usable on all melee armaments. sideways
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Storm Blade
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill: "Storm Blade: Lost skill of Stormveil. Surround armament with shearing storm winds that can be fired forward. Can be fired in rapid succession." Usable on swords (colossal weapons and twinblades excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Parry
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill: "Parry: Use this skill in time with a foe's melee attack to deflect it and break that foe's stance. This provides an opening to perform a critical hit." Usable on daggers, curved swords, thrusting swords, fists, claws, and small and medium shields.
ashes_of_war.lore:
This Ash of War grants an armament
the Skill: Parry.

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: No Skill
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament and replaces any skill present with the following: "No Skill: This armament has no skill. If the armament in the other hand has a skill, that skill will be used instead." Usable on shields and torches.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament and replaces any skill present with the following:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Glintstone Pebble
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill: "Glintstone Pebble: Skill that employs the glintstone sorcery of the same name. Follow up with a strong attack to chain this skill into a lunging thrust, performed while the armament is still imbued with glintstone." Usable on swords as well as polearms capable of thrusting (colossal weapons excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Spinning Weapon
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill: "Spinning Weapon: Defensive skill employed by Carian princesses. Lifts armament into mid-air, then makes it spin violently. Those it touches will suffer successive attacks." Usable on small and medium swords, axes, and hammers, as well as polearms and staves (great spears excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Wild Strikes
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill: "Wild Strikes: Swing armament with wild abandon. Hold to continue swinging. Can be followed up with a normal or strong attack." Usable on axes and hammers as well as curved swords and greatswords (colossal weapons excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Storm Wall
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill: "Storm Wall: Swing the shield to create a wall of storm winds in front of you, deflecting arrows and other such physical projectiles. Can also be used in the same way as a regular parry." Usable on small and medium shields.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Bloody Slash
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Blood affinity and the following skill: "Bloody Slash: Blood Oath skill granted by the Lord of Blood. From a low stance, coat the blade in your own blood to unleash a rending blood slash in a wide arc." Usable on swords (colossal weapons excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Blood affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Ground Slam
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill: "Ground Slam: Jump up high into the air and crash down on the ground ahead. The resulting pratfall sends a powerful shockwave in all directions." Usable on all melee armaments.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Spectral Lance
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Occult affinity and the following skill: "Spectral Lance: Skill of the headless Mausoleum Knights. Hurl a phantasmic spear at foes." Usable on polearms (reapers not included).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Occult affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Charge Forth
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill: "Charge Forth: Quickly charge forward with the armament at the hip, carrying the momentum into a thrust. Hold to cover a greater distance." Usable on polearms capable of thrusting, heavy thrusting swords, and twinblades.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Square Off
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill: "Square Off: This skill starts with the sword held level. Follow up with a normal attack to slash upwards through enemy's guard, or a strong attack to perform a running thrust." Usable on straight swords.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Sacred Order
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill: "Sacred Order: Skill of the Golden Order fundamentalist knights. Perform a salute and grant the armament holy essence. Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death." Usable on all melee armaments.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Lifesteal Fist
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Occult affinity and the following skill: "Lifesteal Fist: Skill that demonstrates mastery of the art of controlling vital energies. A slow, controlled punch with an energy-infused fist that renders foes unconscious and steals their HP. Only effective against foes of human build." Usable on fists and claws.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Occult affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Barrage
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill: "Barrage: Archery skill using a bow held horizontally. Ready the bow, then fire off a rapid succession of shots faster than the eye can see." Usable on light bows.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Prayerful Strike
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill: "Prayerful Strike: Raise armament aloft in prayer, then slam it into the ground. This inspired blow restores HP to the self and nearby allies if it successfully hits." Usable on axes and hammers.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Lightning Slash
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Lightning affinity and the following skill: "Lightning Slash: Call down a bolt of lightning into armament, then swing it down to create an explosive shock. The armament retains the lightning enchantment for a while." Usable on swords, axes, and hammers.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Lightning affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Giant Hunt
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill: "Giant Hunt: Skill developed for confronting gigantic foes. Step forward from a low stance, carrying the momentum into a sudden upward thrust." Usable on large and colossal weapons capable of thrusting, spears, and twinblades.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Sword Dance
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill: "Sword Dance: Quickly close in to perform a series of spinning upward slashes. Follow up with an additional input to finish with a downward slash." Usable on swords, axes, and polearms capable of slashing (colossal weapons and great spears excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Vow of the Indomitable
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill: "Vow of the Indomitable: Skill of the ancient warriors of the Erdtree. Hold shield aloft to imbue yourself with golden power, granting momentary invincibility." Usable on all shields.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Beast's Roar
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill: "Beast's Roar: Unleash a beastly roar, rending the air as a forward-traveling projectile." Usable on all melee armaments.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Carian Grandeur
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill: "Carian Grandeur: Carian royal prestige embodied in a skill. Transform blade into a magical greatsword and swing it down. Can be charged to increase its power by up to two levels." Usable on swords (colossal weapons excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Loretta's Slash
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill: "Loretta's Slash: Skill of Loretta the Royal Knight. Leap forward, imbuing the blade with glintstone, then descend, accelerating into a sweeping slash." Usable on polearms and twinblades.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Hoarfrost Stomp
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Cold affinity and the following skill: "Hoarfrost Stomp: Stomp hard to spread a trail of freezing mist on the ground. The mist applies the frost status effect." Usable on all melee armaments.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Cold affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Thops's Barrier
ashes_of_war.description: This is the page for the Ash of War: Thop's Barrier. Click here for the sorcery Thops's Barrier (Spell) This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill: "Thops's Barrier: Erect a magical forcefield while swinging the shield to deflect sorceries and incantations. Can also be used in the same way as a regular parry." Usable on small and medium shields.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Chilling Mist
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Cold affinity and the following skill: "Chilling Mist: Coat armament in frost, and then slash, spreading frigid mist forwards. The armament retains its frost for a while." Usable on melee armaments (whips, fists, and claws excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Cold affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Lightning Ram
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Lightning affinity and the following skill: "Lightning Ram: Skill inspired by tumbling rams. Let out a bleat, then tumble forwards, clad in lightning. Tumbles can be repeated in rapid succession." Usable on all melee armaments.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Lightning affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Lion's Claw
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill: "Lion's Claw: Skill of the Redmanes, who fought alongside General Radahn. Somersault forwards, striking foes with armament." Usable on swords, axes, and hammers (small armaments and thrusting swords not included).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Flaming Strike
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Fire affinity and the following skill: "Flaming Strike: Skill that emits flame in a wide frontward arc. Follow up with a strong attack to perform a lunging, sweeping strike. This will also coat the armament in fire." Usable on melee armaments (colossal weapons and whips excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Fire affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Determination
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill: "Determination: A knightly skill. Hold the flat of the armament to your face and pledge your resolve, powering up your next attack." Usable on all melee armaments.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Lost Ashes of War
ashes_of_war.description: Empty ashes of war, devoid of any memories of battle. Unable to apply any kind of affinity in their current state, but can be used by Smithing Master Hewg of the Roundtable Hold to recreate other ashes. Thus does the copy pass into becoming the genuine article.
ashes_of_war.lore: Empty ashes of war, devoid of any memories of battle.
ashes_of_war.skill: Used to duplicate Ashes of War

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Glintblade Phalanx
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill: "Glintblade Phalanx: Skill used by the enchanted knights who served the Carian royal family. Form an arch of magic glintblades overhead, which will attack foes automatically. Follow up with a strong attack to chain this skill into a lunging thrust." Usable on swords as well as polearms capable of thrusting (colossal weapons excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Poison Moth Flight
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Poison affinity and the following skill: "Poison Moth Flight: Slash with a poison-infused blade. If the follow-up strike lands on a poisoned foe, it will deal significant damage." Usable on small and medium swords (twinblades excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Poison affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Poisonous Mist
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Poison affinity and the following skill: "Poisonous Mist: Bathe armament in poison, and then slash, spreading toxic mist forwards. The armament retains its poison for a while." Usable on melee armaments (whips, fists, and claws excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Poison affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Sacred Ring of Light
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill: "Sacred Ring of Light: Skill used by the commanders of the Cleanrot Knights. Gather a sacred ring of light in the armament, and then fire it forwards. Can be fired in rapid succession." Usable on polearms (great spears excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Eruption
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Fire affinity and the following skill: "Eruption: Skill of the knights who serve at Volcano Manor. Slam armament into the ground, spawning roiling lava which spouts up upon release." Usable on large and colossal swords, axes, and hammers.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Fire affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Assassin's Gambit
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Occult affinity and the following skill: "Assassin's Gambit: Skill that masks the user's presence at the cost of a self-inflicted wound. Grants near-invisibility and silences footsteps." Usable on small and medium straight swords and thrusting swords.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Occult affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Seppuku
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Blood and the following skill: "Seppuku: A forbidden technique used by swordsmen from the Land of Reeds. Plunge the blade into your stomach to stain it with blood. Increases attack power and improves ability to inflict blood loss." Usable on swords as well as polearms capable of thrusting (small and colossal weapons not included).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Blood affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Black Flame Tornado
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Flame affinity and the following skill: "Black Flame Tornado: Spin armament overhead and then plunge it into the ground to summon a raging vortex of black flames. Hold to create an initial flame tornado while spinning the armament." Usable on polearms and twinblades.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Flame Art affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Hoarah Loux's Earthshaker
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy and the following skill: "Hoarah Loux's Earthshaker: Slam both hands onto the ground to violently shake the earth and unleash a shockwave. Follow up with an additional input to slam the ground again." Usable on all melee armaments.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Enchanted Shot
ashes_of_war.description: This ash of war grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill: "Enchanted Shot: Archery skill that enlivens the arrow with spiritual essence. The resulting shot will fly faster than regular shots and change its trajectory to follow the target." Usable on light bows and longbows.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Barricade Shield
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill: "Barricade Shield: Skill made famous by Sir Neidhardt. Focus your energy into the shield, temporarily hardening it to deflect greater blows." Usable on all shields.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Golden Land
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill: "Golden Land: Thrust armament into the ground, then gather strength to unleash a blast of sacred energy that coalesces into golden darts. Follow up with a strong attack to swing the armament in a sweeping strike." Usable on greataxes, warhammers, and colossal weapons.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Carian Retaliation
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill: "Carian Retaliation: Swing the shield to dispel incoming sorceries and incantations, transforming the magic into retaliatory glintblades. Can also be used in the same way as a regular parry." Usable on small and medium shields.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Waves of Darkness
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill: "Waves of Darkness: Plunge armament into the ground to release three waves of darkness. Follow up with a strong attack to swing the armament in a sweeping strike." Usable on greataxes, warhammers, and colossal weapons.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Ice Spear
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Cold affinity and the following skill: "Ice Spear: Skill of the warriors who served Lunar Princess Ranni. Spin armament to release cold magic, then channel it into a piercing spear of ice." Usable on polearms capable of thrusting and twinblades.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Cold affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Double Slash
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill: "Double Slash: Skill of superior swordsmen. Perform a crossing slash attack from a low stance. Repeated inputs allow for up to two follow-up attacks." Usable on swords and polearms capable of slashing (colossal weapons excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Vacuum Slice
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill: "Vacuum Slice: Lost skill of ancient heroes. Hold the armament aloft to surround it with a shearing vacuum, then launch it forwards as a blade-like projectile." Usable on swords and axes (colossal axes excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Stormcaller
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill: "Stormcaller: One of the skills that channel the tempests of Stormveil. Spin armament to create surrounding storm winds. Repeated inputs allow for up to two follow-up attacks." Usable on swords capable of slashing, axes, hammers, and polearms (small and colossal weapons excepted).
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Piercing Fang
ashes_of_war.description: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill: "Piercing Fang: Skill used by Yura, the Bloody Finger Hunter. Starting with the blade held horizontally, make a powerful thrust that cannot be blocked." Usable on medium and large armaments capable of thrusting.
ashes_of_war.lore: This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

ashes_of_war.name: Ash of War: Blood Tax
